text: you can fuck up easy with blueberry or you can make something beautiful. they seem to know everything about stout in Marshall MI, dont they? Seriously cant wait to get up there. love this brewers beers period. because they are great.

(Bottle) Pours black with a small, foamy brown head. Aroma of blueberry and dark chocolate. Medium body. Flavor is moderately sweet and bitter; blueberry; woody notes; peat. Warming alcohol noticeable.

Bottle (bb 2015?) shared at Beertemple, Amsterdam. Pours dark with almost no head. Still lots of blueberries in the aroma, chocolate, roasted malts, coffee. Taste is moderate sweet and bitter, soft mouthfeel and carbonation. Chocolate aftertaste. Nice.
On tap at Crunchys. Lots of blueberry and coffee in the aroma. Smooth and not overly sweet.

Really nice blueberry compote aroma with strong roasted malts and some star anise too. After the beer has warmed, smoked wood aromas appear, and the star anise becomes stronger. Taste is bitter dark chocolate, charred roasted malts, blueberry, subtle star anise, and hops. It ends with a nice dry finish and a bitter aftertaste. After warming, the charred malts strengthen, with a root beer like flavor too. All another flavors are still present.

A solid stout. Pours a beautiful deep brown-black with a thick brown head. Smells of oatmeal and blueberry. Taste is oatmeal upfront, with some milk stout, and a bit of blueberry in the finish. Had in the bottle.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
33 cl bottle - Very smooth and full of fruit. I liked this in particular. Will love to try this one again someday.

Tap at Gambrinus. Pours a deep brown to black with a finger of beige foam that dissipates quickly. Blueberry nose with a touch of cacao nib. Slightly roasty and sweet milk chocolate on the palate, but not overly so. Cacao nib and faint blueberry skins add a little roast and dryness. Really well-balanced. Diggin it.

Spéciale mais très bien foutue.
Le nez sent pas mal le chocolat, un fond caramel et la rondeur du fruit.
En bouche, on a une attaque très torréfiée, boisée, quasiment fumée. Un peu dérangeant mais vite coupé par une sacrée finale hyper fruitée et gourmande. La longueur rééquilibre bien les deux.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Vigorous pour results in a two finger dark tan head that disappear almost immediately. Slight oily bluish hue at the edge of the glass. Nose is roasty with the blueberry on top. The blueberry is at the forefront of the taste as well, with bitter and chocolate present as well. Its not bad, but I wouldnt go out of my way to try it again.

Black color with a tall milk-chocolate thick creamy-appearing head, receding very slowly. Aroma of roasted malts, roasted coffee, ... IOW, smoked/roasted is the dominant aroma with barely a hint of berries underneath. Thick-ish feel, but not a lot of carbonation; has an almost flat feel. Initial taste is smokey with (as with the aroma) just the faintest hint of berry. Bitter hops appear in the middle and linger into the finish. I have to admit, I was aprehensive about a blueberry stout, but I also have to admit that I am a bit disappointed with how subdued the berry is in both the aroma and the taste. Also, the brewer claims 20 IBU, but there is more bittering than that rating would imply. Overall, a middle of the road stout with not enough berry to validate the name.

Deep opaque black, big tan head. Ripe blueberry, dark chocolate, dark roasted coffee. Some very light toffee and caramel. Quite bitter. Dry. Heavier body, fairly thick mouthfeel. A bit of oil. Long finish. Good.

Bottle from Growlers to Go - Richmond. Pours thick and black with a small dark brown head. Aroma is overwhelmingly blueberry along with some coffee and chocolates underneath. Flavor is chocolate, coffee, blueberry, salt. Hmmm... wasnt sure what to expect, but this is good without being sickeningly sweet.

Bottle, 355 ml, from Beergium. Shared with JFK10000 and Josip. Pours dark brown with small brown head. Light roastiness, lots of blueberries, some chocolate. Lively carbonation. Light to moderate sweet and bitter. Not so easy to drink. Medium bodied.

Bottle. Thanks to trade. Nose is very berry forward chocolate. Like fruity pebbles with cocoa. Small khaki head. Taste is very chocolate forward. Light to moderate berry. Light alcohol warming. Overall average to good. Maybe better.

UPDATED: NOV 3, 2016 Donkerzwart bier met mokkakleurige schuimkraag die langzaamaan wegebt. Aroma is blauwe bes, beetje espresso, maar ook een beetje muffig. Maar de smaak maakt dit méér dan goed. Eerst proef je letterlijk blauwe bessen cake en dan komt er een heerlijk (koffie)bittertje overheen om dan te eindigen in een mild-zoet/bittere afdronk die lang blijft. TOPstout.

Bottle from Dranken Geers, Oostakker, Nr Gent, Belgie consumed at home with Craig and Stella, Wednesday 10th August 2016   This is really good, it is very fruity though I wouldnt necessarily have known that it was Blueberry. Tangy, really nice mouthfeel its pretty good. A7 A4 T8 P4 OV15 3.7
This is a treat... Roommate brought a bottle back from Chicago...dark black pour with dark brown head..nice creamy chocolate..light blueberry aroma..taste is same.. Love it
Thick black pour. Had blueberry pancake with chocolate chips and a cup of coffee type taste, worked very well. Maybe a tad sweet but very good.

Blueberry , raisin, and burned cookie nose. Black viscous pour, medium tan head. Raisin, charred oak, smoke, blueberry. Medium body, moderate carbonation. I have not had a blueberry stout that I liked, until now. This was very well done.

Clear blueberry flavor with coffee and chocolate. Dark coffee, dark chocolate and blueberries taste. Heavy bitterness that fills the mouth forever. The taste is also good balanced between sweetness and bitterness. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Draft. Pours black. Aroma and taste are chocolate, roasted malts, and blueberry.
Bottle from ?. Dark brown/black colour, brown foam. Nose of roasted malts, coffee, berries. Sweet but also roasty and bitter. Interesting stout. Good!

On tap at Brunzies. Great blueberry aroma, fresh fruit. Chocolate, coffee, roasted malt. Dark black opaque with thin tan head. Medium-heavy body with medium carbonation. Starts sweet with chocolate, molasses, and a ton of fresh blueberry notes. Berry flavor throughout, with sweet finish and smooth sweet chocolate-berry after.

Pours black with a moderate, long lasting brown head. Really nice aroma, well balanced with notes of blueberries, roasted malt, sweet. Flavor has a light to moderate bitterness with notes of blueberries, roasted malt, light chocolate, burnt wood. Nice!
Bottle. Black colour. Blueberry chocolate aroma. Sweet chocolate taste, blueberry finish

Kolor:  Czarny jak bezgwiezdna noc. Kompletnie nieprześwitujący. 
 Piana:  Początkowo bardzo bujna w cholernie ciemnym beżowym odcieniu.
Dość szybko niestety opadła do znacznej otoczki.
Pojedyńcze zdobienia na Tulipie. 
 Zapach:  Coś nieprawdopodobnego! Jeszcze takiego intensywnego zapachu leśnych borówek nie czułem w żadnym piwie. Prócz tego cała plejada czekoladowych odnośników i lekka paloność. W tle delikatne owoce cytrusowe.
 Smak:  W ogromnej mierze zdominowany przez amerykańske borówki. Smak jest tak sugestywny, że chwilami mam wrażenie jakby całe ich owoce zanurzone były w butelce. Niesamowite uczucie.
Fioletowy owoc wspiera w smaku bardzo solidna kwaskowata kawa i gorzka czekolada.
Stout ma również palony charakter i nawet minimalne sugestie dymnej wędzonki.
Goryczka palona, średniej maści z wytrawnym finiszem. Jagodowa cierpkość jeszcze przez jakiś czas odczuwalna jest na podniebieniu.
Świetna pijalność, ale nie sesyjność. 
 Wysycenie:  Niskie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Bardzo udany produkt w kategorii ciekawostki piwowarskiej.
Niesamowicie zdominowany w smaku i aromacie przez borówki amerykańskie.
Tak intensywnego jagodowego, czy też borówkowego smaku i aromatu nie odnalazłem jeszcze w żadnym piwie.
Ciekawostką jest fakt, że piwo ma dość wytrawny charakter.
Wspomagają go nuty kawy, paloności, subtelnej wędzonki czy gorzkiej czekolady.
Oryginalnie i smacznie.
On tap at Olgod. Black colour with tan head. Roasted, fruity aroma. Roasted, fruity, blueberry, sweet, chocolate taste. Medium body.

Bottle from Beergium. Black color, brown head. Bitter taste with roasted malts, coffee, blueberries, nuts, licorice and a bit of chocolate. Bitter finish with roasted malts, blueberries, nuts, licorice and coffee. Exquisite stout.

Blueberries in the aroma and finish make for its dominant taste (uh, duh!, it is a blueberry stout) but there are other factors at work. Theres a smokiness on the finish that also comes with sourness, dryness and oakiness (or something that suggests barrel resting). Very different and most enjoyable. Poured from a bottle.

Tap at Erzbierschof Zurich. Intense coffee roast aromas with strong blueberries. Both are dominant throughout and in good harmony. Bitter and strong, yet not heavy. Pleasant soft carbonation leading to a blueberry explosion in a lingering finish. Very well done!
Dark brown full-bodied beer with good sized tan head, malt/berry aroma. Taste is of roasted malt and coffee with blueberry undertone. Lingering finish has liquorice and berry to it.
Black with small tan head. Roast and chocolate aroma with something fruity or berrylike - could be blueberries. Fruity, mild roast flavour. Malty with coffee notes. Roasted sourness. Decent.

Bottle, 7.5%. Good blueberry aroma. Black colour. Small stable brown head. The flavour starts off with a good blueberry note and then comes a more of a standard stout flavour with the creamy and roasted notes that are expected of this style. Has a very slight perfumy note in the finish, but all in all an interesting beer, and not bad.

Bottle. Pours cloudy very dark brown with airy tan head. Clear aroma of roast, with notes of malt and touches of blueberries and hints of fish. Roasty flavour wit notes of blueberries and malt and touches of hops and coffee. Roasty aftertaste with fruity hints. Well, I must admit I had not expected to taste blueberries but I found them there. Decent.

33cl bottle from cerveteca lisboa, Portugal. Color is dark. Head is thin and brown. Taste is light sweet, medium bitter. Finish is long and dry. Aroma is roasted, chocolate, fruity, nutty. Quite good!
Bottle. Black with thin brown head. Aroma is malt, blueberries, roasted and some chocolate. Taste is roasted, coffe and some dark fruits. Bitter.

Roasty aroma, hints of blueberry (which was very prominent when I opened the bottle). Black in colour, tan head. Complex and layered flavours of chocolate and blueberries. After taste sticks pleasantly in throat. I like this beer.

Bottle (from Beergium). Pours dark brown-black with brown head. The head stays. Aroma is blueberries, sweetness, roast, dark chocolate, malt. Flavor is sweet, bitter and slightly sour, blueberries, roast, chocolate, coffee. Finish is roast and chocolate. No sign of alcohol. Overall: this is so well crafted, feels smooth and easy to drink, a lot of blueberries, but they dont run over the beer. Great brew.

Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Pours pitch black with a medium dark brown head. Aroma has a ton of slightly artificial blueberry. Errr. Licorice, chocolate, light roasted malts, tobacco. Blueberries just dont work on stouts... Taste is chocolatey, licorice, blueberry, sweet, roasty, tobacco, malty.

26/I/16 - 33cl bottle from Bierhalle Deconinck (Vichte) @ home - BB: n/a (2016-69) Thanks to Erwin for sharing the bottle!
Clear dark brown to black beer, big creamy beige irregular head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: very fruity upon opening the bottle, berries, sweet, caramel, soft roast, rich stout aromas, sugary impression. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: sweet start, bit sourish, fruity, caramel, soft roast. Aftertaste: bit oxidized, very roasted, fruity, coffee, bit sourish, bitter hops, some blueberries. Nice one!

Pitch black, medium tan frothy head, moderate lasting. Aroma is of malt, chocolate, roasted malt and light blueberry. Taste is medium sweet malt, bit caramel and strong chocolate, roasted malt, touch of blueberries, coffee, some roasted and berry acidity but light, dry roasty bitter finish and lasting aftertaste. Medium to full bodied, soft carbonation, nice and creamy. 
(bottle, Bierhalle Deconinck, Vichte)

W aromacie silna czekolada, kawa z odrobiną mleka, palony słód i jagody. Smak to palony słód, sporo czekolady. Nuty jagodowe rewelacyjnie naturalne formie, idealnie łączą się z leciutkim nutami laktozy. Goryczka głównie od palonego słodu

12 oz bottle at the neighbors. Black with tan head. Aroma of chocolate, roasted malt, blueberries, slight artificial blueberries, hand soap. Taste is medium sweet, dark chocolate, blueberries, slight soap, roasted and burnt malt with slight liquorice. Nice

Bottle. Head is initially small, frothy, brown, mostly diminishing. Body is opaque black (flashlight tested). Aroma is moderately malty (chocolate, roasted grain), with a strong note of blueberry soda/candy/cereal. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, moderately bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, lightly alcoholic.

This ones a double-edged sword in the nose...on the one hand, Im pleased that the blueberry is obvious, but on the other, its a pretty artificial smelling blueberry smell, like Boo Berry cereal or a blueberry soda. And it is a little overbearing, to be honest. Whereas some other blueberry stouts Ive tried in the past year barely smelled of it at all, this one is a bit over the top. Fruity-tart in mouth and a bit too lastingly sweet...and again, artificial tasting. Not repulsive or anything, but a rather cartoony rendition.

bottle. Pours black with thin brown head. Aroma is Chocolate Blueberry. Taste is sweet blueberry chocolate with a smoky chocolate blueberry finish. Kind of like a chocolate blueberry muffin. I dig it.
Draught at Brewberry. Blueberry is nicely integrated in this rich chocolatey stout, smooth and creamy mouthfeel and dry finish. My first Dark Horse experience and a well impressive one.
Bottled. Poured dark. Smells of malt and...blueberry. blends well as it warms. Pretty well done

UPDATED: DEC 21, 2015 On tap, poured into a snifter. The aroma is that of warm, fresh baked, slightly charred blueberry muffins. It pours a dark, opaque brown color with a brown, soft, muffin dough-looking head that has good retention and lace. The taste is a medium high bittersweet. It?s texture is creamy and smooth with a cream-like carbonation, and a full, roasty body with notes of  coffee and blueberry muffins. The finsh is smoky with burnt bread crust / baked blueberry tones and an aftertaste that?s mostly clean, with a light smokey / burnt toast and toffee touch.

Bottle. Sensoric. Nice dark berries aroma along with some milk chocolate and coffe notes, also some licorice notes. Some light booze sensations. Taste is sth between semi-dry and semi-sweet. Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation, finish is semi-dry and creamy. In overall nice stout with touch of dark fruits.
Aromats: Melleņu jogurts, aronija un gauztetais iesals. Garsa: tas pats kas aromata, tikai tads skidrs emocijaas :)
Nice blueberry nose with a mild hint of char. Flavor is light blueberry quickly taken over by a strong char finish.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
Pours a nearly black with a light orange-tan head. Smoky blueberry nose. Smooth, wet, and slick. Flavors approximate the nose. Good stuff.

Growler at home. TONS of blueberry/berry aroma as I pour this first glass. Pours black with a tan head that fades to a substantial ring around the edge of the glass that lasts until its gone and leaves behind spotty lacing as the beer disappears in my belly. Smells of berries, cocoa, floral qualities. Strong flavor of roasted malts, some cocoa, light berry in the background. Very smooth and milky texture, a touch watery. Medium to full bodied; soft carbonation; bitter, roasty finish. I can still taste the blueberry (actually, more of the blueberry) now that the beer is gone.

Bottle at home. Black with short lasting brown head that leaves a nice ring around the glass. Sweet blueberries on the nose. Sipping brings out coffee, burnt toast, tobacco, sweet blueberry jelly, cake, caramel. Quite sweet with roasted bitter finish. Over medium bodied with think but slick feel. Nice stuff, but theres a light artificial touch too the fruits.
Aromat: jagodowy, palony, kawowy. Wygląd: czarne, nieprzejrzyste, piana brązowa, zostawia krążki na szkle. Smak: aksamitne, kawowe, palona goryczka, rozgrzewanie w przełyku.

Aroma: Sweet, chocolate with blueberries, roastiness, great aroma. Appearance: Medium high dense brown head, black color. Taste: Roastiness, chocolate, light blueberry, some alcohol, bitterness is medium. Palate: Body is medium low, carbonation is low, finish is sweet and alcohol.

W aromacie potężna czekolada, lekko likierowo, są owoce leśne, pachnie apetycznie. W smaku dominuje czekolada, lżejsza kawa, jest lekka owocowość. Największym mankamentem jest za mało ciała, zbyt wodnista konsystencja i lekki alkohol drapiący w gardło. Ale jest to naprawdę przyjemny trunek.
Bottle. Pours black with beautiful brownish head. Aroma of chocolate with acidic fruity notes. Taste is moderately bitter with distinct aftertaste of roasted malts. Medium bodied. Very good.

Poured from 12 oz. bottle. 

Opaque, brown-black with a 2-finger brown head and fair lacing. 

Aroma of chocolate, coffee, roasted malt and dark berries. 

Taste of chocolate, roasted coffee, dark berries, licorice and roasted malt. 

Medium/light body and medium/high carbonization.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours pitch black with a nougat white color head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee and a scent of blueberry. Taste is almost the same as the scent, chocolate, light roasted coffee malt and blueberry.
fruity blueberry aromas, pitch black with some tan head, fruity thick smooth with bitter sweetness excellent

Very black tan and white 2 toned head rich and heady/Lacey. Aroma is blueberry chocolate malty sweet cereal. Taste is a nice sweet stout with plenty chocolate light roast rich malt and a nice complimenting flavor of blueberry throughout.This works well for me. Excellent fruit stout. Very sexy.

Aroma blueberry
Appearance black, brown foam, 
Taste medium sweetness, lightly bitter, 
Palate medium body, soft carbonation, bitter, 
Overall smells better than it tastes. Not my mind of beer. I would not suggest this beer to a friend
Has a good smokey flavor with blueberries at the start.  Not to sweet with just the right berry mix to make a great beer.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
Tap at c4. Pours black with a brown head. Aroma of roast, licorice, chokolade, caramel, berry. Taste is the same, blueberry, choko, slight roast. Very balanced.

Bottle shared with Ashton McCobb and homebrew Jeff. Pours jet black with a thin tan head. Aromas of Jamaican gingery cake, blueberry, tar, liquorice, dark chocolate. Taste is more dark cooked berries, gibbet cake, dark fruity chocolate. Clean finish. Lovely.

Bottle thanks to allmyvinyl. 
Appearance - opaque black with a lovely fawn head. 
Nose - Jamaica ginger cake plus blueberry. 
Taste - chocolate, berry fruit and more cake. 
Palate - medium bodied with a creamy texture and a long balanced finish. 
Overall - lovely beer.

12 oz. Opaque jet with a thin film of cream. Aroma is chocolate, soy, blueberry and hints of green herb, char and smoke. Tastes of the same great mix plus some dark bread and caramel. Medium-heavy body has a good balance and a fizz thats more than I usually like, but it remains mostly smooth and seems appropriate for this beer.

Pitch black oily color with brown foam ring. Light blueberry notes in the nose. The taste is smooth fruity blueberry notes. Sweet and decent carbonation and a thick oily mouth feeling. Smooth coffee and dark chocolate aftertaste with a fruity note.

Bottle, 0.355l. Pours pitch black with thin creamy brown head and fair lacing. Aroma of blueberries, roasted malt, cocoa powder and dark chocolate. Taste starts with moderate sweet and rich roasted malt and chocolate, follows by fruity acidity, only mild blueberry flavor, while finish is moderate bitter. Medium body, creamy texture and average carbonation in palate. Très bien...

Bottle from brewdog online. Black with nice tan head. Blueberry Aroma hts immediately and is very inviting, beautiful match with the roasty malty stout. Taste is very well balanced, sweet and bitter with a bit of alcohol hum. Medium full with mild carbonation. Very nice.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2015 Very pleasant chocolate and blueberry aroma. The fruit taste is also present in the taste but more subtle, making the malt shine more. Ideal balance between sweet and bitter. The body is pretty light for a stout, making it very easy to drink and the alcohol is very well hidden for the 7.5% ABV.
Bottle at home. Roasted malt, chocolate and dark fruit. Pretty well balanced tasty beer indeed.

Tap @Alus Celle, Riga. Pitch black color. Creamy brown head, stays. Looks nice. Roast, chocolate, woody, twigs, chocolate in aroma. Chocolate, coffee, woody, slightly sour berries in taste. Soft plus carbonation. Twiggy/branches with roasted malts in aftertaste. Alcohol is quite hidden. Nice brew.

Pitch black, beige head. In aroma very nice and natural blueberry aroma upfront, then roastiness and chocolate. In taste less blueberry but still present, medium roastiness. Medium body, soft carbonation, very smooth. One more great stout from Dark Horse, this time with fantastic blueberry notes.

Bottle. Black with a thin head. Aromas are coffee with obvious blueberry. Earthy and oily with dark toffee. Medicinal with light smokiness. Flavours are sweet blueberry with roast malts and earthy notes. Dark chocolate. Dry finish. Decent.

duft: sød tobak læder blåbær mørke bær.
smag: blid lidt rød sultetøj eftersmag. behagelig og god fylde i øllet
On draft at Sharp Edge Brasserie. Poured black with thin ring of khaki head. Roasted malt, dark chocolate, sweet blueberry finish.

This was poured into a nonic pint glass.
The appearance was a black color with a slim fingers worth of tan head that quickly died off. Barely any lacing stuck around the glass.
The smell had a nice sweet to roasty blend of sweet blueberry, slight roasty coffee, light vanilla, and bringing in a light cocoa all rounding out a wonderful aroma.
The taste was sweet and slightly roasty bringing in a slight bitter (from the coffee). Lingering slightly roasty coffee aftertaste leads to a quick dry finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a fairly decent sessionability about it. Carbonation seemed good for the style and for me.
Overall, as an American Stout it works. The blueberry makes a nice added bonus. Id have again.

Draught @ Fermentoren, Århus. Pours black with a creamy brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate, light tart fruit, blueberry. Flavor is roasted, light sweet, malty, dark chocolate, light coffee, cocoa, nice blueberry notes. Medium body, average carbonation, light sweet fruity finish. Smooth. 300515

Bottle.Black colour with small beige head.Aroma is sweet with taste of tart blueberrys and roasted malt,good full body and sweet nots of berries and slight chocolate note,sweet and well balanced finish.

on tap @ Vino Belissimo / Lima OH --- Clear, very dark ruby brown color, solid 1/2" tan head, heavy lace band. Taste is toasted malt that adds light fizz on the swallow, then dark chocolate followed by light tart blueberry, then chocolate again. Complex, and quite good.
355ml bottle from Saveur-Biere.fr. Blueberry pop-tarts aroma. Taste is rich and fruity against a slick stout background. Decent.

Aroma of roasted malt with a nice authentic blueberry aroma. Not sweet though. Taste is dry roasted malt with a blueberry finish, again not sweet. Almost like eating a blueberry pancake and then taking a sip of a stout.. Or actually the other way around as the blueberry is in the finish, different but quite nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

May 1, 2015 - bottle via trade. Dark pour with some head. Aroma was blueberry, chocolate, malt and light smoke. Taste was mostly roasted malt with smoke and light sweetness, blueberry not noticeable in taste.

Bottle sampled at Classic City Brew Fest 2015! Pours a deep brownish black with minimal tan brown head that leaves light lace. Aroma is blueberry centric, with hints of chocolate and roast underneath. Taste is way more balanced toward the stout flavors, but still nice fruitines. Medium body, soft carbonation, pretty solid.

W aromacie mamy intensywne jagody i sos sojowy. Zapach całkiem przyjemny i zaskakujący.
Piwo jest lekko kwaśne i wytrawne. Smak bardzo złożony, mamy delikatne palone ziarna kawy i gorzką czekoladę, następnie pojawiają się kwaśne jagody i lekka ziołowa goryczka.
Bardzo przyjemny, oryginalny i co najważniejsze naprawdę jagodowy stout.
Blueberry is sweet and adds a slight essence. Its not a heavy beer and the flavor isnt overwhelming. Had bottle.
13.8.2014. Black beer with thin brown head. Aroma of blueberry, coffee and roasted malts. Palate is medium to full bodied, lowish carbonation. Taste has roasted malts, coffee and blueberry.

From a bottle, black with very large staying brown head with very fine bubbles. Nose is roasted malts, blueberry, chocolate. burnt toast. Medium to heavy body, soft carbonation, slightly sweet, maybe a hint of earthiness, moderate bitterness in the finish, very creamy, slightly oil. Long roasted malt finish with tons of great blueberry flavor. Easy to drink body is very nice and great flavors, another great stout from Dark Horse.

355 ml. bottle shared by Kraddel @ Rampkrot. ½ consumed. Thanks. Blackish dark brown, mocha bubbles. Nose is light umami but lots o mocha, sugar & sweet blueberry. More blueberry pulp with brown sugar than the berry on its own. Light bitter roast upfront, touch umami leading to sweet blueberry, brown sugar, lots of mocha, basic chocolate, Low carb, sweet heavy mocha boby. Drinks really easy. Very nice. Fav. Dark Horse beer so far prob.
Pours black , small dark head . Smell is full, bit dark fruits, dark malts. Taste is bit bitter, fleshy, bit plastic-fruityness. ok
Draught @ NYC Craft Beer Festival. Inky black with very small foamy beige head, blueberry muffin aroma, low carbonation, blueberry flavored coffee taste, long finish. Very nice and satisfying.
Draft at the NYC craft beer festival. Deep black color with a light blueberry tasting easy drink ability. Very good

Appearance: near black, creamy tan head.  Aroma: 	strong chocolate roast, hint of blueberry and vanilla. Taste: 	tastes like nothing so much as a chocolate chip blueberry muffin.  Finish: roasty, slightly dry, with a nice bit of blueberry must. Notes: 	The flavor combo isnt my favorite, but this was extremely well executed. Good palate. Bottle from Total Wine in McLean, VA.

Draft at the Pump House. Very dark with a one finger tan head. Some blueberry and coffee in the aroma. The berry is not tasted as prominently but is there. Coffee, tobacco, and roast. Malts are big. Semi sweet to dry. I like blueberry in a beer and wish it had been bigger. A nice beer.

Opaque black pour a beautiful deep brown head slightly tinged with red. Aroma is little bits of blueberry over roast malts. Delicious on the tongues, the bitter and roasted cocoa powder plays well with the sweet malt and blueberry flavors. Smooth and fairly thick mouthfeel is pleasant and suits the style. Great adjunct stout.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at Beer Market. Huge aroma of blueberry muffins, jet black with minimal head. Surprisingly not as much blueberry when tasted. Flavors of chocolate, roasted malt with subtle blueberry. Very surprised!
Didnt really like it but I really liked the bourbon barrel version of this. I just wasnt a fan.
Aroma is amazing you can smell it from the moon, blueberry and chocolate, flavor is similar, nice
On draft at Soacebar Falls Church VA. Pours black with a tan head. Blueberry aroma. Flavor of licorice and milk chocolate. Smooth finish.

Svart med veldig lavt skum. Aromaen består av sjokolade og hint av bær, antageligvis blåbær med tanke på navnet... Noe kaffe også. Ganske anonym aroma egentlig, i hvertfall servert rundt 9-10 grader. Blir noe mere liv etterhvert. Kaffe og sjokolade i smaken, samt blåbær. Her er det mere tydelig at vi har med blåbær å gjøre enn i aromaen. Medium konsistens, litt vannaktig munnfølelelse. Blåbær i ettersmaken.

Appearance: It has a very viscous pour as it forms an oily black body with a thick dark brown head that looks very nice but fades out to a thin layer leaving no lacing.

Aroma: I can smell a roasted aroma from about a foot and a half away from the glass. On closer approach I get a roasted coffee-like aroma. There is a berry aroma to the beer after pulling the glass away. I wouldnt be able to identify it as blueberry without reading the label.

Taste: Roasted flavors here; some dark roast coffee and a high cocoa content bakers chcolate. I dont pickup blueberry while actually drinking the beer. My burps taste a bit like blueberries but thats a stretch...

Mouthfeel: It has a nice thick mouthfeel. It is easy to drink.

Overall: A good stout, but I wouldnt call it a blueberry stout. Skip it if you are looking for something that has blueberry flavor. I didnt expect this thing to taste like Kool-aid or anything...but some blueberry flavor would have been nice.

Odeur melant le torrifié intense à la myrtille parfumée. Le gout est similaire. Lassociation entre le malt brulé et la myrtille est trsè perspicace. Probablement une des meilleures stout que jai jamais bu.

Opaque black pour a beautiful deep brown head slightly tinged with red. Aroma is little bits of blueberry over roast malts. Delicious on the tongues, the bitter and roasted cocoa powder plays well with the sweet malt and blueberry flavors. Smooth and fairly thick mouthfeel is pleasant and suits the style. Great adjunct stout.

This pitch black beer has a tiny, dark brown head that doesnt leave much lacing on the glass. The aroma is malty, roasted and very strong, with delicious notes of dark caramel, dark chocolate and a faint fruity touch, without being particularly blueberry-ish. Strong malty roasted flavour, again with lots of dark caramel and chocolate, but also with darker roasted notes of coffee. There is also a noticeable and recognisable sweet fruity part: this is definitely blueberries! The taste is moderate sweet, the finish is moderate bitter and there are also some very light acidic hints. Mid-bodied, dry and with a soft carbonation. Finally a blueberry stout with just the right amount of berries! 
[35.5 cl bottle, from Vinmonopolet Vika, Oslo]

ブルーベリー  
酸味がわりと&
Very enjoyable blueberry flavored sweet stout. This beer smells of blueberrys and taste chocolate. Good beer by the guys in Marshall, MI.
Nose is dried blueberry and chocolate. Flavor is ashy, more blueberry, cacao, dry roastiness. Really nice

Bottle (12 oz). From Andrew, thanks! No idea of how fresh/old it is.

Appearance: Black with a medium quickly diminishing dark brown head and no lacing. 

Aroma: Aroma is of roasted malt, chocolate, light/moderate blueberry presence and hints of smoke.

Taste: Taste is mostly of chocolate and blueberries along some roasted malt, hints of smoke, moderate sweetness and molasses.

Palate: Medium body. Soft carbonation. Kind of oily mouthfeel. Roasty finish. Short berries aftertaste. 

Overall: The blueberries blend surprising well with the other components of the beer. Its quite tasty and theres an easy recognizable blueberry presence, but it quickly become cloying especially considering the rather low abv. I liked it, but didnt finish the bottle.

Pours a deep dark brown with, I believe I saw, a blue tinge with a light brown head which lingers and laces nicely......aroma of coffee, smokeyness......taste is very clean, hits with a smoked coffee taste, booze kicks in then blueberry in the end. Quite an enjoyable quaff on this cold winters night. Well done.

Bottle. Pours black with a deep brown head that dissipates slowly to the edges. Aroma combines roasted malts, light smoke, bitter chocolate and blueberries with a dark grain backbone. Flavor has dark grains, bitter chocolate and roasted malts supported by blueberry and a hint of smoke in the finish.

Draft at Gingerman. Deep stout pour you know what Im talking about. Thin head lovely nose of blueberry and chocolate. Tastes of plums, molasses, chocolate, and plenty of blueberry goodness. Bitter palate. Very enjoyable

Pours dark brown with limited dark khaki head. Smells of coffee, dark chocolate, sweet blueberry. Taste matches the aroma fault closely. Lots of roasty, chocolately malt flavor with a bit of trailing blueberry sweetness and very slight tartness. Very tasty and balanced but does not open up and develop as it warms as other stouts often will, drinks better cold. Pretty solid overall. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Oily black with a thin mocha head. Aroma is blueberry pie. Taste adds some cocoa. Medium mouthfeel and carb. Very good.

Black pour thick khaki head. Aroma malty with blueberry. Taste is chocolate, coffee, roasted malts with a nice finish of blueberry. Very subtle blueberry taste lingers. Very smooth, thick, velvety, creamy and good.

Color negro intenso con media corona de espuma de baja retención aunque perdura un fino velo en el borde de la copa; en nariz aromas potentes a chocolate negro, café moka, frutos negros y licor; en boca entrada potente y maltosa con fuerte carácter; cuando coge temperatura gana en intensidad aromática, siguen notas a cacao; el alcohol se siente aunque no tiene mucha graduación; trago corto con largo pos gusto y notas dulces; una excelente stout compleja y bien balanceada.

BOTTLE 12 OZ.
The aroma is very intense, even for a 7.5% stout - lightly smoked prunes, molasses, chocolate. The body is more drinkable than the bold aroma suggests, with lots of roasted/burned malts and ashes, and hints of tannic mildly acidic ground berries. Excellent.

Bottle pours dark reddish black with tan head. Roast, coffee, blueberry, earth, chocolate. Moderately bitter and sweet. Lightly crisp, medium body. Blueberrys a bit of a gimmick, but nothing to complain about here.

Piana drobna, kawowa, szybko opadła. 
Bez śladów na szkle. 
Kolor czarny, smolisty, nieprzejrzyste. 
W aromacie wyraźne jagody. Po ogrzaniu pojawiają się nuty słodkiej czekolady. Lekki aromat ciepłego ciasta. lekko kwaskowaty zapach przypomina zapach mrożonych jagód.
W smaku ciemne słody, zdecydowane jagody. 
Pozostawia lekko słonawy posmak.

35cl bottle @El Cabanón, Avilés. 27-04-2014.
In short: smooth tasty ale.
Pours very dark with nice very tan head. Short head retention, poor lacing. Roasty, liquorice, fruity aromas. Medium body, soft carbonation, oily texture. Taste is roasty, creamy, some fruity. Very smooth and pleasant.

330ml served in a snifter glass.
Black label marked 7.5% ABV.
A: pours a deep black color forming a small thin bubbled dark beige head. Low retention and a lot of small spotty molasses lacings left in the glass. 
S: Strong notes of dark chocolate and blueberry. Roasted malts, cappuccino and wood. Sweet pie. Notes of earth and flowery hops. 
T: Slightly sweet upfront. Dark chocolate, coffee and blueberry pie. Quite earthy. Smooth mouth and moderate bitterness. Some notes of wood and grassy hops. 
M: Full body. Creamy, smooth and a bit molasses. Bittersweet roasty aftertaste. 
O: Great drinkability. Amazing Stout

bottle pour from stout variety pack...glug glug from bottle..black hue with a slight head that yes has a blueberry tint..nose is fruit dominant with good quality blueberries not fake or artificial at all..palate is really smooth and tasty..the blueberry is a nice addition to the mix here and makes this an interesting beer..finishes with a nice slight tartness on the end..mixed in with some good more typical chocolate character from the style..quite enjoyable and damn this would pair exceptionally well with some blueberry pancakes at brunch...worth seeking out

at olbaren in copenhagen. dark brown with a purple tinge, modest head; somewhat medicinal aroma with the blueberry restrained; plenty of rich chocolatey flavours balance surprisingly well with the sweet blueberry character also offering a touch of acidity

pours unclear very darn brown with a small beige cap showing minimal retention and lacing. luscious chocolate and lightly smoked roasted malted goodness, with distinct blueberries blending in superbly, chocolate-covered blueberries, some dried and sweetened blueberries, woodsy, clean yeast, hint of sweetness - molasses, bit of juicy meat. light carbonation, medium body - oily, semi-sweet and woodsy-grassy-gently smoked finish. excellent fruit stout.
From tap at Mi2 at Cardinal 13.10.14. Almost black. Pale brown head. Aroma of blueberries, with dark chocolate and roasted barley. Similarly fine taste. Good drinkability.

On tap at Cardinal, Stavanger, Pours clear very dark ruby with a huge frothy tanned head. Fantastic berry aroma, fresh and light citric. Thick and creamy mouthfeel. Taste is light sweet, but dark red berries, some roast and tarish bitterness at the finish.
On tap at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours black with a nice head. Aroma of blueberries, dark chocolate. Smooth mouthfeel.

Fra fat på Cardinal under Bjørnøy Rundt Triathlon okt-14: Pent beige skum over en kølsvart øl, og opp fra dette stiger en liflig blåbæraroma i elegant samspill med god sjokolade og like god kaffe. Smaken er også helt på topp, hvor den fine syren fra blåbærene er prikken over ien. En nytelse fra første sniff til siste dråpe.

On tap at Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. Pitch black colour, moderate tan head. Aroma of blueberries, chocolate, vanilla, mild coffee and moderately roasted malts. Pleasant flavour of roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate and blueberries, a slight fruity acidity, dry finish with moderate hops. Very enjoyable.

4.5%? seriously? probably the best use of blueberry (a fruit i generally dont prefer in beer, though i like blueberries) in a brew that ive ever tried. huge blueberry aroma, not in the least fake, like it usually turns out. pretty thick for a low abv beer. the flavor is more stout than the aroma, which was 50 50 at best. nice roasted malt, chocolate, berries, with a slight lingering tart berry finish mixed in with roasty goodness. surprisingly well done."

Bottle at home. Has a pitch black colour with a medium, creamy, light brown head. Roasted and sweet aroma of coffee, ash, dark chocolate, leather and oak. Roasted malt also in the flavour along with more ash, wood and coffee beans. Has a slick and silky mouthfeel, and a medium bitterness. A well-roasted and pleasant stout, but cant find much of the blueberries.

Bottle. Very dark black pour. Aroma is dark chocolate, roasted grain, coffee and blueberries. Taste is roasted grain, coffee, dark chocolate, dark roasted grain and some blueberries. just enough that you can taste it and so that it melds nicely with the traditional stout flavors. It has a light-to-medium body. A very nice stout that I would drink again.

12oz bottle from The Beer Shoppe (Ardmore PA). Shared with Bob F. after work. Pours a thin black color with a small foamy dark tan head.
Aroma of chocolate, light sweet artificial blueberry, and roasted malt.
Taste of sweet blueberry up front, followed by dark roasted malt, and milk chocolate.

What a fantastic beer! Definitely my second favorite in the dark horse stout series only behind plead the 5th. A great stout with a nice blueberry flavor that doesnt overpower. I drank a year and a half old tres recently, ages well. Reccomend.

Coffee, cocoa, chocolate and blueberries in the aroma. Black with a brown head. Medium sweet and light to medium bitter. Medium to full body with a soft carbonation. Overall a nice stout, with nice present blueberries.
keg at the kings arms e2.pours black with a slight blue tinge In the head.Aroma ad taste of blueberries. great beer

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2016 Ma web Originally had bottled, on 09/02/14. Tap at CK Diggs, in Mi. Pours very black, tan head. Aroma is lots of blueberry, smoke, plenty of chocolate, roasted malt. Flavor is chocolate, blueberry, malt, a little smokey, really nice sweet blueberry notes. Well balanced.
Fairly dark brown, nearly black. Aroma of blueberry and roasted malt. Interesting mix of fruity sweetness, bitter roasted malt, and chocolate.
I really liked this one...i liked the blueberry twist...different but enjoyable....crazy flavors that twisted together and worked...good job fellas....way too mix it up!

beige head fades fast with some lacing. coffee coloured. aroma bit leather, roasted malts, quite fruity. taste like aroma, blueberries, lavender, rosewater, liquorice with a fair bitterness from the roasted malts. dry mouthfeel, rather thin body and medium carbonation. really has lots of blueberries in the taste. bottle 33cl
Lukter blåbær med en gang, men kaffe og svisker kommer mere fram etterhvert. Fyldig og lite kullsyre. Kort bitter ettersmak med noe alkoholvarme i avslutningen.
Svart med lys brunt skum. Flott blåbærlukt, kaffe og sviske. Bitre, salte og noe søtlige fruk og bærsmaker. Kort, lett bitter avslutning. lite kullsyre
Blåbær lukt med en gang går over til tyngre lukt. Muligens kaffe. Litt blå skjær i skumnet. Mørk sjokolade
Beige skum med litt blåskjær,fremtredende lukt av blåbær,smak av mørk sjokolade og kaffe,lang ettersmak.
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours black with some sediment and a tan head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are blueberry, roasted malt, chocolate, and coffee - with a slightly bitter finish.

0.33l bottle. This one has a nice deep dark brown looking body and only a small but lasting and elegantly lacing dark brown head. On the our its so lovely roasted and totally unexpected fantastic shampoo-like fruity. Theres just so many nice things to say about this lovely aroma. Its sweet but not to sweet in any way. Really fruity, but still relatively toasty and roasty so theres never really any doubt that its a stout creation this. Mild vanilla and some hints of herbs in the background. Really nice! Tastes lovely also. Roasted but almost a bit like drinking a cloud. Yeah, it actually has a oil-cloudy mouthfeel this and its soft and only prickling on the bubbles. I would not at first been able to identify the taste as blueberries, not now either to be honest, but its definitely fruity! More like blackberries blended with currants in a way. Lots of nice sweet chocolate and even a little coffee latte here. I get the same aftertaste in the mouth that I get when Ive had a good fat-milked latte. A lovely little stout this. Ill sure be picking up another bottle or two of this - if theres any left. 13.06.2014

Pours black with a think caramel head. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee, and blueberries. Taste is heavy, but full of dark chocolate, roasted malt and of course blueberries. The blueberries are not overpowering and just subtle enough to know theyre there. Good stout.

Bottle from saveur-biere.com. Dark brown to black body, with a very thin, dark tan, creamy head, that dissipates immediately. Aroma of dark chocolate, coffee, blueberry, wood. Taste with about the same aromas. Mouthfeel is medium, oily, with a medium carbonation and it finishes roasty, wooden, with dark chocolate, coffee and a slight acidity from the blueberries. Tasty! The chocolate and coffee notes blend very well with the sweet blueberries, which appear more and more the more it warms up. Smooth and well balanced. Really enjoyable!
Black pour. Small tan head. Lacing. Huge fresh blueberry aroma. Huge blueberry taste with some peppery notes and a slight chocolate note.

Butelka 0.33l 
W szkle ciecz o ciemno brązowej, przechodzącej w czerń barwie, z niską i błyskawicznie znikającą pianą. W aromacie silna czekolada, kawa z odrobiną mleka, palony słód i jagody. Smak to palony słód, sporo czekolady. Nuty jagodowe rewelacyjnie naturalne formie, idealnie łączą się z leciutkim nutami laktozy. Goryczka głównie od palonego słodu.

Bottle at Bishops Arms, Växjö. 
Pours a tar black with a very weak brown head. A pleasant tinge of blueberries in nose and palate. Otherwise a good but not impressing dry stout. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Flaska. Svart öl med ett fint beigt skum. Blåbären känns omedelbart. De finns där i doften och sticker fram sina tentakler genom kaffet, den rostade malten och chokladen. Följs upp i smaken men där de är mer som en del av alltet än i doften. Mycket njutbart. Sälta i avslutningen. Stor kropp.

Botella de 33 cl en el lúpulo el 27-07-2014, en el momento. Color negro intenso con espuma beige oscuro poco persistente. Aromas de maltas tostadas con ligeros ácidos y frutos rojos del bosque con algunos tonos quemados y ahumados. Cuerpo medio con 7.5 vol correctos con cierta sensación alcohólica, paso ligero y sensación de licor. Sabores maltosos tostados, con frescos y ligeramente ácidos frutos silvestres y un toque picante que después de acabarla todavía no se de donde sale. Tonos de maderas quemadas y carbón, al final, bien combinados con cierto amargo y sensación láctica que permanece en boca por un buen rato. Buena y peculiar, seria conveniente repetir de nuevo.

12 oz bottle. Pours nearly black with a thin tan head that fades quickly to a ring. Aroma is very large. Blueberries, dark chocolate, roasted malts, and a hint of dark fruit. Wow. Taste is balanced. Big roasted malts, dark chocolate, mild Blueberry, and a near espresso finish. Medium-full body with a medium carbonation. Clean in the mouth with a dry finish. Overall this is a great stout by itself. Add the blueberries and you get one of the best fruit beers Ive had.

Draught at The White Horse, Parsons Green on 24 Nov 2012. Poured black, with a dense tan head. Aroma of dark chocolate, fresh blueberries and roasted malt. Coffee flavour, with some rich molasses and cooked berries. Full mouth feel. Finish was liquorice, burnt malt and treacle.

Thick oily black engine oil with a beige layer. Decent first impression. Dark malt, some coffee and blueberry in my nose. Yeah I like! Solid fine body. Pleasant mild sweetness and a moderate bitterness. A bit oily texture. Well what matters most? Taste off course. Is this one ok? Yes! No worries. Lovely smooth flavor and you can easily feel the blueberry. Not to often, and it is not to dominant either. Fine balance. Also some mild coffee and chocolate. Nice and pleasant stout![Bottle form Vinmonopolet Vika in Oslo, Norway]
Draft->mini tumbler at Spacebar. Deep brown with bare head. Dark chocolate, light espresso notes, with sweet blueberries. Better than I expected.
Flaske fra vinmonopolet vika. Svart farge. Beige skumtopp. Lavt karbonert. Smaker jord, aske, brent malt og blåbær. Definitivt den beste Blåbærstouten jeg har hittil.

Bottle thanks to Brian. Pours a dark brown with small beige head that diminishes to nothing. The aroma is strong blueberry pancake and roast. Thin mouthfeel with strong blueberry, light roast, dark chocolate, easy to drink, very good.

Bottle from Vika enjoyed at home
Pours pitch black with a creamy tanned head. Smell of dark dark roasted malts, blueberries, leather, coffee and hints of tobacco. Moderate sweet, quite toasty at first, then a blend of highly roasted malts and fruity blueberries. Quite unusual flavor profile, but i think it works quite well. Some tar and ashtray in the back, quite light mouthfeel, not that heavy oily as expected from the color. Moderate bitter, earthy and toasty finish. Very nice blueberry stout. Ive tasted a few of them now, and this is by far the best of them. Really good stuff

12oz bottle pours dark black-brown with very little head. Nose is a combo of earthy wet roast coffee grounds, dark bakers chocolate, and blueberry pie. Taste is rich bitter chocolate, earthy roast, dark fruit, and of course jammy blueberry. Finish is sweet berry and dark bakers chocolate, some earthy soil. Overall pretty well executed and rather good, better than expected.

Keg at Earl of Essex, Islington, London. A black coloured pour with a fading medium tan head on top. Rich, malty, chocolate, blueberry aroma. Tastes similar, rich, malty, chcocolate, blueberry, almost creamy texture. Lovely blueberry stout, so good I had 3 half pints and left with that luscious blueberry taste in my mouth.

Bleuets et chocolat cest un alliage parfait et ce liquide ne senfarge pas dans la surdose. Cest superbement balancé, le chocolat noir et les bleuets sébattent dans un corps onctueux qui se termine sèchement. Les notes rôties sont adéquate ainsi que lamertume. Un dessert douillet.

Aroma of roasted malts, some coffee and chocolate, but the blueberries are definitely the dominant flavour. Flavour is roasty malty, blueberry, a little sweetness. Very refreshing. I loved the way blueberry was included in the flavour.

12 oz. bottle. Pours black, with a minimal, tan head. The aroma is immediate fresh blueberries, caramel, and bread, with some notes of chocolate and char. The flavor is sweet, with some light roasted bitterness. Medium to heavy body, creamy, and thick. Overall, this is a nice and well made fruit stout, with a good, blueberry cobbler nose. The flavor is a little disappointing, but not bad.

Pours black with minimal head. Nose is blueberry pancakes, roast. Taste matches the nose, blueberry, roast, I wouldn't call it sweet, but not dry, it's well balanced. Not artificially blueberry, pretty legit. This is really a well done beer, not overwhelming or sweet, just tastes like what I want a blueberry stout to be. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Vinmonopolet in Valkendorfsgate, Bergen. Pours a coffee black body with a small beige head. Nose is dark burnt wood, leather, licorice, coffee, dark chocolate and hints of smoked meat, blueberries and sweet matls. Taste is dark chocolate, blueberries, smoke, leather, mild licorice and hints of coffee and dried fruits. Medium to full body, soft to medium carbonation. Very nice blueberry stout which actually brings out both the stout and the berries. I like it.
Blueberry isnt one of my favorite additions to beer, but this is a good example. Not much in the taste, mostly in the aroma. Chocolate overwhelms, a nice dessert beer.
Draft at Stouts. Thick dark pour with a tan, slight bluish hue, head. Nose is roasted malts and blueberry. Nice subtle blueberry taste. Medium heavy mouthfeel. Really nice .

Color negro, espuma beige. Aromas de cereal dulce, café y tostados. Cuerpo medio y textura melosa, de inicio tiene un dulzor entre tostado y afrutado que pasa a un amargor final seco y acafetado bien equilibrado. Muy buena.

355 ml bottle at home. Black with small nice beige-brown head. Aroma is not so intense at the beginning but it gets better when the beer gets warmer. Roasted malty, some chocolate and coffee and definitely berries. Taste is better. Sweet, you get chocolate at the beginning, then becomes fruity, berries yes and it finishes with bitter coffee. Medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, bitter long finish. Very nice!!

Bottled. Pours black with an average brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, dark fruit and blueberries. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carb. An excellent stout.
Bottle. Pours a black color with tan head. Oatmeal, blueberry, milky, sweet aromas. Blueberry, creamy, milk, light roasty flavors. Pretty tasty.

(Bottle) Black colour with frothy, beige head. Malty, roasted nose with chocolate, milky coffee, roasted oatmeal, blueberries and a touch of tar. Malty, fruity taste with notes of coffee, blueberries, soft roasted malt and chocolate in a finish with a balanced bitterness. More than medium body, with soft and mellow mouthfeel. A slight sweetness coming through. Tasty and very well balanced. Very nice.

Bottle. 7,5% Pours close to black producing an inch of thick and creamy looking dark-tanned head. Aroma of coffee. chocolate, roasted malts and berries. Taste is moderate roast, chocolate and coffee. Quite bitter finish, but there is some sweetness also. I dont know if I would have picked up the blueberries in a blind tasting, but when you know its there you get some sense of it. Full bodied with soft co2.
Mørk brun farge. Brun ring langs kant. Duft av kaffe, bek og lakris. God smak av bek og kaffe.

Poured into a Fat Cat pint glass. The bottom of the empty bottle was black due to a layer of sediment. Pours opaque black with a small, creamy, light brown head that retains well. Coats of lacing left behind after each tilt of the glass. 

Aroma: Dark roasted grains; baked blueberries; blueberry syrup; coffee; dark chocolate.

Taste: Blueberry and dark roasted grains of about equal strength complement each other. This stout has a light and well-chosen sweetness despite dark chocolate and coffee notes. Alcohol is very well hidden. 

Feel: Creamy and full body with soft medium-low carbonation.

O: Not quite as delicious as Shipyards Smashed Blueberry, this stout does have an ample blueberry components and nicely balanced flavors.
Bottle. Pours black in color with a thin beige head. Aroma and flavor of blueberries, dark roasted malt and dark chocolate. Pulls off the stout with blueberries nicely.
Mørk nesten svart farve med mørk beige skum. Lukt av røstet malt, blåbær, bek, kaffe. Smak av røstet malt, blåbær, sjokolade bek, kaffe og lakris. Melkebaren.

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2014 Look: pours a dark black with a dark tan head. Head doesn't stick around long. Lacing hangs in the edge of the glass.
Smell: dark fruit. Red apples. Blue berries as it warms up. Slight coco aroma. 
Taste: dark chocolate flavor. Slight hint of coffee. 
Feel: thick heavy beer. Leaves a thin film on your teeth. But not in a bad way. Blueberry after taste but not much blueberry on the from end.
Overall: good beer. Good sweet flavor but not overly sweet. 
First tasted: home 5/14/14

355 ml bottle @ home.Beer enjoyed from a tulip glass. May 13. 2014.
Bought @ "Vinmonopolet Vika", Oslo.
Black in color with a thin beige/brown head and low carbonation.
Aroma is a bit sweet up frront with fresh blueberries,roasted malt,dark chocolate and some coffee.
This beer is actually tasting blueberries.
Medium sweet with a slightly bitter touch and finish.
Yummy beer.Glad i have bought some more of it.

Bottle from Rays in Tosa. Pours black as night, black as coal, with a brown head, somewhat foamy, leaving spots of lacing. Aroma is sweet with fresh blueberries, and some chocolate and some coffee. Taste comes through sweetly and bitter, with blueberries and light sweet fruits, bakers chocolate, some roast and simple sugar. Medium to full bodied. Somewhat dry. Almost no alcohol presence. Finishes with a nice blend of sweet and bitterness. Solid dark beer again from Dark Horse!
Bottle from Vinmonopolet. Lovely aroma of roasted grain and blueberries. Lovely blend, too. Coffee, soot, fresh bittersweet berries.

Draught @ Olympen Mat og Vinhus, Oslo
Pours black with a tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, chocolate, caramel and lots of blueberries. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long blueberry, roasted and chocolate finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Belle bière presque noire avec une mousse brune. Une expérience agréable au nez et en bouche car cette bière nous ramène à notre enfance avec des notes et saveurs de bleuets des Pères Trappistes de Mistasini. Une belle découverte que je nai pas fait moi-même mais plutôt slovaksniper, merci.

I rarely enjoy blueberry beers that much (I havent tried the elusive Cantillion version made for Ølbutikken or any of those), this however I liked a lot. Nice bitter and burnt flavours mixed in with a not too overbearing sweet blueberry, with ample tartness.

Lovely.

UPDATED: APR 28, 2014 (Thanks Cory "BlowOffTube")

Bottle.

A- Cocoa, bitter chocolate, mocha, coffee, roasty, subtle blueberry.

A- Black purple color, dark liquid, brown head.

T- Bakers chocolate, cocoa, coffee, roasted malts, light blueberry, slightly bitter, slightly sweet.

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, sweet dry finish.

O- The blueberry aroma and taste was not overbearing. It gradually came through more and more as it warmed. It was balanced well, and while I probably would have liked a little more blueberry and less bitter chocolate taste, there was nothing to complain about here. A well done fruity stout,

355ml bottle from Saveur Biere


Aroma of blueberrypie. Black outfit with very tiny circle foam around the glass. Nice touch of blueberry at taste, no overdosed at all. This is good!

On tap at Schouskjelleren, march 29nd 2014. Black body, small beige head. Aroma of blueberries, roasted malt, vanilla. Massive sweet blueberry taste, dark chocolate, roasted malt and licorice. This one doesnt play around just teasing you with hints of blueberries like so many others, its the real deal and delivers a tremendous blueberry taste. I love it!

Pours a dark almost black color with light khaki head. Head dissipates pretty quickly to a ring around the glass. On pop, the blueberry is very obvious, with tons of blueberry from even a couple feet from the glass. It smells just like fresh blueberry. The blueberry tones down after a bit and then you get some milk chocolate and a touch of roasted nut. Taste starts predominantly with coffee and dark malt, a touch of blueberry that quickly passes, milk chocolate, then dark roasted nuts and malt again. Carbonation is slightly prickly on the tongue and the finish is long and wavers between medium dark chocolate and bitter dark malt. This is pretty good and I wanted to like it more...

Bottle. Oily, shiny black pour with gentile beige lacing. Aroma has lots of blueberry pancake syrup with cocoa notes. Flavor is clearly impacted by the blueberry, but I dont really get it specifically. I almost taste twigs. Slight earthiness with dark cocoa and a gentile roast. Slight blueberry permeates in the finish. Thin body. Nice.

Fat på The Flying Scotsman. 
Svart vätska med lite brunt skum. 
Mycket rostat, lite kaffe i doften. 
Smaken är rätt tam, men efter en stund kommer en syrlighet av blåbär. 
Saknar kropp.

Pours a nice 2 finger dark chocolate head. Body is pitch black with no light escaping. Head retention was surprisingly quickly diminished and lacing was above average. 

Smells of freshly blended blueberries. Surprised that the blueberries smelled so fresh and not too sweet or artificial. Other aromas are of dark semi sweet chocolate, roasted espresso, and bits of smoked malt. Hops are nowhere to be found and alcohol is hidden well for a stout almost 8%.

Taste is bits of chocolate covered blueberries mixed with a smoked porter. Charred oak and some coffee cut the fruity sweetness. Light bitterness is in the aftertaste and alcohol is barely detected.

Mouthfeel is medium bodied but with a good amount of carbonation. Head died pretty fast, wish it stuck around to cut the carbonation. 

Overall this beer was pretty good. Never had a blueberry stout before and I was pleasantly surprised. Extremely drinkable, wish it was available in my region.

Bottled December 2nd and poured March 20th. $2.19 single.

Appearance: Pitch black with a seriously dark brown head that goes down quickly and leaves a small film on top of the beer. No lacing.

Smell: Welp, roast and blueberry. Dark chocolate covered blueberry kind of vibe, but with coffee in there as well. Pleasant to my nose holes. It doesnt smell like a burst of blueberries all over the place, but its clearly there and not in an overbearing fashion.

Taste/feel: First thing I notice without a doubt is the body on this beer -- quite full with only a mildly prickly carbonation on it. The blueberry and other stouty characteristics work incredibly well together. Theres a sweet, slightly sour blueberry character, and then the roasted bitterness. Rather than dominate the beer, the blueberry compliments it very nicely without becoming too much. The blueberry is implemented very well in Tres, and Bells Cherry Stout is looking quite a bit less appetizing (if thats even possible for some people) after having this. The sweetness and sour/tanginess from the blueberries in this beer doesnt leave an unappealing, artificial sort of aftertaste that Bells Cherry Stout does. The aftertaste is very mildly bitter with a blueberry flavor. As a whole, this isnt a bitter beer much at all, thanks to the blueberries. Theres a slight bit of it from the roasted malt, which is to be expected, but its nicely balanced overall. As for the alcohol, not noticeable at all in any way.

One of my new favorites from Dark Horse. Its not often you see a fruit infused stout turn out to be as tasty as this one is. Again, the blueberry is there to accent this beer -- not turn it into fruit juice. If I had any complaint, itd be that Id like it to be a bit more bold on the flavor. More blueberry and more roasty depth. This stuff tastes great as it is, but uhm... maybe an Imperial version, Dark Horse? Just a thought. Definitely try this one out.

the aroma is ALL blueberry. 

great blueberry flavor without being overly sweet. its also got a great roasty flavor behind the blueberry

fantastic beer

You really wouldn't think it would work, but somehow it does. The flavor of the berry without the cloying sweetness. Well done.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cette bière qui est noire affiche une belle et solide tête mousseuse brune. Une dentelle se déroule entre chaque gorgée. Son nez est très appétissant avec ses notes rôties, son café, ses parfums de gâteau et ses effluves grandissants de bleuets enrobés de chocolat noir. En bouche, son caractère rôti et torréfié est bien balancé par les saveurs uniques du petit fruit bleu et par les notes plus douces projetées par les malts. Au palais, jaime la sensation crémeuse de ce corps bien traversé par les bulles. En finale, une bonne dose de torréfaction se manifeste à la remorque dune expression chocolatée noire et amère.
Blueberry flavoring hard to detect. Nice taste, didnt love the palate. Great looking dark color.

Bottle, thanks to Bacterial. Thankfully shared with friends. Pours deep dark brown. Aroma is straight up blueberry muffin. This is a brunch beer for sure. Taste: quite floral, artificial blueberry, toast and roast chocolate. Wow ... based on my reaction to Cascades Blueberry, theres a good chance my mouth does not appreciate what blueberries bring to beer. This is a neat novelty beer, and the smell was way cool, but once it got into my mouth all I could think was "gross." But, its exactly as it purports to be.

12 oz bottle. Very dark black color. Aroma is dark chocolate, roasted grain, coffee and blueberries. Taste is roasted grain, coffee, dark chocolate, dark roasted grain and reined-in blueberries - just enough that you can taste it and so that it melds nicely with the traditional stout flavors. It has a light-to-medium body. A very pleasant stout that I would drink again.

After too cream stout, that seemed quite boring, this is awesome. Blueberry aroma does exactly needed refreshing kick and pleasantly makes up to aroma, palate flavor. In other aspects I liked this brew as well. Sweet, quite light roasted maltiness, bit licorice, nice dark choco and ofc.. blueberries. Well balanced enjoyable brew

I had low expectations, but figured Id give it a try. This was surprisingly good! Not so much a blueberry flavored beer as it is a nice stout with blueberry sweetness added.

You can smell the blueberry right when you crack the cap. Flavors of unsweetened dark chocolate, toasted grains, oats, light cream and blueberry syrup. The blueberry is really kept in line well. My only wish is that the body was heavier. Otherwise, a very good beer.

Bottle. Black pour with a short brown head. Lovely blueberry notes intermingled with roasted malt and dark chocolate make up the aroma. Taste is roasted malt, dark chocolate covered blueberries, tart berries and coffee notes. Body is medium-full and slightly chewy with a dense, creamy carbonation. Lots of roasted malt and dark chocolate during the finish along with coffee notes (a lot like Green Mountain Wild Mountain Blueberry coffee) and tart blueberries. Nice!
On tap. Black with small white cap. Quite dry stouty taste with mild bitterness towards tongue root. Blueberry notes with slight bitterness on the middle.

An artsy gray label and a midnight pour. The first-rate aroma is dark and fruity, with a clear strain of blueberry syrup. The flavor is sweet, with some coffee, tamarind, strawberry, and blueberry. It appears to be brewed with real berries. Another excellent release from Dark Horse.

November 14, 2013 bottling.12 oz bottle into a tulip glass. Pours a pitch black with a mocha head that is almost stained purple/blue. Nose is chocolate covered blueberries buried beneath roasted malts and coffee. Smells really nice but its borderline smokey. Taste is smoked malts, coffee, chocolate and real blueberries. The fruit is very faint, think about it and it fades away. A nice addition to a stout though. Medium bodied and creamy yet surprisingly drinkable. Overall its an odd little stout with a cool adjunct. I wont be ignoring this one in the future. Thanks Brian!

via webshop de molen, zwart bier met schuimige bruine kraag.
aroma van mouten, chocolade, koffie, gebrande en geroosterde mouten en uiteraard een fruitig bosbes aroma.
smaken zijn redelijk zoet, redelijk bitter, zeer sterk bier, matige donkere fruiten van de bosbes, chocolade, lichte koffie, gebrande- geroosterde- en caramouten. 
medium body, romig en glad in de mond, lage co2, afdronk wat droog en koffie/chocolade. vrij korte afdronk
I thought this was a good beer but a little too "thin", I wish it was a bit more "creamy". I would drink it again.

Pours nearly black and slick with the most minimal tan head that bubbles to a coating and fades to the barest rim. Aroma is blueberry oatmeal and coffee. Breakfasty. Taste mellow the blueberry to a faint note and brings forth oatmeal, roasted grains and lightly burnt coffee. Aftertaste is roast cocoa and blueberry. Medium body and somewhat slick on the palate. Almost no carbonation. A decent stout that uses the blueberries in an appropriately subtle way. Let it warm up a bit. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The Tres Blueberry Stout pours a thick black with a dark brown head that leaves fair lacing. The aroma is roasty and blueberry. The flavor is blueberry and roasty with a touch of cream. This is a nice thick and filling stout. Overall this is a good beer.

12oz bottle poured into stout glass. Very dark brownand opaque. Half finger of tan head that settles to a ring. Aroma is roasty with clear but not overpowering blueberry. Also, there is dark roast coffee and a little alcohol. Taste is initially roast coffee and dark cocoa bitterness with blueberry and chocolate sweetness. Medium-full body, creamy and a bit oily in texture, low carbonation, lingering berry sweetness on the finish.
Tap at Pizza Luce. Black with a thin brown head. Blueberries, graham crackers, malty, and light earthy hop aromas. Taste is dry is with light earthy bitterness. Body is medium with a bubbly feel.

2014 bottle to a tulip glass. Pours black with a really nice brown head that subsides pretty quickly. Very full aroma that comes across as "meaty." Dark malt with some roast, a little cocoa, some blueberry that is sort of acrid. Taste is blueberry and dark malt up front with the roast and bittersweet chocolate in the middle. Settles into a coffee like bitterness on the tongue. Has a strange herbal/berry aftertaste. A medium-full body with a little sting to the mouthfeel. Finishes dry. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein sehr dunkles fast schwarzes Bier mit schöner cremigen Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr röstmalzig, süß schokoladig, Kaffee, fruchtig. Geschmack süß schokoladig, Kaffee, leicht bitter röstmalzig.

Pours dark brown, almost black with an amazing dark brown head. Aromas of blueberry, like in blueberry pancakes or waffles, lots of roast and sme bitter chocolate/coffee aromas. Slight caramel notes as well. Taste is nice. Comes across roasty with hints of blueberry. Finish is more bitter chocolate. That finish swirls with the blueberry to leave a nice sweet sticky taste on your lips. Body lacks a bit. Medium at best.

From notes, consumed on 5/24/13. Bottle poured into a snifter. Pours jet black with a finger of tan head that fades quickly. Aromas of big blueberries, chocolate, coffee, light roast. Tasting notes of big blueberries, coffee, dark chocolate, slight roast. Medium body with a semi-dry finish.

Poured a bottle of this into a pilsner glass. Was a deep brown almost black with a medium tan head. Aroma was roared malt with a very light whiff of blueberry. Taste is coffee, roasted malt and a pleasant subtle blueberry. Was expected a full fruity tatted but it is understated who makes it very good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at Good Dog. Pitch dark purple pour with a tight off-white head, that mostly disappears. I love blueberries but in general hate any blueberry beers, but this one mostly works. Coffee/chocolate/ash/spice stout with dark fruit blueberry alongside. In balance, works surprisingly well. Sweet at first but a nice dry cocoa finish. Deep and rich. Nice.

Draft at JD Reardons - pours black with tan head . Soft roast and faint blueberry aromas . Taste - cocoa , light roast coffee , fresh blueberry. The cocoa lingers a bit . Very good . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nice blueberry aroma and very subtle blueberry taste. Just downright delicious. Highly reccomend.

Bottle 330 ml at home, from Secret Sinterklaas, thanks! Into a snifter. ABV 7.5%
Black colour on the body, with a thin brown head. Good retention for its size, a thin line persisting around the glass along with a big foamy island on the surface.
Great aroma! Roasted malts and chocolate, together with intense blueberry and light alcohol. The aroma reminds me of some fruity liqueurs we had at home, like mint or kumquat.
Taste enhances those memories, at least at first, since its quite sweet, with obvious alcohol although relatively low, blueberries are there too, and near the finish the roasted malts appear along with bitter chocolate. Mildly bitter aftertaste with a short duration.
Medium body, good carbonation.
Overall, and memories brought back aside, a great stout.

Draft at Lost Dog Dunn Loring. Poured a motor oil black, with a small, brown head on top. Aroma is light blueberries, roasted malts. I was a bit skeptical, as a lot of these blueberry beers taste a tad artificial. Aroma was a check for it being okay, so it was so far, so good. Flavor was an initial blast of blueberry - tasting a bit like a blueberry muffin. Later sips were a lot less blueberry in nature, mostly dark, bitter roasted character. Not too bad.
Dark body brown head. Blueberry aroma. Taste is a bit sweet and berry but a bit less impressive than the aroma. Not bad.

Aroma is blueberry, light malt and somewhat thin. Appearance is dark dark brown with a tinge of blue/purple. Leaning towards a darker brown head. Taste is bitter, decently malty, more stout flavor than expected, and then, of course, blueberry is very present. Mouthfeel is decent, a little harsher carbonation than expected but thick for sure. Overall, this is different in a good way.

I thought this was a great stout it has a great aroma and the blueberry gives a great taste with the chocolate in the stout. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On draft at Global Brew. Huge aroma of blueberry muffins, jet black with minimal head. Surprisingly not as much blueberry when tasted. Flavors of chocolate, roasted malt with subtle blueberry. Not thick or syrupy, rather pleasant. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Has a caramel blueberry aroma with a dark brown color. A slight blueberry flavor with a long malty chocolate finish.
12 oz bottle purchased at Giant Eagle on Rte. 8 in Pittsburgh. Lots of nice heaviness surrounded with a subtle bouquet of fresh blueberries. Some notes of chocolate and malt.

Special tap at Dark Horse. This is beautiful. A nice dark black pour with a dark khaki head. Minimal lace. The aroma is big in blueberry. It's sweet, with a licorice tone that's to die for. The flavor is bitter blueberry with incredible malt characters. The mouth feel is incredibly thick. And the flavors last beautifully. A solid solid brew

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a dark brown with a foamy brown head. Smells like blueberries. Taste is subtle blueberry with roast malts. Well-balanced and very tasty.

Had this first at the autumn be review, then decided I needed to buy it to make sure I told myself the right stuff after trying a plethora of brews at abr... yep! Amazing beer, smells and tastes of blueberry and chocolate, color is good, little light for body, but Ill say this... Out of over 100 beers I tried this was the one that stood out to me at abr!!
Bottle. Near black with a small, dark brown head. Strong blueberry and chocolate malt aromas. Similar flavors. Lighter body than the rest in their stout series.

Great beer, easy to drink. Wonderful complex blueberry taste without tasting too fruity or girly. Nice solid black appearance and great aroma. Well balanced.

Tasted from bottle. Pours a very dark brown almost black with thick beige head. Huge blueberry aroma mixed with roasted malt, chocolate and coffee. Taste is definite blueberry notes mixed with the roasted malt. Nice balance of sweetness of fruit with the roasted stout quality. Definitely not overly sweet. You do get the expected coffee notes with some chocolate tastes. Minimal bitterness. Medium to full bodied. Not as heavy as dark horses other stouts. Sweet and creamy mouthfeel. Most fruit beers are not my thing but this is an exception. I like a few of their other stouts better but this is still very good.
