Bottle, in trade from Sammy. Hearty looking near black pour with a dense brown head. Firm roast character dominates the aroma and palate, very full bodied, lots of burnt bean and bitter chocolate, but with a lovely perfumey natural blueberry essence that really sneaks up on you. What makes this so excellent is that the fruit here manages to be elegant and understated even thought the beer itself is big and hearty. Really great!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: A fantastic stout. Chefs have known for a long time that blueberries and chocolate are a great pairing. Its good to see a brewery figure it out too. Awesome aromas of blueberries and cream. Flavors are roasted malt, chocolate, earth, lactose, and blueberry rounding it out. Smooth and creamy mouthfeel. Excellent.

Dark midnight pour with cocoa head thats a sixteenth inch high. No definitive scent, way too light, sweet blueberry cream. Low carbonation, frothy creamy mouthfeel, roasty dry finish. Lots of carmely roast malt in the flavor with sweet blueberries and roasty dark chocolate. Nice stout with unique sweetness.

Pours a deep dark black with a minimal beige head. Smells of roasted malt and blueberries, though not overpowering. Taste is burnt chocolate, slight blueberry and cream. Rather sweet but again not over powering. Mouthfeel is wonderful, bitter chocolate and malt lingers for a while. Overall, I was skeptical of the blueberry but it is not potent enough to overpower the beer. It is well and balanced. Try it.

Bottle - Pours black with a tan head. Nose actually has a good amount of blueberry on it, like a blueberry pie with some milky sweetness, with a dry, ashy stout base behind it. Less blueberry in the taste. Its just a hint here, with the dry, roasted stout taking the forefront. Very thin, with minimal carbonation. Decent.
Great take. Pours black, foamy tan head. Big blueberry cobbler aroma. Chocolate blueberry and granola taste. Thick body and light carbonation for a nice mouth feel. Real good.

On tap at Dark Horse. Black with brown lacing. Light roasty aroma, with buckets of blueberries. Taste is very good; roasty, chocolatey, blueberry, and light spice. Thick and creamy body. I love the combination of chocolatey flavours with the blueberries. A winner.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours black with a tan head. Taste sweet, blueberry, chocolate. I thought this was good. I could drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Number three in the best beer series Ive ever had. Blueberry is present but not overpowering or too sweet. Also a great chocolate flavor hidden in there. Its like the blueberry and chocolate are playing peek-a-boo with my tastebuds!

Black pour with mocha head. Im always apprehensive about adjunct beers like this but the nose on this blows me away. The stout and blueberry characters are properly proportioned to highlight each other. Theres a nice little spice and vanilla note as well. Makes me thing of quality hot chocolate and grandmas blueberry pie. Almost as exciting on the palate with a nearly flawless marriage of flavours. Quite full bodied with a lasting finish. Colour me impressed.

Pours a very dark brown with a very deep brown colored head. Very nice looking beer. Backs that up with a great natural blueberry and coffee smell. The taste was also pretty good but the one area that I thought could be better. Still good stuff though. Im definitely a fan of this one.
Very solid stout. Smells like blueberry pancakes. Appearance is dark brown, nearly black.
Bottle..Pour is dark..Nose is blueberry pie, sweet, roast, earth..Taste Blueberry, spice, chocolate, sweetness..

12 oz. bottle. Pours an inky black. Very thin purple-ish head. Aroma is lots of blueberry with some roast and light coffee. The blueberry is more subtle in the taste, and the coffee is more apparent. For a stout, this is pretty easy drinking. Not bad.

Bottle: almost black, slightly lighter than the other stouts of the series it seems with a creamy, frothy leather & tan head that shows very nice retention. Aroma is dense, sweet blueberry syrup, slightly concentrated with some dark chocolate fudge & slightly roasted malt to balance it out. Taste is cascaded with more blueberry & dense blueberry syrup... Sweet but not cloying with some bittersweet fudge & very timid black coffee in the back-end. Large roasted malt character adds some bitterness, perhaps with a touch of floral/herbal hops. Blueberries dominate, though, & get even more powerful with warmth. Nice take on the fruited stout from Dark Horse, though it may be my least favorite of the series. Still quite nice.

Tap, Beer Temple, Amsterdam. Black looks with a small tan head. Nose was chocolate, roasted malts and a hint of blueberry. Flavour was somewhat similar. Dried out towards the finish. Smooth, rich and drinkable. Maybe could have done with a bit more blueberry presence, but decent all the same.
355ml bottle at 7.5%. Pours black with a small head. Aroma is blueberries and light smoked ham. Taste is blueberries to start and a smoky coffee finish.
Brotig malziger Antrunk, röstig, süßlich. Leichter Hopfen, hintergründige Fruchtigkeit. Vollmundig malzig bleibend, starke Karbonisierung. Eigen. 9/11/8/10/8/10
Aroma is sweet blueberry appearance is dark with light head, taste is sweet blueberry and malts. Good combo

Pours a dark purple with no head. Smells of blueberry and mocha and tastes about the same

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Finally, a fruity stout that is really good. The tardy sweetness of the blueberry is nicely balanced with the roastedness of the stout. Good beer.

Bottle. Pours black with a creamy finger thick mocha head. Aroma is roasted malts, forest berries and blueberries. Full creamy body with soft carbonation. Flavour is sweet with chocolate and muscovado, blueberries, vanilla, oak and notes of leather. Sweet finish.

12oz bottle. Pours a deep black color with a one inch brown foamy head and heavy lace. Aroma is sweet and earthy, with a powerful natural blueberry aroma. Taste is very unique; flavors of coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malt and blueberry. Thicker, light syrupy body, moderate carbonation.
bottle. Black with small head. Rich roasty stout with very mild blueberry flavor. Blueberry less subtle as it warms. Not bad, but doesnt really do much for me either.
Bottle. Pours black with a large brown head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, port, floral and caramel. Taste is medium bitter and medium sweet. Full bodied and soft carbonation.

Huge mocha head over black body. Aroma of roast and blueberries, bitter-sweet chocolate, burnt toast, ash. Taste of roast, chocolate, ash, burnt toast. Blueberry flavor very subtle, but getting more pronounced in palate and in subsequent sips. Very dry. I would hesitate to call this a sweet stout. But it is quite good nonetheless.
@ Bishops Arms, Marina Plaza, Helsingborg. Fat (85:-). Mycket blåbär i doften, inte lika mycket i smaken, där finns det i stället en hel del choklad.
12 ounce bottle. Thanks Mike! Pours a very dark brown with a nice tan head. Aroma of malt, chocolate, and berries. Taste is roasted malt, dark chocolate, blueberries, and vanilla. Very good.

In aroma some blueberry is to be found. However in taste it is very subtle. Murky brown and medium bodied. Would be nice to have a little more body. Very balanced and subtle.

Poured deep, dense brown with a huge frothy beige head. Aroma of mocha with blueberry. Medium body, flavour of vanilla smoothness over slightly sweet blueberry and a dry but sweet end.
My favorite taste of the Pittsburgh Beer Fest 2013. Strong blueberry flavor over a chocolatey coffee stout. Excellent!

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; dark brown pour with a big tan head, big blueberry aroma, fruit doesnt come through in the taste mostly roasted malts and plain chocolate some dried fruits and sweetness, subdued carbonation.
UPDATED: DEC 22, 2013 Bottle from HOTB. Poured black with minimal head. Pleasant fresh  blueberry aroma. Slightly bitter choc taste.
Dark black pour with no head at Jerry's. blueberry is definatly in the smell and taste. Also peppery and has a burnt backbone. Pretty good but not understanding the high rating.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 01.07.2013, 0,35l bottle @ NY hotel room:
Big brown creamy longlasting head. Aroma is rish and slightly fruity, dark malts, coffee, blueberry, salty licorice, dark chocolate, dark sugar, caramel. Taste is slightly burnt and dry, dark malts, ash, burnt caramel, grass, dark berries, berry skin, licorice. Longlasting bitterness. Nice, but again its the taste that drags a Dark Horse beer down from a top score.

Bottle, 2nd Tuesday Tasting @ De Molen. Black colour, tan head. Nose has mocca, chocolate, some roasted malts, light fruityness. Flavour is chocolate and coffee, roasted malts, bit of blueberries. Toasty finish. Good stuff.

Bottle at home. Pours opaque black with a large, frothy brown head, medium retention with spare lacing. Aroma is blueberry, roast and chocolate malt, and light earthy hops, some prune notes late. Flavor is dark chocolate and roasted malt, subdued blueberry, light hops and bitterness with a dry finish.
Bottle at home. Black with dark tan head. Blueberry, coffee, vanilla and roast aroma, roasty, sweetish blueberry and bitter taste, full body, vanilla-alcoholic aftertaste, carbonated. Good.

Bottle from polo, thanks man! Pours a rich black with nice tan head. Not much going on at first in terms of smell, but as the glass sat Idle, the smelll of blueberrys lit up my basement...taste is somewhat mellow with a hit of coffee and and a bit of blueberry. Cool.

Bottle @ de Molen. Dark color, medium brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, blueberry, licorice, hint of chocolat. Im not a big fan of the blueberry notes in regular English stouts, so when theres actually blueberry in it, its not my kind of beer. Its a bit dry in taste as well, together with some fruity sweetness. Its actually not that sweet for a sweet stout, more dry. Ok stuff, but not my kind of beer.

Bottle at the De Molen July 2nd Tuesday tasting. Poured a dark mahogany with a frothy tan head. The aroma is roasted malt and blueberries with a little caramel too. The flavour is big roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate and with a hint of sweetness on the palate. A super beer I must say. It has everything.
7.5 ABV Caramel thin head. Taste and smell of many (!) blueberries. Aroma should be a little thicker and maybe little rounder. Slightly sour. Nice beer.

Sampled from bottle @ De Molen monthly tasting. Opaque pitch black color, medium sized light brown head. Aroma of malts, dark malts, roastyness, blueberry. Taste also clearly has blueberries and roastyness with a firm malty basis. Soft texture, medium body, gentle carbonation. Dry finish with some fruityness and roastyness. Nice.

Dark with a beautiful brown head. Aroma of blueberries with sweet stout. Not that much taste, some blueberries mocha, chocolate and roasted malts. Could use a bit more taste. Low to medium body. Soft carbo.

Bottle @ 2nd Tuesday tasting at De Molen, hosted by dEnk. Pitch black pour, thin tan head. Aroma full of blueberries, roasted, ashy and spicy. Flavor is fruity with sweet blueberries, slightly sour, ashy and roasted. Decent body and very natural blueberries. Nice brew.

Sample at the molen monthly tasting.
Thin tan head. Clear blueberry aroma. Very smooth. Clear black pour. Blueberries taste.

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2014 Beetje waterig maar wel lekker.

Helaas kan ik hier geen goede rating voor geven aangezien ik de avond niet goed heb genoteerd wat ik van alle biertjes vond die ik gedronken heb. Dit is dus een rating die ik ingeschat heb.

12oz bottle poured into a goblet. Label says 7.5% ABV.
Opaque black with a decent mocha head.
Chocolate cream aroma with pleasant roastiness, vanilla and mild berry notes.
Dark cocoa flavors, some espresso, a hint of tart fruitiness, medium bitterness and faint vanilla.
Creamy, well balanced, med-full bodied, a bit oily, complex and quite great.

A black beer with a beautiful, big and dark brown head. Aroma of roasted malts and coffee, some sweetness and liquirice, also bluberries and hint of chocolate. Taste is roasted, lots of blueberries, chocolate and some soft liquirice. In the aftertaste blueberries and liquirice. Medium+ bodied, smooth carbonation, almost velvety to drink. Interesting stout with lots of blueberries, and they are giving a fresh nuancee to this beer. The good stout.

12oz bottle in an English pint. Pours black with a lacy, tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, some dark chocolate and coffee, hints of blueberry, and a light bitterness. Flavor the same with the blueberry mostly masked by the stout malts. Average to smooth texture. A pretty good stout.

Bottle. Better Beer Of The Month Club. Black opaque with a beige to brown head, bursting aroma of blueberries, chocolate and roasted malt, flavor of coffee, roasted malt, chocolate, cocoa, medium to full bodied, pretty surprising

Pours black with dark tan head. So much coffee on the nose, the blueberry barely registers. Strong coffee and smoke in the taste, blueberry is subdued but begins improve with warmth. Subtle, very good.

UPDATED: JUN 25, 2013 Bottle. Better Beer Of The Month Club. 7.5%. Black-colored with a big brown head, a bit creamy. Roasty aroma with dark chocolate and blueberry. Roasty flavor, sweetish and slightly bitter and acidic, with coffee, dark chocolate, cocoa and faint notes of blueberry. Bitter aftertaste. Medium-bodied, maybe just a bit too carbonated. Good stuff.
UPDATED: JUN 13, 2013 Pours black with tons of tan head. Aroma is roast and light alcohol. Taste is very creamy roasted malt, sweet and bitter finish. Not detecting much blueberry, but very nice.

Bottle @ home. Aroma is pretty big blueberry, slight roast and chocolate. Flavour is roasty malt, again big blueberry, some red fruits, faint hint of roasty sourness. Lingering roasty fruity bitterness. A bit thin, but very nice.

Pours a motor oil colour with a dark khaki head. Nose is a little roast, but overwhelming of blueberries. Tastes a little roasted malt but there is a ton of sweetness. Blueberries. There is a little touch of fluoride though.
Blue berrys and stout.  Not a whole lot of sweet or tart.  Not super impressed with fruit beers.

12 oz bottle into a Samuel Smith pint glass.

A: Pours a nearly black color, similar to the Too cream stout. Aggressively poured, this features a four-finger tan colored head. Like its brethren, it seriously looks like an imperial stout.

S: There is some unsweetened chocolate and roasted barley here, but beneath that is a slight hint of blueberry. Not enough to kill the balance by any stretch, but enough to interest the olfactory senses.

T: At first, the typical notes of roast, chocolate, and coffee open things up. But then the finish comes, loaded with blueberry. I feel like the blueberry notes do a good job of not getting in the way of the stout qualities - some sips sees the roast/chocolate win out, others see the blueberry as the dominant flavor. Ultimately, the two elements blend together reasonably well.

M: Compared with One and Too, this seems rather thin. This aids drinkability admirably, however it doesnt have the decadent feel of the other two.

O: Not a pure stout, but it works well as a stout/fruit beer hybrid. The blueberry does a good job of blending in with the base, never fully overpowering things. Id gladly drink this one again.

bottle.  black with a huge, foamy, brown head.  blueberry muffins, baked bread, chocolate, roasted barley aroma.  carbonation is bit high.  flavors of roasted bitter dark chocolate, milk chocolate, blueberry muffins, caramel.  dude....thats awesome.  this beer is stupid good.  the only thing that would make this better for me is less of the foamy carbonation.
Polaren sätter direkt att det är blåbär i. Faktiskt lite imponerande utan att veta. Kaffe dominerar ju annars i denna pjäs. På tap på oconnor. Bra stämning

Refrigerated 12 oz. brown bottle obtained through trade with JStax poured into a English pint glass.  Pours black with small beige head.  Medium small bubble lacing, thick body, and medium carbonation.  Aroma is roasted blueberry.  Taste is sweet roasted malt and blueberry.
On tap @ Orested ölbar. Pours black, with minimal head and carbonation. Aroma of dark chocolate and coffee, taste is similar, with a slight fruitiness in the finish

Bottle.  Must have had a bad bottle my first go round because the second was much better.  Dark pour with small khaki head.  Blueberry, coffee and malt aroma.  Strong coffee taste with only a hint of blueberry.  Decent stout.

Serving: 12 oz. bottle via trade.  It pours pretty much black with a small, tan head.  The nose is almost all blueberries with a hint of roast on the back end.  The flavor is a mix of sweet chocolate, blueberries, light earth, coffee, and roast.  Medium to full bodied with a medium finish.  While its well made, the flavor combination just didnt hit on all cylinders for me.

Bottle. 4/27/13. Pours opaque brown-black with a thick and dense brown head. Aroma is blueberry, yeast, chocolate, creamy, grass, spicy, some vanilla. Taste is creamy and a bit farmyard; spicy, grassy, hay, blueberry, coffee. Some nice lacing. Medium carbonation. Slick and soft with a medium body. Not bad at all.

Draft at Proletariat with Andrew, PJ, Brendan and Dubra. Pours a deep dark black body with thin tan lacing around the rim of my sniffer. aroma is pure blueberries!! Wow. Mouthfeel is medium to full with nice notes of blueberries, light tartness, vague chocolate and light roast.

The aroma is nice, roasted coffee, blueberries.  Jet black pour, pillow-like tan head.  The flavor is roasted coffee upfront, blueberry making itself noticeable, bitter chocolate.  The finish is roasty, light sweet berries, pine needles.  Medium/thick in body, creamy.  Really nice.
Black, frothy brown head. Nose is roasted malts, blueberry pancake. Taste is more pronounced blueberry, roasted malts, chocolate, cardboard. Smooth creamy medium mouthfeel.
Pours very dark with a brown head. Aroma is a bit of roasted malt and berry. Taste is roast, vanilla and light berry. Lively carbonation with a sweet smoth finish.

Pours opaque black with a thick one finger brown head that sticks. The nose reminds me of Blueberry Morning breakfast cereal. A sweetened dehydrated blueberry aroma flits above the surface, but underneath is an almost nutty bran muffin and hint of dark chocolate. The flavor is not quite as integrated as the nose. It starts off with an artificial blueberry flavor with a tinge of sweetener that somewhat sloppily transitions into a moderate roasty finish by way of a kick of tartness and astringency on the mid-palate.

Nice stout. Blueberry is mostly in hints and not overly strong. Earthy coffee notes as well. Good finish. I'd keep my eyes open for this one. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle poured a clear dark reddish brown with a small lasting tan head. Aromas of blueberry, roasted malt, cocoa and light vanilla. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of blueberry, roasted malt, dark chocolate and light vanilla with a smooth lingering roasty blueberry finish.

Thanks Mike. Enjoyed in a wine glass. Huge blueberry nose. has a dark blueberry hue in the head and body. Very unique! roasted and heavy with dark malts but this tart blueberry taste. Perhaps too much blueberry syrup but overall, a nice tasting beer as the weather warms up!

Black pour with little head into the glass. Aroma of blueberries, coffee, and chocolate. Faint blueberry flavor with a dark chocolate, black coffee bite. Enough sweetness to balance out the malts. Tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nose was a blueberry explosion. Palate was not as much blueberry. Mixed in some nice coffee and chocolate notes. Pretty damn tasty.

Aroma is big blueberry and roasted malt/toast. Some chocolate and earthy aromas, too. Pour is dark black, thin head. Flavor is big blueberry, some toasted bread, roast, chocolate, and coffee. Good stuff

12oz. Bottle
Appearance - Oil-black pour, chocolate head
Aroma - Burnt blueberry Pop Tarts
Taste - Robust roasted malts, bittersweet blueberry, smoke, dark chocolate

This was a wonderfully done stout. Lots of blueberry and dark chocolate in this one make a twisted, almost smoky finish. Thanks for sharing this one, OmegaX.

On tap at Mekong, ordered this one despite the fact that it let me know that it was a blueberry stout.  Poured black.  Aroma was strongly of blueberries - even the people standing next to me could smell it.  Some light chocolate notes as well.  Hits the palate as a medium bodied, slightly sweet stout - stout flavors tend towards chocolate with some faint coffee notes.  The blueberry flavor is less pronounced than in the aroma, but still present - actually quite complimentary.  For some reason, it strikes me as an almost, but not quite, artificial blueberry flavor.  Probably because of the juxtaposition of the fruit notes over the stout notes.  But not bad - for a blueberry stout.
Very dark, mocha head. Burnt blueberry, malt, smoke. Rich smoky blueberry, blackberry, rye, creamy.

Pours black with a huge, dark brown head.
Aroma is chocolate, coffee, and blueberry muffin...roasty.
Taste is the same...sweet, with the blueberry imparting a slight bitter.
I had my doubts about this one, but it works... and works well.
Not even a big fan of blueberries, but I found it quite good.

Pours like  an imperial stout - very thick and full bodied looking. Looks very slick and viscous. Black with a small tan head. Wonderful combination aroma of blueberries and roasted malts... Really gorgeous nose. Taste is blueberries up front, not overly sweet or artificial, but just a great blueberry flavor followd by a whole heap of roast on the backend. Very good stuff. The more Dark Horse beers I drink, the more I like this brewery.

First time I have been able to try this beer.  Again from Michigan beer trip.  Slight bitterness from blueberrys match well with coffee and slightly sweet Chocolatey base.  These guys really know how to use fruit in their beers and this beer is a great example of it.

Dark brownish black. Brown head, medium turned soapy with a lasting brown ring. Aroma is intoxicating,  is like a coffee and blueberry muffin, roasty. Flavor matches, coffee and a blueberry muffin, roasted malt. Body is lighter side of medium, slightly bitter, roasty finish. I really enjoyed this.

Pours a deep black with a deep tan, dense head that leaves a great amount of lacing on the glass. Aroma has a deep roasted malt nose, light chocolate, strong blueberry aroma, almost a Boo Berry-type nose. Flavor has a great blueberry presence with a solid amount of late roasted bitterness with some mild chocolate flavors to help take the edge off of the blueberry sweetness. The body of the brew is light with a great amount of fine carbonation. Overall a pretty good brew. Sweetness is present and is kept balanced with the malt bill present in this brew.

Deep dark pour with a solid, long-lived tan head. The aroma is pretty remarkable - smells like a blueberry pie with hints of chocolate. Much less blueberry in the flavor. Instead, the ratio is flipped and chocolate dominates with hints of blueberry still present. The mouthfeel is a little dry/chalky, but doesnt detract too much. Nice beer.

Aroma and appearance carry the score. Black/purple pour with mocha head. Smells like blueberry pie. Perfect blueberry pie. Tastes like I am sucking on a piece of chalk. Smells/looks perfect, tastes like crap. I will look at this and smell this all day long. Would prefer a colonoscopy over tastong it.

Typical stout appearance. Near black opaque body with a thick beige head. The aroma brings the blueberries right away. Blueberry, chocolate, roast. Smells very inviting. The flavor offers more roast and chocolate initially, with blueberries coming in mid palate. Quite tasty. Medium bodied with a bit of sweetness, but not nearly as much as I was expecting. Dry finish. I would definitely have this again.

12 ounce bottle in an American shaker pint. Number three, "tres," of the DH stout lineup. Aroma had no hint of those blueberries. I got a woodsy, soil and smoke aroma. Appearance was pretty weird. It was a dark black and hyperactively foamy. The cap nearly popped off the bottle and then upon pouring it had a soda-like bubble action of rapidly fizzling, dark brown foam on top - not the slow movement foam you usually see on a beer. Taste was comparable to the aroma package: smoke, earth, wood, and dry. Where are those blueberries?! Palate was bubbly at first but it flattens out rapidly. Medium to heavy bodied. It coats your mouth with the smoke and malt resin aspects. Overall, this one fits in with the Dark Horse smoky stout herd. I like how they have five different stouts that each take a slightly different approach, but the differences are subtle enough to make me either do a side by side comparison, or just come to the conclusion that the labels are the biggest difference among the bunch.

12oz bottle pours a dark black/brown with a small deep tan head. Aroma is heavy on the blueberries, with some roast, chocolate, licorice, and molasses. Taste of roasted malts, licorice, some chocolate, and berries. Not crazy about this one but not horrible.

Bottle. Earthy roasty coffee, chocolate, and light berry aroma. Black with a moderate dark brown head. Berry, dark roast coffee, and chocolate flavor.  Medium full body, lively carbonation. Very roasty, and the blueberry lingers in the finish.

Pours black with brown head. Smell of sweet and roasty malt. As it warms up a bit you start to smell the blueberrys. Taste of sweet bitter oats, with hint of blue berry as the carbination settles down. A nice stout.
On tap.  Pours black with off white head.  Aroma is roasty with some fruity sweetness.  Taste is bitter, roast, blueberry, very good.  Would drink again.
Chocolate-covered blueberries. This one strikes a nice balance of stout and blueberry to start and finished with a dry roasted malt characteristic.
Bottle pour black.  Nose lots of blueberry with faint hint of chocolate and roast.   Taste initial blueberry, followed by roast, chocolate, and late bitter.  Nice mouthfeel and length.

Amazing. Blueberry very well-integrated. Aroma of blueberry, cream, dark chocolate, roast malt, some coffee.  Thick palate, thick consistency. Average carbonation with mocha head and good lacing. Huge palate that starts off bittersweet and ends in dark chocolate and coffee. Bottle.

12 oz bottle courtesy of Mike. Thanks. Pours a dense black color with a small tan head that soon dissipates to a fine ring. The aroma is big and bold with fresh blueberries bursting in my face. The taste is a step back from the nose with coffee, mocha, earthy hops and blueberry all vying for attention. The palate is full and creamy with lively somewhat distraction carbonation. The finish was long with lingering bitter dark chocolates. Overall: Very interesting, Id drink again, and I loved the nose--lots of fresh blueberry aroma that filled the whole room.

Chocolate covered blueberries. Aroma reminds me of that can of mini blueberries from the Sara Lee muffin mix box. Taste is still a bit more watered down than the 2011 batch, which is still the Tres gold standard for me. That stuff was in-your-face awesome.

Beautiful dark DARK purple pour, not very carbonated.  Little head.  Smells like the blueberry syrup I use on my waffles.  Never liked any blueberry beers so here it goes... Im not sure what to think. Thickness is right, has the bitterness found in other good chocolate/coffee stouts but this reminds me of the bitter seed you find in a blackberries but with a hint of blueberry background. Probably the best blueberry beer Ive had,  but thats not saying much.

Aroma of moderate coffee roast, sweet blueberry and dark chocolate. Appearance is oily black with creamy mocha head. Flavor is coffee roast up front; the chocolate and blueberry show themselves near the finish. Palate is big, frothy and creamy. Pretty good, but not the best stout Ive had today.

12 oz bottle pours an opaque dark brown with decent tan head and some lacing.  Smell is of blueberry pancakes.  Aroma has blueberries, roasted malts, and  touches of chocolate and smoke.  Taste is sweet with a slightly dry finish.  Body is only medium, with average carbonation.  Surprisingly good, and would be great if it werent so thin for a stout.
Draft to taster. Looks good; black with foamy beige head. Smells solid; blueberries and dark malt with some roastiness. Tastes like it smells with an average mouthfeel. A solid spin on the style.

Pours a nice dark color with a frothy tan head that lasts a good while. Aroma is nice and toasty with a great sweet blueberry note also also notes of chocolate and coffee.  Flavor is nice and smooth with toasted blueberry initially with also some coffee notes. The flavor turns into a nice bittersweet finish that stays smooth throughout. Mouthfeel is average and carbonation is decent. Overall this is a great beer I would hapily drink again.

Pours a cola brown color with a quickly vanishing tan head.  Aroma of blueberry, roasted malt, and dark chocolate.  More roasted malt and chocolate flavor than blueberry, but blueberry is present.  Very well-balanced beer.

Bottle,  Pours an ultra dark purple color with a nice dark brown head that fades slowly and never completely goes away.  Aromas are fresh blueberries, roasted malt, chocolate and light smoke.  Kinda smells like burnt blueberry pancakes, very nice.  Taste is more roasty and smokey than the aroma would suggest but the blueberry taste is still very present.  Really nice balance flavors.  Finish is smooth but a tad watery.  The thin body knocks this down from being a great stout to just a very good stout.
Bottle. Pours a dark brown with a tan head. Dark blueberry sweetness comes through in the aroma. Taste is sweet and fruity with a lingering bitterness.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with a nice brown head with moderate lacing.Big sweet blueberry aroma meshed with chocolate and roast. Taste is like a chocolate blueberry muffin with a sip of espresso.Taste becomes a bit artificial and cloying on the palate. Surprisingly good.

Pours black with a big roasted mocha head.  Aroma of bitter dark chocolate, heavily roasted coffee beans, and a blueberry cupcake.  Barely taste the blueberry at all - all bitter chocolate and roasted coffee.  Light/Medium bodied - slight watery feel.

Bottle.  Blueberry is most notable in initial scent.  Flavor is largely roast malt, and chocolate.  Seemed higher in carbonation.  Smooth drinking good tasting stout.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
12 oz bottle. Redish tan pour. Slight blueberry and malt aroma. A bit of a chocolate blueberry taste. A carbonated head sticks around for a while.

12oz bottle - pours dark brown with cherry red/brown head and good lacing.  Nose is coffee and blueberries.  Flavor adds chocolate.  Interesting.  roasted/burnt aroma.  Sweet from the blueberries but way more bitter from the roast.  dry on the lips.  I dont know if I like the blueberry flavor in a stout.

Wasnt sure about this one but worth a try. Pours pitch black with a brown one finger head. Really gorgeous pour. Aroma not helping me want to drink this. I can tell it is a mix of blueberry and chocolate, but really, it kind of smells like vomit (by kind of, I mean it literally smells like last nights dinner coming back for an encore). Just weird. Luckily, the flvaor starts out okay. Not much blueberry going on to start, but the flavor is very roasty with hints of chocolate. Definite bitterness--not expected at this level from a sweet stout--and there are definitely hops here. Slight tinge of blueberry. Roasty smokey aftertaste with some cocoa. 

As I get through it a bit more the blueberry really starts coming out on the finish, and then all the way through. This just ends up becoming an all blueberry beer. Sweeter and sweeter as I go. Ultimately a drainpour. I just cant deal with this one. Admittedly, I am not a huge blueberry fan anyway.

Higher carbonation for a stout, which keeps it a bit lighter than It actually is on the palate. Overall I guess they hit what they were going for. But need to work on that truly effed up aroma pI would think even for those who are blueberry fans. Certainly different and interestingly complex, but not for me. It was worth a try.

12oz bottle sent by northernbrews as an extra, thanksJeff!  Pours black with a light brown head, aroma has a little bit of chocolate with just a touch of the sweetness of blueberry, actually pretty nice, the flavors have more of the chocolate coming through than the fruit but you can tell the blueberry is there without it being overbearing.  Really nice stuff.
Bottle. Roasty coffee malt, major blueberry and some caramel. This is a great stout. I really could drink this one every day.

Poured pitch black with dark brown head, tons of small bubbles and left a very thick lacing on the glass, the aroma was very roasty with chocolate up front some coffee and then blueberry, the taste matched the nose with all of your regular stout characteristics up front, and then followed by a subtle blueberry flavor in the finish, this stout was very thick and rich and balanced so well, i liked how the blueberry was there but wasnt artificial or overpowering and this paired excellent with chocolate, delicious stuff here!

Pours black with a thin brown head. Aroma of blueberries and chocolate.  Taste is chocolate and malt with a strong blueberry finish. Blueberry is a bit artificial but this is still a cool beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught. Pours a very dark brown color with moderate off-white head. Nose has a nice hint of blueberries to it, which is interesting. Taste is fairly characteristic of a stout, but with some fruit and blueberry notes in there. Feels very smooth.
Dark oily black pour.  Nice scent, berry and chocolate.  Taste is much of the same, very sweet.  Impressive mix.
UPDATED: DEC 23, 2012 Very slight smell of blueberry. Not much blueberry flavor,  mostly regular stout. Nothing to special here,  a little disappointed.  Expected more fresh blueberry notes.

Bottle @ home... It pours pitch black with a small creamy tan head.... The aroma is roasted malts, berries and coffee.... The flavor is roasted malt, light dark chocolate and sweet berries..... a bit thin mouthfeel, nice bitter finish....

Dec12: Blueberry fragrance mingles with the familiar scent of chocolate, coffee and burning. nice brown head that disappears quickly. black creamy beer with a twist of blueberries. soft texture and low carbonation. Blueberries are evident in the taste, and it fits well with the sweet stout.
Smells great, not very thick or clingy for a stout.  There wasnt anything to hold all that delicious blueberry I was smelling, on the tongue.  A nice mocha after flavor.

Pours dark brown with a thick brown foam.  The smell is heavenly.  Like a chocolate blueberry muffin.  The taste is mellow semi chocolate that gives way to a very tart blueberry finish.  Its a bit too tart for me for this style of beer.  Im going to age one for a year to see if the tarness in the finish mellows out a bit.

Bottle. Pours opaque black with a small brown head that dissipates with decent lacing. Aroma is strong blueberry that fills the room when the bottle its opened, along with coffee and dark roasted malts. Flavor has much more muted blueberry notes. Medium sweet, light coffee bitter, light astringent. Light to medium body.
Sample @. SBWF 12. Dark brown colour with a medium brown head. Both aroma and flavour of blueberries, chocolate.

12oz bottle.  Black pour with a big frothy tan head.  Aroma is coffee, chocolate and light blueberry.  Tastes are toasty, chocolate, nutty, dark fruit with blueberry mixed in well.  Thin to medium creamy palate.  Even bitter finish.  Good.

Bottle @ home, picked up in a trade. Inky black pour with a small, dark brown head. Spicy, rich blueberry (almost like a blueberry muffin), dark chocolate, milky, vanilla aroma. Rich dark milk chocolate, vibrant, fresh blueberry, a bit bready, delicious flavor. Very tasty, easy drinking beer. I wish I could pick up a dozen of these each year.

Tap at the Boilermaker, Philly - 24/05/12.
Dark oily black with a small beige head.
Roasted malt nose allied to bitter chocolate and a definate pinch of blueberrys.
Tastes just as aroma. Medium bodied, good carbonation level and a creamy feel. Good stout.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: UPDATED: APR 27, 2014 Excellent stuff. The first sip had a pronounced blueberry flavor, but as my palate got used to it, it faded and became a wonderfully balanced stout. Not at all heavy or overdone.

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2014 Tap (White Horse, Parsons Green) (6:4:7:4:15=3.6)
Jammy berry aroma, deep roast too. Smooth in the mouth. Rich roasty body, burnt but soft . Finish grows in roast, finally hitting a late coffee peak - yum!
Rerate: Tap (ALEhouse, Riga) (6:4+:8-:5-:14+=3.7-)
Rich and full, but mellow, roast, hint of milkiness, but something sharp to sour too. Black, keggy tan head. Super rich roasty taste, burnt but in no  Suway astringent at all. Super smooth palate, almost moussey. Super drinkable stout. Not getting any berries except for the sharpness on thee nose. To merge these two ratings, Im gonna bump up the feature which Im always too shy to push up - palate - this felt goooood in the mouth.
Aroma is blueberries, coffee, chocolate and malts.  The flavor is blueberries, dark fruit/vinous, malts, chocolate and a tart finish.
Oh the taste. Thick malt flavor, roasted malt, and leather come to mind. The blueberries area very nice addition to what be a nice thick stout. Drinkable.

UPDATED: JUL 22, 2014 Bottle. 7.5%. No best before date. Pours black with a diminishing dark tan head. No lacing. Aroma is soft, with coffee and blueberries, the latter providing a slight tartness. Interesting combination; feels a bit like cake. Somewhat tart, perfumy blueberry flavour, with roasted notes in the background. Coffee finish with the tart, perfumy note lingering. Overall so-so... the coffe/blueberry mix works well in the aroma, but in the flavour it sort of clashes, and the perfumy note doesnt do any good either  its rather cloying in the long run. 21.07.14.

Old rating: 4  / 4 / 4 / 3 / 7 = 2.2
Bottle. Pours black with a big khaki head. Strong aroma; sweet and roasted with notes of chocolate and an off-note which increasingly reminds me of raw seitan; interesting, but doesnt work in a beer. Flavour is slightly berry-tart with a perfumy note, roasted and with that same seitan-like note as in the aroma. This doesnt work; the berry-tartness and perfume note clashes with the roasted note and the seitan-thing is just wrong here. Roasted finish, slightly tart and with a lingering note of seitan. Overall: seitan is good, but not in beer. 31.07.12.
12oz bottle, the huge blueberry nose on this is awesome, the taste is pretty good too, with the blueberry lingering... this would be a definite 4.4 or higher if i liked blueberries.

Pours dark with low brown head
Distinct blueberry aromas, chocolate, some vanilla and roasted barley
Woody taste, mild palate, low bitterness, aftertaste of blueberries and chocolate. Medium bodied. A good stout!

12 oz. bottle. It pours very thick and dark brown with a slowly building medium brown head. The aroma is strong with smashed blueberries, dark chocolate and roasted malt. The flavor is a little softer on the blueberries with more chocolate and roasted flavors. The blueberries are noticeable though, especially in the finish which is just a tad tart. The mouthfeel is very full and the beer feels pretty thick on the palate. Dirty roasted malt near the finish as well. A big stout that delivers on the blueberry without being artificial or cloying. Nice job.

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2012 Smells and tastes wonderfully of blueberrys. A nice combination with the roastiness. Apart from the blueberries, the stout lacked some character and umpf. It was also rather light in its body, which makes it relatively easy to drink, perfect for the summer.

(Bottle). Interesting aromas of berries, including blueberries, along with roasted malt and licorice. The taste is lovely fruity with nice hints of blueberries that blends surprisingly well with the taste of roasted malt. The aftertaste is very pleasant with lots of flavor nuances lying and simmer on the tongue, including licorice, blueberry and roasted malt. I must admit that before I tasted this beer I felt skeptical about a blueberry stout but this is actually really good! If you can, you must try it!

Svart öl med ett ljusbrunt skum. Förutom den klassiska doften så finn där en söt fruktig doft som jag antar kommer från blåbären. Denna finns även i smaken om än inte lika påtagligt. Bra grundöl som jag nog gillat bättre utan blåbären.
Pours deep black with a tan head. Aroma of blueberries with underlying chocolate roasted malt mixed in. Taste is blueberry mixed with roasted malt. It blends into a syrupy taste.

Poured black color, with medium size brown head.  Aroma is chocolate and blueberry, hazelnut.  Creamy palate. Poured thick.  Medium-heavy body.  Roasted malt flavor with mild blueberry flavors.  Pretty good.  Pretty smooth.  Enjoyed it.
Strong aroma of fake blueberries. Flavor is of a bitter stout, woody, dark chocolate aftertaste. The blueberries comes on very slight in the end.

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2014 Bottle shared with Damico in celebration of Radiohead.  Pours a dark color with a coffee colored head.  Aroma of roast and blueberry with caramel and slight hints of mixed fruits.  The blueberry creeps in on the front end and then quickly leaves not out staying its welcome.  Very nice balance.  Nice roasty chocolate notes mixed in.  Really good.

Dark brown/black color; Medium creamy body; Aroma of toasted sweet malt, blueberries, & chocolate; Flavor of roasted sweet malt, caramel, chocolate, blueberries, some hops, and coffee; Nicely balanced; Pretty good.
Aroma of blueberry and chocolate cake.  Pours black with a brown filthy head.  Taste is blueberry, fudge, and slight roast coffee.  Sweet without being fruity,  Tasty and easy to drink.

Draft at Beer Temple (offline rating).  Pours black with a tan head.  Aroma is dominated by blueberries with standard roasty stout aspects in the background.  Flavour is much the same - full on blueberry with roasted malts, coffee and dark chocolate in the background.  Full bodied with soft carbonation.

Ar: Jammy blueberry and dry roast.
Ap: Black and opaque - small mocha head with moderate retention.
T: Cocoa and dark caramel up front - maple syrup and blueberry mid-palate - fruit is very jammy - very low bitterness and fairly sweet, with a burnt quality on the finish.
P: Medium-full body and very smooth and luscious - medium-low carbonation - finish is medium-dry.
O: Excellent fruit beer - the blueberry aroma/flavor mingles very well with the stout and is both interesting and pleasurable to drink.

12oz bottle pour into pint glass.  I enjoyed the hint of blueberry to the toasted malts--just enough to recognized the fruit, but not so much to turn me off.  A little carbonation on the palate. Nice, slight bitterness on the finish.
Pours pitch black with a tan head. Aroma is roasted malts and blueberries. Flavor is roasted malts, coffee, blueberries and hops. Very nice.

The sweet stout pours unclear black coffee with a beautiful mocha tan head. The aroma hits you with bluebs gloriously at first with just the right berry sweetness that remain but calm to a roasted stout profile. The flavor brings dominmant blueberries balanced perfectly with roasted malts, then the blueberries settle softly and sweetly bringing out a creamy body and light but full roasted malts.

Splendid stout with a clear taste of blueberries and still not too fruity or sweet.
  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours like an oil slick, dark head fades quickly. Great blueberry aroma head but it doesnt interfere with the stout-ness of this drink. There is a slight acrid note on the backed. Oily texture, huge body, finishes dry with blueberry kick.

21st May 2012On tap at the Craft, this version 5.9%. Opaque black beer, small tan head. Viscous smooth palate, mild fine carbonation. Fresh blueberry - lots of! Rich dark malts underneath, a little roasty. Coffee and bitter dark chocolate. Finishes smooth with more blueberry. A beer of real contrasts - and the blueberry just keeps on coming!

Strong aroma of chocolate and blueberries with a black pour, flavorful and balanced taste that matches the aroma and dry mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Craft, London. Pours a deep brown, almost black colour with a medium light brown head. Foam vanishes quickly. Aroma is roasty and woody, but quite bland. Some berry-like acidic tone. Taste is sweetish and slightly acidic, with clear notes of blueberries and roasted malts. The berris actually dominate and their acidity helps cut through the bitterness. Mouthfell is medium with soft carbonation. Overall, very nice and interesting, and easy to drink, but a bit more flavour would help.

Bottles from erzbierschof in bern and on tap at ølbarn in copenhagen.  Nice malty chocolate and blueberry aroma. Pours oily and opaque, brown head.  Sweet and well-balanced.  Even smoother balance from the tap. The blueberry flavor is quite strong, even through all the stouty bitterness. Thick creamy mouth feel.  Well carbonated but not fizzy.

I love me a dark beer, and I think we can all agree that its hard to find a stout or porter with a particular fruit in its name. This beer covered all the main components of a spectacular stout and one upd it by adding a perfect amount of blueberry to it.
Smells of blueberries. Pours completely black. Tastes of chocolate, coffee and blueberries. Has a fairly pleasant mouth feel. Overall this beer was all that I wanted and was expecting... There are countless amounts of fruit wheat beers, but how many fruit stouts do you have? Blueberry wheat beer is to this stout as blueberry poptarts is to blueberry pie.

On tap at Beer Temple. Dark brown body with dark tan head. Nose is of blueberrys, also roasty stout and tar and oil and molasses. Taste is roasty, toasty and blueberrys definitely kick in. Took me a few sips to really get into it and to get it, but quite enjoyable and interesting. Well done.

On tap @ Beer Temple. Black color. Firm tan head, like mocha. Strong blueberry aroma, some roast, medium sweet. Flavor is lightly sweet, roasted. Medium body, soft carbonation. Finishes with more roast, slightly ashy, medium bitter. Nice combination.

Poured from 12oz bottle.  Pours very dark brown with a bit of tan head.  Aroma is blueberries and a touch of chocolate.  Taste is blueberries and roasted malts.  I would have loved this to be a touch sweeter.  Having had Bramble recently, I know how good a stout with berries can be, this lacked the complexity and sweetness of Bramble, but was still a really interesting beer.
On tap. Thick black with small brown head. Rich blueberry notes with some roastedness. Fantastic blueberry taste and some small hints of coffe and roasted barley. A great fruity stout.

Draft at Fountainhead. Not sure how I missed this one before. Pours a deep black/brown with a tan head. The nose is cocoa and roast, some black malt and then a soft aromatic blueberry note. Really nice and clean. On tasting, the base stout is really clean and fresh, lots of cocoa and charred notes. Balanced bitterness and the fruitiness of the blueberries is a very nice addition here. Really nice beer.

Originally reviewed: 1/4/10. Poured into my pint glass. Pours a very thick dark black with a thick mocha head on top. Retention was fair, but it left no lace at all. Scents of roasted malts, some coffee, and faint dark fruits.

The mouth on this was stellar. A thick creamy wash over the entire palate. This was almost downright chewable. Flavors of chocolate, roasted nuts, some espresso, and the slightest hints of blueberry. I appreciate the fact that this doesnt smack of cheap fruit concentrates. Wow. I was really impressed with this beer. I daresay I guzzled this one. I wish I had more...
Chocolate colored head. Blueberry roasted malt chocolate nose. Slight alcohol on the nose. Coffee chocolate and toasty taste. Blueberry on the finish. Very light body.

Pours thick, dark, black with a big foamy brown head.  Nose is obviously blueberry.  I could smell it while it was pouring from the tap.  Other than that though, chocolate covered blueberries, grass and almonds.  Taste is sweet up front, but then bitter takes over through to the finish.  Mouthfeel is heavy, yet soft.  Creamy with a long aftertaste.

On tap at Pinocchios.  I was skeptical.  I dont like fruity beer.  This one...smells like blueberry, it tastes like blueberry.  Its very blueberry.  Its not bad though.  The rich dark choco flavor compliments the blueberry well.  Fairly high carbonation.  Surprisingly not horrible for how super blueberrily it presents.

15 April 2012, bottle. Nose is dark choc stout with an immediate blueberry aroma that defers to the stout the more you smell it. Med body and fizzy. Burnt choc stout with blueberry cobbler notes. Really good combination. Blueberry isn't too strong and stout is great. Perfect. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Brought out to celebrate Nicks 38th. Pours black with a small, very dark tan head. Quickly disappears and doesnt leave a great deal of lacing. Nose is amazing. Pretty much replicates blueberry pancakes. So unique. Taste shows your typical stout flavours with a blueberry and bread note on the finish. The blueberry pancake note really shines at the end. Medium to full mouth feel with a good level of carbonation which helps the beer flow a little. Fantastic beer

Roasted burnt cookie malt aroma, with just a hint of that blueberry above it. The blueberry is the perfect amount; only a touch, not cloying. Very boozy. Hints of cocoa and chocolate. Really outstanding nose.

Jet black and oily look. Slushy dark brown head. Looks deep and murky. The feel is oily and slick. 

The flavor is burnt malts: cocoa, mocha, chocolate, charcoal, burnt cookies. Hints of stone fruits: dates, raisins and plums. And of course the blueberry. Lovely.

This is a hell of a nice beer. Dont let the blueberry scare you off.

Pours black with ruby hues and a thin mocha head.  Aroma is nice and roasty with distinct blueberry notes...mild chocolate.  Flavor tastes like a lightly roasted chocolate covered blueberry but not sweet!  Nice!  Mouthfeel is full and creamy with a roasty coffee/blueberry finish.  Dig it!

Bottle; Thax Mr.Rask: Black colour, with a nice brown creamy head. Aroma is dominated of blueberry, lemonade mixed with candy(?)
Flavor had  a nice mouth feeling of coffee, dark choclate, blueberry and citrus, flowers. Medium body, long fruity finish!

Sampled from a 12 oz brown bottle this beer poured thick, black and oily with a large creamy very dark brown head that lingered and left great lacing. The aroma was strong real blueberry and marshmallow. The flavor was strong blueberry, chocolate syrup, toasty malts and marshmallow. Long finish. Thick, full and creamy body. Outstanding.
On tap at Mikkeller Bar. Black in color with a small dark brown head. Aroma of blueberry. complex and very nicely balanced. low on bitternes. Must try again! (note: served to cold)

Bottle at home bought from Cask Pub and Kitchen. Dark chocolate brown colour, with small golden head. Aroma is blueberries, chocolate, coffee, bit of smoke, lots of roast malt. Taste is lovely, all the elements of a good stout and then the blueberries at the front, fade in the middle and then reappear at the end. Lots of chocolate bitterness and maltiness. Bit of vanilla creaminess in the background too. Nice and thick, and very smooth. Really nice beer and glad I finally was able to try it.

On tap at Mikkeller Bar. Pours pitch black with a small brown head. Aroma of blueberries, roasted malt and some chocolate. Unfortunately its served pretty cold but it just gets better with the rising temperature. When a saw it on the tap list at the blackboard I thought it was a beer I would either love or dislike. Fortunately it was the first one. Its just fantastic. Intense blueberry taste mixed with some chocolate, and extremely well balanced in my opinion. Just nosing it for several minutes (waiting for it to get warmer) is a pure pleasure. Complex and full bodied. Truly a delicious beer. When the glass is empty Im left with a choclaty blueberry taste in my mouth and the urge to buy another glass. Unfortunately we didnt have the time to do that so I really hope Ill get a chance at another occasion. I want more! (2012-04-07)

Bottle. Dark Pour, beige cream head with miniscule bubbles. Aroma is great: hibiscus, blueberry, chocolate covered tropical fruit. Taste is very toasty smoked malts, coffee, vanilla chocolate toffee. The blueberry comes out as it warms. Slightly bitter on tongue in finish for a sweet stout but works with the beer. Warming experienced in bottom of stomach, very little lacing. Delicious and unique stout from Dark Horse.

On tap @Ma che siete venuti a fà. 
Aspect: black colour with a very small head not so much persistent
Creamy, medium carbonation.
Chocolate smell and taste. Light and easy to drink enough. I didnt find it absolutely nasty as you drink. Good.

26/03/2012 Ma che siete venuti a fà (tap). Nerissima, densa, impenetrabile, schiuma color beige, fine e abbondante. Al naso curioso mix di malti tostati, note caffettose e una punta acidula data dai mirtilli. In bocca risulta abbastanza sgraziata, le due componenti si amalgano bene nel complesso, ma fanno abbastanza a cazzotti. Stucchevole e fastidiosa alla lunga. In compenso ha una ottima bevibilità. Così così.

12oz bottle.
Pours black, with a tan head.
Smells rich, of chocolate, blueberries, and roasted malt.
Tastes of a large semi-tart sweetness, with a huge coffee bitterness.
Full bodied, medium carbonation, oily texture.
Finishes extremely dry, with a long-lasting bitterness.
I find it too bitter to really appreciate; the blueberry in the palate is mostly a tart undertone.
Chocolate and intense blueberry aromas.  Chocolate blueberry muffin flavors.  Overall a very delicious beer.

UPDATED: APR 2, 2012 Gorgeous pour with caramel head, turned a bit darker afterwards. The pout seemed to lack the essential blueberries it referenced, I couldnt find the flavor. Otherwise a bit bitter ans very smoky. Not as great to me compared to other reviewers.

Bottle to snifter. Pours dark brown black with a thick foamy tight tan head that fades to a tight film. Aroma is interesting with a smokey peat scent and blueberries all around. Taste is more smokey peat and blueberries with malt and coco with a subtle bitterness throughout. Palate is medium and chalky with a nice dry finish. Really well done and interesting enough to make me want more!

Black with a medium height, dark brown head.  Aroma is full of blueberry, roasted malts, chocolate.  The problem with all blueberry beers Ive ever had is that they always remind me of all those blueberry eggos I ate as a kid.  Full bodied.  Flavor has a nice roasted malt profile, chocolate, light milk, and plenty of blueberry.  This one has the aroma of eggos but the flavor is much different and quite nice. One of the better fruit infused beers Ive had.
Bottle from Systembolaget. Taste and smell of chocolate, blueberries and some roasted maltiness. Nice combo with the blueberries, they added a freshness to the beer.

S: black, dark brown head, thick
collar

A: blueberry juice coming thru,  followed by light roast coffee, a bit of dry, blueberry skin present

T: starts like a stout, light roasted coffee start, dry, bitter blueberry finish

O: tasty, great with a berry dessert(I'm eating ben & jerry's cherry Garcia, yum!) solid brew from a solid brewery

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Received in trade from barak316, thanks for the opportunity. A vigorous pour produces jet black body with tight tan head that looks like poetry in a glass. It smells like blueberry muffins as soon as I pop the cap. Roasty herbal earthy aromas as well as some berries upon closer sniffing. Taste is herbal and earthy up front to the point of being annoying. That slowly fades into a burnt sugar roasted kind of thing. Long lingering caramel roasty sweetness with a touch of heat in the finish. Medium to thick body with a light level of carbonation, and a rough sticky mouthfeel. This kind of grew on me as I drank it, but its not one of my favorites. This for me was very similar to the two with the addition of blueberry flavoring?

Dark close to black in color, good foam on head.
Aromas of bluberry
Full bodied and high complexity- including very well integrated taste of bluberry.

A beer you should try given the opportunity

On tap. Reminded me of the Too Cream, but with a subtle hint of blueberry in there. Rich and roasted, well balanced with bitter and sweet. Subtle aroma as well, not a big fruit bomb. Very nice and smooth. Dark Horse stouts are great for sure.

12 oz. bottle, into a English pint glass. Purchased @ Julios. Served at cellar temp.  Sizable, mocha head that diminished quick leaving thin ring of head, mild lace. From the second I popped the cap, I could smell blueberry. Hard to find anything other than Berries in the nose. Nice flavor! Up front I get the berry followed by, roasted malt, chocolate and a lite bitterness in the finish. Creamy palate. Low carbonation. Dark Horse did well with this stout. The thing I like most is the blueberry tastes natural. If you like sweet stouts, this is nice!

12 oz bottle, from last year.  Not sure if this one didnt hold up with age, but I was not impressed with this one.  Blueberries are there and it is not all artificial, but something just isnt working here.

12 ounce bottle into tulip glass, bottled this year(new label).  Pours pitch black color with a nice 2 finger fairly dense tan head with good retention that reduces to a nice cap that lingers.  Some decent spotty lacing on the glass.  Aromas of big dark chocolate, blueberry, roasted malt, caramel, coffee, and a bit of smokiness.  Fantastic aromas, smells very much like fresh blueberries.  Very authentic.  Taste of dark chocolate, roasted malt, blueberry, coffee, caramel, toast, and light herbal hops.  Fair amount of coffee bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of chocolate, blueberry, coffee, roasted malt, and caramel on the finish for a good bit.  Great balance of flavors; very nice showcase of the blueberry and roasted chocolate notes.  Medium carbonation and body; with a very nice highly creamy and slightly slick mouthfeel.  Alcohol is very well hidden at 7%, with only a slight warming after the finish present.  Overall this is a highly excellent stout.  Probably the best I have had with fruit in it.  Great balance and big robust flavors; with very smooth drinking for the alcohol level.

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2012 Bottle from cbfobes. Dark black motor oil pour not much head. Aroma is sweet blueberries and roasted coffee. Taste is subtle blueberries up front followed by a nice chocolate toast. Body is lower to medium. Great after taste of chocolate covered blueberries.

Pours a three finger brown head that vanishes leaving no lace.  Black color, no highlights, ton of yeast left in bottle.  Light carbonation and medium-heavy bodied. Blueberry nose and flavor is roasted coffee and blueberry. $2.95 for a 12 oz bottle from Julios Liquors Westborough, Ma.

I was very impressed at how organic the blueberries seemed and how the sweetness stood out versus other blueberry ales I always found a bit to sour for my liking. I suspect the coffee and chocolate flavors help accentuate this as well as adding a nice backdrop to this beer. Dark Horse doesnt disappoint me! Beer description says the berries are light but they seem to shine quite well.

From notes.  First reviewed 3/29/2010.  Consumed 3/27/10 on tap in a tulip.

Midnight black, with no light escaping anywhere. It arrived with a thin tan head, which receded to the edge of the glass and left slight lacing on the way down.

Strong roasted coffee and chocolate malt is the dominant aroma; blueberry provides a secondary presence on the nose.

Surprisingly bitter all the way through. The coffee and chocolate start off strong with a dark roasted malt back, adding a light but firm blueberry taste. A touch of cigars in the middle, and the coffee is the taste left standing at the end. A fairly strong bitter aftertaste as well.

Smooth and creamy, a good fit for this stout.

Tres is a strong, moderately complex stout. The blueberry flavor provides a nice change of pace from the traditional variety. The bitter aftertaste will slow me down a little bit, but this is a good stout to rotate into the mix.

This beer was served chilled in a pint glass. Of course the beer was too cold at first and had to sit on the counter to reach a proper temp.

Ar- The aroma of this beer reminds me of drinking cafe mocha and eating blueberry muffins. Nice dark roasted and almost chared aromas even a faint whisp of smoke. 

Ap- The body of the beer is almost perfectly black. The head on the beer is a thick burnt tan coloration. Nice retention noted on the head. Nice rings of foam mark this beers very rapid passage from my glass.

T- Darkly roasted malts enter the realm of dark french roasted coffee and cocoa. Blue berry flavors are present in a subdued sweet fashion.  Nice balance between sweetness and a burnt finish. 

P- The body of the beer is medium and very smooth. Light carbonation works well with this beers character. Nice smokey burnt finish keeps this beer from being overly sweet. 

O- A very nicely made stout. The fruit flavors and aromas seem to be authentic insteed of chemical in nature. Nicely executed and will seek this beer out again next year.
Dark, sweet fruit on the nose, with a moderate head. Palate is heavy and smooth with aroma-matching sweetness on the sip. Sweet gives way to roasted kick on the finish. Better than most fruit stouts.

12oz bottle. Black color, great-looking brown head. Little lace. Great dry texture, easy to drink with a lighter body. Nice, light and smooth carbonation. Great roasty malt aftertaste, and the level of blueberry is probably perfectly in balance - just enough to be noticed, but not too sweet as to drown the the delicious stoutiness. A bit of nice bitterness still prevails in the taste. Excellent sweet stout.
Dark with a brown head. Aroma is roasty like a toasted blueberry muffin. A hint of chocolate as well as the standard malty toastiness, maybe even a hint of coconut. Quite different.

12 oz bottle poured into a tulip. Pours a dark brown/black with a frothy tan head. Aroma is of reminiscent of a slice of blueberry pie and a cup of coffee. Roasty, chocolate, and dark fruits fill the nose, very pleasant. Taste is not overly sweet, just slightly so, with roasted coffee and dark chocolate bitterness. Mouthfeel is smooth and creamy, carbonation is mild. Very nice stout!

355 ml bottle bought @ Systembolaget and consumed on January 27. pours very dark brown, almost black, with a small brown head that quickly dissipates without leaving any trace. Smell is sweet and fruity with lots of blueberry, some salty liquorice and hints hints of roasted malts. Reminds me of blueberry hard candies. Taste is mostly roasted malts, liquorice, bitter chocolate and coffee but the blueberries are evident here too. Finish is bitter with a very slight sourness and some coffee. An interesting mix and a solid beer.

Immediate smell of blueberry when opening the bottle. Pours dark an smooth. Not very much carbonation. Head has a purplish tint (obviously from the blueberries).  Smell dark roast coffee, blueberry, and dark chocolate.  Mouthfeel is halfway between an Imperial Sout and Regular American Stout. Waves of roasty sweet stout with undertones of blueberry pie, however, the blueberry does not dominate the palate - much better balance than other fruit stouts Ive had. About 10 seconds after swallowing, you are left with a little bit of puckering and drying from the blueberries. Overall, fantastic beer.  It will definitely be an addition to my yearly lineup of seasonal release purchases.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2013 Bottle: Thanks to VsXsV:
Wow, a deep brown to black pour, a deep black beer in the glass with a nice vast but small brown head. The head seems to slowy change into a vast brown lacing.
Incredible smell, lots of blueberries but nothing to crazy here with something like "too much blueberries".
The smell however is mostly dominated by the blueberries, but there are also traces of (deeper roasted) coffee, hops, (deep) roasted malts and something light sour which most likely comes from the blueberries.
The taste is subtle, soft, smooth but also deep and complex but on a very generous way. A nice coffee and roasted almost burned malty/barley taste with (instead of a vanilla) a nice blueberry touch. The blueberries are added correctly, the exact amount this stout should have.
There is a nice bitterness that seems to stay there for a long while but never seems to fade or get stronger.
The aftertaste is soft roasty with a roasted herby/grassy/light grainy touch and a good bitterness.
The blueberries seem to take this beer to a softer side. Still delicious!
The carbonation is is pretty low with a light growing light spicy/sparkling mouthfeel (still mostly on the softer side), full body and a creamy texture.
This beer is deep yet soft and smooth, good roasted and bitter but so very well balanced and brewed! Amazing beer! Chapeau!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: 355mL thanks to brainlair. Ink pour with a larger mocha head. Deep and full with impressive retention. Thicker mocha lace. Nose is quite nice: muted blueberry pie, pie crust, graham cracker, milk chocolate. Small air freshner chemical is unwanted. Taste is very thick dark chocolate with some of that characteristic ash that plagues Dark Horse stouts. This really could be something quite amazing if that astringent bitter ash were absent. Thick, dark chocolate mouthfeel. As it warms, ash moves to very dark cocoa powder and is thick and bitter but lacking cigarette burnt character. Secants quite nicely. Good stuff.

Bottle.  Lots of blueberry aroma but not sweet, also roasted malt.  Black and moderately thick, tan head.  The taste release coffee and more roasted flavors... Full body, moderately thick, avg carbonation.  I enjoyed this stout... not sweet.

Very dark in color with a slight dark brown head. Aroma is almost all blueberry. Taste is a bit toasty, slight chocolate notes, and blueberries. Silky mouthfeel. Very different, but complex. Overall a decent beer.

12oz bottle.  Nice dark hue, medium carbonation.  Aromas are roasty with a blueberry forwardness much more like fresh blueberries rather than what you would find in a wheat, maybe from the slight chocolate notes too.  Palate is pretty smooth, malt forward, some sweetness through the mid palate and finishes with a slight sweet blueberry.  Really tasty and balanced, abv is hidden as well.
UPDATED: JAN 19, 2012 Very interesting beer, very unique. Pours black, almost no head. Very toasty, almost smoky flavor, and strong blueberry aroma. A bit flat and a tad too earthy,  but good.

Pours black with dark brown head and decent retention.  Aroma is strangely herbal with notes of blueberry dancing about the classic roast and chocolate notes of a big stout.  Taste is big stout coffee, chocolate, smoke, super rich and mingled with blueberry throughout.  Body is big and chewy, low carbonation, sludgy mouthfeel, creamy blueberry finish.  Beautiful.

Bottle. Black color, brown head with good retention. Aroma of peppery dark cocoa and coffee with berries.  The flavor of the blueberries is sublte enough to blend pretty well with the roastiness of the stout.

12oz bottle pours out motor oil thickness with a decent cocoa colored head that disappears quickly. The aroma is of dark deep roasted malts, hints of chocolate and guess what BLUEBERRIES. The flavor is of that same deep dark roasted malts and blueberries with hints of chocolate. The roasted malts are almost bitter but not quite. Wonderful beer.

strong slightly artifical berry aroma, dark brown / black with small head, moderat lacing,  nice balanced bittersweet with big blue barry tones dry finish. could have been a bit stronger.. over all a nice offering from michigan. cheers!

Monstrously black with a head that started off pouring nil, then exploded into a great brown monster!  It quickly settled down though and left nice clumps of lace.  Smell was quite on the blueberry side, also a little smoky, roasty malts.  Taste was an explosion of amazing burnt and deep roasted, smoky malts, with intense blueberry overtones.   Not bad on the feel, pretty good with a smoky, roasty, burnt aftertaset with just a tinge of sweet blueberry finish.  Odd, but tasty!  Would be a good conversation piece for a tasting.  Definitely try!  Be expecting exactly what the label says!

Bottle.
Pitch black with a short brown head that doesnt lace.
Sweet aroma with chocolate and a big fruity blueberry note that reminds me of blueberry bubblegum. The aroma gets a bit more acidic ashy after a while with just a hint of cold coffee and some licorice.

Taste is lactic sweet and a bit acidic with a nice smooth blueberry note and an ashy roasted character. But then comes the aftertaste with a big nice dark chocolate flavor and strong cold coffee.

Medium to slightly thinner mouthfeel with soft carbonation.

Great aftertaste! And the bubblegum note gives me childhood memories.

Bottle from Systembolaget

Opaque black beer with beige head. The sweet aroma has malts and chocolate. Tastes roasted malts some blueberries. Quite dry beer, the blueberry annoyed a little.

A. Pours a nice black, with a mild blue hue. A nice 2 finger head, with good retention. Maintained a nice 2mm ring the whole time.

S. Noticeable hickory/oak notes, with a sweet smell of blueberry and malts. Extremely nice smell to this beer. This is the type of smell that I could have a scented candle made out of, that my wife would like too. 

T. Start has a rich malt flavor. A slight blueberry flavor, but also very sweet. The sweetness fades at the end to a bitterness. Almost as if your tasting two different types of blueberries through out the beer. It really is quite a interesting transformation.

M. It has a heavier feel, that presents itself right away when you sip it. A chewy thickness that stays bold the whole time. However the flavors round out the thickness well. A fair amount of carbonation, however not overwhelming.

O. This is a very interesting beer. Without the blueberry flavors, this beer would be lost on a shelf with a lot of other 1-sided stouts. However the flavors that present themselves throughout this beer really keep it interesting all the way through the glass, and even after your done drinking.

I think this is a impressive beer. It has some flavors that normally would be the end of a stout to me, but rounds them out with a lot of interesting angles to the taste. It really keeps you sipping to continue to get all those subtle hints. On a nice side note, when you burp, it tastes like blueberry pancakes! I cant wait to share this beer with a few friends.

2011 Bottling
Tasted on 1/9/12 from a 12oz bottle sent to me for nothing by Roonai, thank you for the generosity.  Pours a purple tinted jet-black with a massive deep brown head that slowly recedes, first to rocky lace, and then to uneven lace.  The nose is dark chocolate and darkly roasted coffee with a ton of blueberry syrup and a creamy vanilla hint.  The flavor is full of blueberry and the creamy note up front, moving to some toasted nuttiness, and the nicely bitter dark chocolate covered espresso bean.  The body is full and creamy with average carbonation and a long dark covered chocolate and blueberry finish.

Bottle 12 fl.oz from erzbierschof.ch. Black beer, brown and fugacious foam, immediat perfume of blueberry, roasted malt, dark chocolate and toffy-licorice. The taste is chocolaty, fresh blueberry ans jam, fruity acidulity, rich and roasted malt, toffy-molasses. The blueberry is smooth and subtil, not heavy but the body is full, creamy texture. Here, Stout and blueberry, I even met a happy marriage.

355ml bottle.
Pours pitch black, with brown edges, and a brown head.
Massive aroma, layers of roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, licorice, tobacco, prunes, the blueberries add a somehow minty touch, almost herbal.
Off-dry, full bodied, high but well balanced bitterness, but a bit low CO2.
Heavily rosted taste, lots of malt, chocolate, coffee, minty blueberries, ashes.
Very rich and complex, yet ridiculously easy drinking. (2012-01-04)

Bottle, pours black with medium brown head. Aroma is fruity with blueberries and roasted malts. Taste is roasted malts, dark fruits, lots of blueberries and some chocolate. Medium mouthfeel. Hard to rate I think, not a complex beer but a good solid sweet stout.

Stor doft av blåbärs- eller kanske snarare björbärsgodis, julmust och äpple. Lätt kropp, lite syrlig, lätt tvålig, torr eftersmak med drag av bitterchoklad. Och så hela tiden dess blåbärsestrar. Det funkar ändå riktigt bra. Jag gillar att den har en realativt lätt kropp. Det passar bra till blåbären.
draft at union. pours black with medium tan head. aroma of blueberry pie! taste is also of flaky blueberry pie and cup of coffee
Heavy roasted malt notes in aroma and flavor, but tremendously smooth.  Nice blueberry flavor doesnt take over, and is a nice complement to its light body and fireside roast bitterness. Yummy

Bottle pours black with brown head.  Aroma is sweet roasted malt and chocolate with a hint of blueberry.  Taste is roasted malt, coffee, some blueberry, but not too much, and also some chocolate.  Body is full and carbonation is average, with large bubbles.  Lacing is average.  Overall, a very good stout.
bottle.  Great blueberry and malt smell.   Not a whole lot of blueberry in the flavor, but more of a traditional stout.   Great beer!
Very dark brown with a tiny brown head. Malty with fruity tones. Malt, hops and fruit ( blueberries ). Medium to full body with a nice bitter finish.

Bottled.  Very black, no head. Rich blueberry aroma with some salmiak. Mid sweet with full body and clean, rounded mouthfeel. Some milk chocolate and licorice, plenty of blueberry jam. Long roasty bitter finish. Unconventional but functional use of an otherwise very dull berry. The first time I feel that blueberries contributes to anything in a beer.

Tap at New Albanian.  Strong blueberry and toffee malt aroma.  Opaque black color with moderate head.  Toffee malt and mildly bitter herbal hops flavor.  Mildly sweet blueberry finish.  Nicely blended.

33cl bottle. Pours pitch black with small brown head. Smells and tastes smoky roasted malt and blue barry with a bitter smoky finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled from Systembolaget
Pitch black. Brief briwn head. 
Sweet blueberries and heavily roasted malt in both aroma and flavour. 
Light cocoa-bitterness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

355 ml bottle from Systembolaget. Opaque, black liquid with small to medium tan head. Aroma of blueberries, coffee, chocolate, vanilla, smoke and even more blueberries. Taste is really chocolatey and roasted, light sweet and medium to high bitter. Really balanced. Medium to full bodied with nice carbonation. Really nice one. Smells like blueberries without becoming artificial and tastes like a really good stout. Well done!

Bottle - Black in colour with a tan head. Blueberry, coffee and plain chocolate in the aroma. Blueberry, roasted malt, Bournville chocolate and coffee feature in the taste. Interesting and rather enjoyable.

Bottle (35 cl) from Systembolaget. Black with a brief beige head. Nice roasted chocolate and coffee aroma, with some rubber notes and a slightly artificial blueberry touch. Medium bodied, a bit fizzy carbonation. Semi dry, medium bitterness.
Luktar spya. smaken är söt, artificiell och helt uten eftersmak. Inget att rekomendera

12oz bottle shared by Dallas, thanks 
Appearance: Black with a medium sized tan head and some spotty lacing 
Aroma: Roosted malts, blueberries and coffee 
Taste: Roasted malts, light smoke and chocolate 
Nice

Aroma: Blueberries, lots of them, roasted malts, coffee, tar, smoke. 
Appearance: Dark colour, no head. 
Flavour: Blueberries, thick base, some acidity, heavily roasted, sweetish finish. 
Mouthfeel: Average. 
Total: This was a very pleasant first beer from this brewery.

(Bottle)  Pours black with a dark brown head. The aroma holds blueberry jam and medium roasted malt up front with undertones of caramel, dark chocolate, cocoa, vanilla (ice cream) and maybe a touch of milk. Simple but sexy nose. The flavor is light sweet to dry, light to medium bitter and light acidic. Blueberries, cocoa, light coffee, light vanilla, mild ginger and asphalt alongside  light citric touch. The mouthfeel is fairly clean, light tart and somewhat watery with a light to medium carbonation. Blueberries, citrus acid and tart roast on the finish. Light to medium bodied.

Bottle from SB cons 2011-12-09 Göteborg
Ar: first rich blueberry soup, then chocolate, roasted malt and coffey
Ap: fizzy black body, wee beige head
F: rich chocholate, blueberries, home brewed coffey, medium carbonation and bitterness, finish is the same
12 Oz bottle. Huge blueberry nose, roasted malts. Filled with blueberry, chocolate, roasted malts. Great beer, easy drinking.

Bottle from systembolaget.
Aroma of blueberry jam and roasted malt.
Lots of blueberries in the taste as well, along with rosted malt and licorice. The fruityness is a bitt odd in a heavy bodied beer.

En "fusionerad" stout av blåbär, kaffe och mörkchoklad. Väl i glaset så fylls rummet med en doft av djup urskog och blåbär. Smakmässigt så bjuds man först på amerikanska blåbär därefter maltiga mörka choklad toner och sist rostat kaffe. Eftersmaken skiftar/bråkar mellan en behaglig beska och blåbär. En förutsättning för att man skall bli lika lyrisk som jag blev är att man både älskar blåbär och stout. Hur som helst så är jag riktigt imponerad.

12 ounce bottle thanks to Dallas. Pours a dark brown color with a medium brown head. The aroma is awesome; rich strong blueberries, very fresh. The flavor has berries but more subdued, some coffee and a light sweet roasted malt. Very smooth and tasty. This direct addition of fruit to a stout worked.

Det första som slår mig är att det är något i aromen som luktar illa, jag kan inte precisera det och kamraten bredvid kunde inte känna det men där var något som luktade lite illa. Smaken är lite spännande, inte bara för blåbärsfusionen, då den kommer i etapper. Först visar den sin mjuka och lena sida därefter kommer den rostade malten in rör upp lite känslor och avslutnigsvis kommer blåbärssmaken in och förvirringen blir märkbar. Det här är en intressant öl och jag får nog säga att den är mer spännande än den är god. Slutsats: den får pluspoäng för innovativitet.
