Almost black with a small light brown head. Aroma of chocolate and blueberry. The flavour is medium sweet and perfectly balanced with the roasted malts. Really nice.

Bottle.

Black, with a small tan head. Aroma of berries, coffee, roasted malt and chocolate. Not as much blueberries in the sweet taste as expected. (my bottle was about one year old)

Not a superb beer but ok and easy to drink.

Bottle from Allen thanks, a dark beer with a medium brown head. Nose is dark chocolate like with light red fruit notes. Aroma is dry, very bitter and roasted, huge astringency with a strange fruit note, blueberry fruit notes are disappointing, less interesting then expected, very astringent. Aftertaste is roasted and dry fruit like, too dry and harsh.
Black with a disappearing dark brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, chocolate and lots of blueberry. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and roasted rather bitter. Oily. 011111

Bottle shared at a recent BA/RB tasting...  Poured pitch black with a thin head.  Some blueberry and roasted malt on the nose.  Well balanced, not overly blueberry, and sickly sweet with the fruit.  Done just right.  Dark malts, blueberry flavoring, dark chocolate and mild palate.  Nice drinking blueberry stout.
(Bottle 25/10-2011) Very low brown head, black color, sweet roasted aroma, sweet roasted slightly bitter taste.

355ml bottle from Bierkompass

Pours pitch black with a small sticky brown head. Aroma has notes of roasted malts, hops and hints of berries. Taste is quite roasty and hoppy with notes of fruits. Strong roasty finish with hints of berries. Nice, quite roasty stout.

355 ml bottle.
Pours a black colour with a small, almost non-existing head. Aroma of roasted malts, roasted coffee and milk chocolate. Flavour of roasted malts, coffee, sweet berries and milk chocolate. Medium bodied, smooth bodied and a long, dry, roasty, coffee finish. Tasty.

Bottle from Jeff - thanks!  Pours with an initially large, dark expresso brown head that fades out to a foam slick on black beer.  Aroma is heavily roasted malt, light chocolate, a dank musty smell (not off putting), and light blueberry.  Taste is a clean, heavily roasted stout with chocolate, dry stout character, and a hint of blueberry in the finish.  Some heavier dark fruit or perhaps sweet malt notes toward the finish as well.  Light but even feel in the mouth.  I really like the combination of the heavy roast and the light fruit.  Original and very good.

355 ml bottle.
Pours black with nice small beige head. Aroma of oat, dark roasted malts, bilberries, chocolate, light coffee and toffee. Flavour of roasted malts, caramel, distant notes of blueberry, ash and milky chocolate. Not as sweet as I expected which is a good thing.
4225

33 cl bottle @ home, no BBE info
Aroma has lots of roasted malt and coffee. Also some blueberries. Flavour has roasted coffee with some distant blueberry aroma. The aroma gets stronger when we get closer to the sweet and a bit floury finish. Good stout, but I think this would be even better without the berries. Maybe.

pour very dark, but not black, and lets some light through. Big, darker than off-white head.
Aroma has plenty of chokolate, coffee and vanilla. Also a lot of berries in the nose. Nice balance.

Blaubeerig, malzschokoladiger und röstiger Geruch. Antrunk süßlich, dann Blaubeeraroma gepaart mit schokoladigen Noten, bitter aromatisch weiterführend. Malzig, Kaffee und Bitterschokolade im Ausklang. Astrein!

The best blueberry beer on the market for my money. Pours a jet black it an off white head. The nose is of blueberries, coffee, dark chocolate, dark malts and toasted oak. The taste is smoky and of dark malts and chocolate, with a nice subtle blueberry finish. The blueberry compliments this beer very nicely without dominating it.

Almost pours like motor oil.  It has flavors of blueberry, dark bitter chocolate and maybe some black licorice with the typical stout notes.  Its not too fruity.  The blueberry is mild, but definitely noticeable.  Medium bitterness with a hint of sweetness.  Good stuff.

Serving glass: Poured from bottle into Nonic Imperial Pint.

Appearance: Pitch black with initial thick purplish-tan head, leaving a thin line behind.

Aroma: Dry roasted malts with chocolate, licorice, molasses and coffee. Just a titch of blueberry in the aroma.

Taste: Wow, what a great mix of flavors. Starts off with mostly dried out roasted malts of chocolate, molasses and licorice. Then ends with an odd but delicious & enticing mix of bitter coffee and sweet & tart blueberry. The blueberry becomes a lot more noticeable as it warms.

Palate: Moderately low carbonation, pretty creamy body, semi-dry finish.

Overall: Never would have guessed that blueberry and a stout would go so well together. Just fantastic.
Nose is coffee, dark chocolate, some alcohol, roasted malt, feel is quite fat, carb is mediumlow, taste is sweet roasted malt, sour leaves, coffee, cream, whiff of alcohol

Bottle. Poured into a tulip glass a thick, dark brown color with a sticky mocha tan head that slowly settles. Some lace left as the head calms. Dark chocolate notes with an almost pepper like hint as well. For only 7% is smells a touch boozy as well. Light blueberry flavor in the beginning that is quickly dominated by a growing leather and roast flavor. A couple of sips of this pretty much told me exactly what kind a beer this was. Lingering roast with a slight alcohol burn. meh. Medium/heavy mouthfeel. Nice look but the aroma and smell leave a lot to be desired.

Pour out of bottle, dark creamy black with dark tan head, really nice looking, head stuck around as well.  Aroma was just how Id picture a beer like this, chocolate, dark fruit, roast, coffee, some slight lactose and a beautiful very clear blueberry note that fit in well.  Taste was nice and creamy a bit low on the carb level surprisingly, but with nice notes of roast, chocolate and coffee.  Blueberry was in the taste much more as it warmed up, but overall was a nice addition to a delicious stout.

Incredible marrige of fruit and ale. Silky black stout with sublime fresh blueberry flavor and aroma this ale is balanced, yet complex and one of the finest fruit beers Ive ever had. Very highly recommended.
user_location: Peoples Republic of Bloomington, Indiana, USA

text: UPDATED: AUG 18, 2011 A decent stout. Interesting with the blueberry. I prefer no fruit, but it was worth a try.

This is the last of the stout series for me and this one pours just like the rest, pitch black with a bubbly mocha head that dissipates to a ring. There is little lacing but lots of bubbles rising to the middle throughout. Aroma is surprising for a stout, it smells like a blueberry cobbler with some coffee and chocolate malts thrown in. The taste isnt quite as nice as the aroma but still good with the dark roasted malts and bittersweet chocolates dominating. The blueberries are present but not overwhelming, making for a nice, balanced flavor. The mouth feel is medium bodied with tons of carbonation, Odd for a Stout. This is right up there with Plead the 5th in the series. Great beer and the best sessionable stout Ive tasted in a while. I shared this 1, but I will buy more.

from erzbierschof.ch - dark black beer with a long lasting and firm dark beige foam; roasted coffeish aroma with deep notes of blueberries; full-bodied and quite oily, moderate carbonation; creamy palate and with a respectable bitterness; long hoppy finish with notes of dark chocolate and blueberries - voluptuous

Poured a dark brown with minimal head. The pour looked very thick. Aroma had a touch of blueberries with roasted malt. Flavor was mostly malt with a hint of coffee. I really didnt get any blueberry in the flavor. Overall a pretty good brew.

Bottle.
Pitch black with a porous brown head with a creamy top.
Huge blueberry aroma, roasted malt, and chocolate.
Taste: blueberry ice cream, chocolate, licorice, some coffee, a slight acidity, roasted, medium bitter.
Medium-bodied, quite a high carbonation.
Really nice!
Una negra molt repetible, negra negra de color, no especialment dura, amb olors i sabors de mores com anuncia el nom.

Dark Horse TGres Blueberry Stout is an almost pitch black beer with some brown head that disappears almost completely quite quickly. The aroma is delicious blueberries, chocolate and roasted malts. Flavour is coffee, blueberries and roasted malts. Its a bit sweet. Relatively thick. Im beginning to like this brewery more and more.

Black with a very creamy, beautiful and lasting cappuccino-colored head. Sweet aroma with a very present fruitiness from the blueberries, that mixes with roasted malts, notes of coffee and chocolate. The taste is sweet, bitter and fruity and very well balanced with a long, dry and quite bitter roasted finish. Body is medium, texture is soft and oily. 
A very nice brew - the blueberry works extremely well with the dark and roasted components.

Bottle at Bishops Arms Järntorget, Göteborg, on July 20, 2011Black color, big dark brown head. Sweet, berry, fruity, malty, chocolate, alcohol scent. Sweet, acidic (black malts or blueberry?), malty, roasted taste. Dryish roasted aftertaste. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bitterness. A bit grainy.Id liked the blueberrys more, though a hint more comes as the beer warms up.

12 oz. bottle, $2 single at Famous Liquors. A lot of chocolate in the nose, but yes, thats some blueberry making its way through, too. Quite full of chocolate malt yumminess, without too much astringency. Pours solid black, with nut brown foam. Taste is a nice Guinness style stout, but thicker what with the extra alcohol. Chocolate again, and some mocha coffee with Kahlua too. The blueberry is there, somewhat transformed by those rude malts in the fermenter. But its there to add smoothness and more of an edge of fruit than the usual cloying sweetness. Manages to be outstanding by not becoming "extreme."

UPDATED: JUL 30, 2011 As with most stouts, pour black with tan head, little lacing.  Aromas of chocolate, caramels, and blueberries.  Taste is above average sweetness, but not from the blueberries.  Full bodied, sticky, and creamy.  Overall, a tasty brew with the blueberries not overbearing but really just right.  Another good one from Dark Horse.

Reminiscent of Southern Tier porter somehow. Remarkably dark appearance with a deep beige head. Excellent, inviting nose. Great balance. Very nice creativity. Medium to full bodied. Beautiful signature. Low bitterness. Nice lacework. Short finish which is reminiscent of blueberry and chocolate. Excellent stuff.

Bottle. Black beer wit a brown head. Roasted aroma. blueberries, chocolate, metal and licorice notes. Blueberry flavor, chocolate, milky, berries, licorice, pine notes, metal. Bitter chocolate and metal finish. A bit different but very nice.

Purchased at Breeze Thru Liquors in Milwaukee, WI; enjoyed on a day when I found out when Im starting a new gig!  Appearance a pure pitch black, somewhat sludgy, with a really unique brown/dark blue/purple head.  Never seen anything like that before!  Aroma really unique, equal parts blueberries, chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, lactose, very nice.  Taste is pretty thick with good carbonation, great chocolate notes with a slight hint of toffee, roasted malts make it somewhat smooth, and the blueberries are in there but are not dominant, sit nicely in the balance.  Very nice balance, highly enjoyable.

12 oz bottle.  Black pour thin head.  Nose mostly dark chocolate, coffee and a slight hint of Blueberry.  Taste followed the nose exactly.  I was expectingmore blueberry and sweetness so I wasnt fully pleased there.  However this did come after 2 sweeter brews so it may had been more of a palate issue.

Chocolate, coffee, caramel and blueberries in the aroma.  The blueberry note is mild and decent, but it comes off a bit artificial and kinda reminds me of blueberry Eggos.  Theres good roasty bitterness on the palate.  Lots more caramel.  Some molasses.  Mouthfeel is smooth.  Great looking head, creamy and light brown.  If the blueberry flavor worked a bit better, Id be a much bigger fan.

Brunsvier kage brød malt blåbær sort ingen skum 
Sød Meget bitter mellem cremet flad 
F33 cl 12/6-11 @ home

11-JUN-2011, bottle @home, from "Fish & Beer".
Black with a purple hue and dark brown fluffy  head - also with a slightly purple hue?
Nose is fruity from bluebeeries. Taste is very blueberry-like on top of a lovely stout with loads of coffee and roasted notes.
Quite long blueberry and roasted taste ending hoppy bitter.
Full mouthfeel - is this really an Imperial Stout?

Pour deep brown to black, coffee tan head decent lace. Aroma blueberry, coffee, caramel, butterscotch, chocolate,cereal, slight metallic. Taste roasty, dark chocolate, caramel, coffee, light blueberry, heavy cream, vanilla.  Medium body with a slight thickness to it mild carb. Overall way above expectation tasty stuff and very balanced. Thanks JSPrime!!!

Bottle from pantanap. Pours pitch black brown with a great dark brown creamy head leaving a nice lacing. Aroma is so blueberry after pour, fills the room with that sweet berry scent. Good roasted and malty and fruity stout aroma with a touch of freshly baked muffins/cookies. Medium stouty mouthfeel. Like the balanced flavor of roasted malts, tartness and slightly sweet blueberries. Palate is a bit acidy and roasted. Finish is very nice, longlived tart roasted with a touch of sweet blueberries.

Black pour with a tight tan head.  Aroma is chocolate bar, roast, dark malt, some light blueberry sweetness.  Rich creamy mouthfeel, roast and chocolate are immedeately evident on the tongue, with a slight blueberry sweetness making appearances here and there, finish is dry and roasty.  A rich roasty chocolate forward stout with a light blueberry sweetness.  Quite nice

Bottle. A black one, looking really nice in the glass, but the tan head would look even better with more height. It has the most wonderful man-made aroma Ive ever smelled, with lots of blueberry, leading my thoughts to pancakes, coffee, chocolate and dried fruits as well as hints of alcohol and something sugary. Its almost equally superb in the mouth, which after minutes of satisfaction to the nose finally got a sip. Its sweet and malty, slightly roasted and caramel-ish and roasted-bitter. Blueberries are present, but not as intense as in the aroma, and theres also chocolate and coffee. Its full-bodied and smooth, with the finish lasting long after the final drop has been swallowed. Wow! Gimme more, much more. 110107

Very interesting beer. Powerful blueberry aroma (I could smell when someone else poured one) almost like muffins, but then the blueberry flavor is very subtle, just a bit of fruit at the end of a dry, smooth stout flavor.
Very strong blueberry aroma, lots of fruit. Light sweetness on the palate, but more malt and roast comes out, but blueberry dominates. Very enjoyable.

Pours black with a super dark brown head but fades quick.  Nose is chocolate covered blueberry candy! wow! and coffee.  The blueberry nose doesnt seem artificial.  Taste is a perfect blend of roast, blueberrys, coffee, and other roasted character.  Heavy body and thick silky mouthfeel.  This is a quality beer but not one I would like to drink every day.
Bottle. Black colour with a tan head. Aroma is blueberry, coffee, licorice, malt. Flavour is blueberry, coffee, licorice, malt, hop. Full bodied nice beer.

Huge thanks to dcschiller for this treat. Bottle pours deep brown/black with a tan head.  Aroma is amazing with notes of roasted malt, dark chocolate, and light coffee with underlying sweet/tart blueberries.  Flavor shows blueberry drizzled fudge and light smoke.  Overall body is moderate and the finish leaves you wanting more.

12oz bottle poured into my De Struise glass...A dark brown body with a huge dark tan head that rises several fingers. There is incredible lacing and retention...The aroma is very strong, as I wait for the head to fall fresh blueberries start to waif over rom a few feet away. Weirdly, as I get closer the aroma lets me down as the blueberries come off more generic and chemical. Also quite a bit of alcohol for a 4.5% beer. Weird bitter note too that are hops, totally inappropriate... The taste is really weird and boring. The blueberries come off as bitter, only a hint of sweet blueberries. There is a strange medicinal note, aloe, light very bitter, hop finish. Not very interesting or good enough that I want to keep drinking.

Interesting idea, just not executed very good. Pass.

On tap at Crane Alley in Urbana, IL. Chocolate chip, blueberry muffin stout is the best way to describe this one. The blueberry aspects are not overpowering at all. Lots of roasted malt as well and creamy sweetness, with an aroma and flavor profile that play off each other well. This was at times a bit too sweet for my liking, but overall this was a solid fruity stout. I liked.

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2012 Updated rating....had FRESH / on draft at the Brewery pub....this stuff is even better than in / from a bottle....had two NON-beer drinkers with me and even they both loved it...below rating still applies but even better...

12 oz bottle from Todd....thanks.  Pours black with nice brown head....nose and initial sip is pure blue berries...great start to a sweet stout.  The blueberries dominate....supported by the chocolate / roast malts....this is a great dessert beer....

(bottle courtesy of jcnd9803).  Pours black with 2 finger chocolate head.  Lots of fine carbonation bubbles.  Aroma has dark chocolate, blueberry, roasted coffee.  Taste is sweet-and maybe a little sour-with ripe blueberries intertwined with a roasted bitterness.  Medium bodied with a creamy texture.  Slightly bitter finish.  A nice beer, but wish the blueberry was a bit stronger.  Still, I like this this quite a bit.

Pours black with a brown pillowy head.  Aroma is roasty, coffee, dark chocolate and blueberry.  Taste is sweet with a bitter finish.  The blueberry adds an interesting sweetness, overall this is excellent.

Black pour dark tan head great looking brew ... aroma of blueberries and roasted malts ..... taste is delicious tart blueberries, roasted coffee and chocolate/cocoa with a bitter roasted finish .... well balanced and all flavors mesh well very drinkable brew

12 oz. bottle from Root Cellar. Pours a deep, opaque brown color- black in the center and cola brown on the sides- with a small brown head that settles into a ring. Aroma of roasted malts, smoked wood, blueberries, chocolate, and ginger. Flavor of roasted malts, burnt toast, smoked wood, blueberries, peat, and ginger. Medium-bodied, with mild carbonation and a roasty mouthfeel and ashy finish. Not just fruit, but a ton of roasty things going on in this. Really enjoyed it.
12oz bottle, great blueberry aroma, quite the sweet stout, relies on its malt before the sweetness of the fruit. This is quite good, easily drinkable and not overly artificial. Nice.

Took me a long time to do this. On tap at the Bocktown; a really nice informative beer everything place.  I see why this rates so high, approaches imp stout territory on the palate - probably shoulod be in the fruit beer or impy stout styles.  Big coffee initial blast with mild fruit of blueberry essence in the taste buds of this one.  Big black pour, choco moose head that fades. Smell is fruit black cool coffee.  Yes bitterness but much less than i expected.  However, Mr. Big bitter sets in and evolves as the session continues. Very little if any CO2.  Becomes overly strong and difficult near the end, wew.  Over the top on the finish.  Yes slight fruit of possibly blue on a big coal black coffee beer. Mouth coating and perhaps a little lovely rude.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: A mild blueberry aroma and flavor. Definately not a fruit beer and not a great stout. Other than that, not a bad tasting brew. I prefer to have my stouts without fruit and my fruit beer not tasting like coffee.

I was under the impression this was way lower in abv... Black in color, small tan head... Aroma of blueberry, coffee, roast, and cream... medium bodied, roasty, some creaminess, moderate to light blueberry flavor, not overly pungent... This is a decent stout with blueberry....

Blueberry very apparent upon pour, but dissipates and leaves you withe a yeast smell that reminds of bagels.  Has a dark black brown color with a fairly thin head for the style.  Carbonation is crisp, maybe too much so, with a nice roast flavor in the back of the mouth.  Sweetness is light and I wanted more to go with the blueberry taste which was subtle.  Finishes dry.

12oz bottle. Im going to come right out and say it ... blueberries do not belong in stout. That said, this actually is a pretty good stout. Just wish it didnt have those blueberries messing it up. Definitely the best blueberry beer I have tasted by far.

poured from a 12 oz bottle into my Bells tulip glass.

nice dark black color. not a whole lot of head dissipates fast into pretty much nothing except a hairline around the edge of the glass

smells like blueberrys and roasted barley. a bit like toast.

tastes extremely of roasted barley, very toasty... almsot like burnt toast. small hints of blueberry, not as much as i thought there would be. heavy hits of black pepper the more i drink, yuck. 
*edit - 5 minutes after i finished this thing and the dryness feels like i tried wiping my tongue off with my shirt, but that would be better because the taste would be gone. give me water. This stuff is leaving a super dry burnt popcorn taste on my tongue. this has to be one of the most disgusting beers ive had in a long time.

mouthfeel is super thin and extremely dry. dried the inside of my mouth out and made me feel parched. i wanted water... its only 4.5% ABV... yeah, horrible mouthfeel.

ill pass on this beer. wouldnt drink it with anything cuz i will never buy it again. good thing i got it in a mixed 6.

I loved it down to the last drop. It really tasted exactly like blueberry pancakes with maple syrup. Not typically what you get in a beer. It was full bodied with no much of a head, but bursting with flavor through its gratifying finish. Bistre in color. Really a sight and so unique!

Pours black into a snifter. Mocha head with good retention recedes to skim surface. Chocolate covered blueberry aromas. Dry with sweet blueberry upfront turning to chocolate and espresso in the lasting finish.

Pours a deep blue-tinted black with a thin brown head. Aroma has a sort of subtle fruitiness to it. The blueberries combine with the dark roasted malts to make something that smells like burnt blueberry pie. Flavor is unusual. Burnt malts take the forefront, but there is a definite blueberry punch on the finish. Its a nice contrast to the bitterness of the malts. Palate is full with a little bit too much carbonation. Pretty good stuff overall. Interesting beer.

Bottle. Pours black with a cola colored head that lingers around for awhile. The aroma is filled with blueberries and a little bit of smoke. The flavor is chocolate, coffee, and smoky roasted malts all with a wonderful blueberry fruitiness in the background. The blueberries intermingle with this beer very well.

Bottle.  Dark black pour, lasting brown cookie head and an aroma of crushed fresh blueberries. Flavor is smoke, chocolate, plenty of peat and rich creamy blueberries. Solid and very enjoyable fruit beer.

On draft at Capones.  Pour was onyx with 2 big fingers of deep brown head which left very nice lacing.  Nose is big soy sauce up front, roasted malt, blueberry, and a bit of date.  Taste is caramel and roasted malt, done in the creamiest desert fashion, which subsides and fades into a smooth blueberry; this trio stays smooth and creamy to comprise the finish.  I was shocked at how smooth and delicious this offering was, and feel that it would make a fantastic session beer.

12 ounce bottle I found in my refrigerator -- no date on the bottle but likely about a year old. Poured into a tulip type glass. Dark, rich jet black color. Even the head is very dark brown and thick looking. A nice aroma of blueberries pops out as soon as you open the bottle. A more direct smell notices cocoa and chocolate flavors as well. Definitely some dried blueberry flavor, but its in the background and not overwhelming. As the blueberries fade, its replaced by a lingering dried cocoa taste, charcoal and some molasses flavors.  Medium bodied, with a creamy milky mouthfeel to it. Id classify this a well-done gimmicky type beer. Its something you want to try and enjoy once, but not something Id want more than once in a while. Strange, but when thinking of a food pairing, I keep thinking this beer would work great for breakfast with a plate of blueberry pancakes.

A delicious sweet stout. Aroma was big. Strong blueberry that overpowers anything else (and thats not a bad thing). Pour was a nice deep dark brown/near black with a lingering puffy tan head. Taste was delicious. Strong roasted malt with a milky sweetness. The blueberry is strong in the aroma and just a faint aftertaste. A nice mix of blueberry and hops in the aftertaste mix things up with the taste buds. NIce beer
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: 12oz bottle from Downer Wine and Spirit.  Pours a jet black color with a tan head.  Aroma is chocolate and blueberry.  Medium on the palate with average carbonation.  Flavor is mildly bitter, roasted malt, with a blueberry aftertaste.  A very interesting beer, and a nice example of using fruit in a stout.

On tap at the local option; pour is dark brown with a modest tan head into a tulip. First blueberry brew, and i find it interesting that the blueberry sticks out like it does. The first note is blueberry, actually, and the chocolate and light roastiness. This brew fizzles out a bit on the finish, but its a fine experience.
this was interesting, honestly i was scared at first, the blueberries are very subtle and primarily on the nose, which is best case scenario, the stout is rich and roasted, great beer.

Blueberries seem like a good match for beer. They always seem to pop through and add quite a lot of aroma w/o being artificial. Well, at least they are better than cherry and most other fruit. This beer pours a completely opaque black w/ a pretty red-brown head. Blueberries strike the nose as soon as the bottle is cracked and remain pretty intense in the glass. Their flavor mingles w/ deep roasted coffee and it comes together in a way that manages to be both unique and classic. Taste is a bit on the tart side, which emphasizes the fruit more so than the stout tastes but w/o completely overriding the chocolate and coffee overtones. Texture, too, veers more towards what youd expect in a lighter fruit beer. It is light bodied but not thin w/ prickly carbonation. Overall, though, this was quite a nice beer--a little different, very flavorful and quite drinkable.

id have to agree with the last rating, i bought one, two, and tres together, and to be honest was way more excited about one and two than of three. I thought it was going to be sort of a contrived flavor, artificial flavor to it, but its absolutely delicious, and not too heavy of a stout, really a nice surprise.

Look, I didnt want to rate a "blueberry" stout this high, but I have no choice!  Aroma, appearance, taste, and mouthfeel are superb!  Easily one of the smoothest stouts I have ever tried.  What a dessert beer.
Totally black color with huge brown head. Lots of fine roasted malt aroma and taste. Blueberries added vey little to aroma or taste of a fine stout.

As advertised, the aroma is of blueberries, though not intense. Behind the demure fruit is potent hops and chocolate. The medium brown head is fluffy, falling off a bit to form a sheen of caramel bubbles on the surface. The brew is intensely black. Though I feared the fruit would be overwhelming, the blueberry is actually secondary in the taste, taking a backseat to the hops, chocolate and coffee notes. It is a bit heavy on the palate, thick like an iced coffee. Despite the presence of hops, there is little in the way of bitterness in the aftertaste.

12 oz. bottle poured to a snifter at Lunar Brewing Co.. Displayed a black/brown, viscous pour, with a healthy amount of lasting, tan/brown, creamy head foam, and clingy waves and spots of lacing. The aroma was extremely roasty, cocoa & coffee, and a noticeable blueberry scent. Ditto on the flavor, except the blueberry was relegated to a much lighter position toward the finish. Hop bitterness was pronounced and lingering, a little woodiness was perceived, and a pleasant, creamy mouthfeel complimented the full body. Maybe a little more astringent nature to the finish than I would like, but a decent Sweet Stout.

Aroma: Caramel and chocolate, with a hint of berry and heavy cream.
Appearance: Almost opaque black with a thick, dark brown head.
Taste: Medium sweetness with a hint of bitterness and slight saltiness.
Palate: Full bodied, creamy texture, average carbonation, long finish.
Overall: Not an unpleasant beer, but not so overwhelming that Im blown away. The blueberries are subtle at best, which is a bit disappointing, as Id like them more present. As it is, its a very drinkable beer, but nothing to wow or rave about.

12oz bottle. Very dark pour, thick and syrupy. Slight brown head, thin and sparse. Very little lacing. Aroma is malty with hints of blueberry, but nothing too fruity. Flavor has notes of chocolate, blueberry, and malts. Not very heavy, very easy to drink.

Deep brown color with a thick layer of dark tan foamy head.  Big spotty lacing left all around.

Aroma has a nice sweet blueberry element that comes through quite strongly.  The flavor is very similar and has some gentle bitterness in the finish.

Mouthfeel is a bit thin but not too bad.  Drinkability is excellent - no one aspect is too overwhelming.

Would definitely drink this again.
Bottle, pours dark with a creamy head, aroma of coffee, blueberry and cardamom, chocolate and dough, taste follows the nose, solid and interesting.

355 ml bottle. Black body with a small, dense brown head. Lovely aroma of dark malt, coffee and blueberry. Flavor is like aroma, sweet, light roasted dark malt, coffee, bitter and mild but distinct blueberry. Extremely nice, love it.
Bottle purchased from Tiffanys in Kalamazoo, Mich.  A solid cream stout, with tastes predominantly of dark malt and blueberries.  Definitely an interesting brew.  Nice work.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2014 I spoke too soon...This is the last of the stout series I had yet to try.  I thought Too Cream Stout was good, but this is phenomenal!  Jet black, orange-tan head.  Robust, roasted coffee and dark chocolate with a whisp of fresh blueberries.  Flavor is brief blueberry that explodes into roasted coffee, patent malt, toffee.  Brief end of blueberry/fruitiness and finishes deep roast, malt bitterness.  Carbonation that bounces flavor off the taste buds.  This is not a fruit beer!  However, the blueberry lends a complexity and finish like no other.  Absolute mastery!  If you havent tried the stout line from Dark Horse - go out and try them!  But save this one for last!  Stout that is extremely and dangerously drinkable.  Re-rate: multiple vintages.  This beer can be great or sub-par.  Guessing has to do more with blueberry harvest than anything else.  Some have blueberry flavor spot on, other gritty, dirty.  Average vintage reality rate -0.6

Bottle.Pours black with a beige head.Aroma of blueberries, roasted malt, coffee, hay, caramel and burnt notes.Flavor is sweet caramel blueberry with some roasted and coffee notes.Medium to full body,average carbonation.Very nice blueberry stout.

Pours black with a tan head. The aroma has a tun of blueberry. Chocolate, coffee, cream, and spice. The flavor is bursting with blueberries, and chocolate. Its like a chocolate covered blueberry. Great fruit beer.

Black of color with a small brown head. An aroma of roasted malt, liqurice, spice, dark fruits, sweets and weak chocolate. A flavor of spice, dark fruits, weak liqurice and weak bitterness in the finish.

G: Poured into a 16-ounce pint glass with the Two Brothers Heavy Handed IPA logo on it.

A: Pours a very dark, rich brown with a mocha-colored head. The head is a little light, perhaps a bit less than a finger with a decent amount of carbonation visible on top. 

S: Dark malt up front, soon overpowered by the glow of blueberries. A slight hint of alcohol. 

T: Very intriguing. Blueberries up front, fading into darker malts and a decent amount of bitterness. Hints of unrefined cocoa. A decent amount of coffee in the finish. I was worried about blueberry overkill, but that was definitely unfounded. 

M: Creamy with a lasting carbonation. Leaves the palate slightly dry. 

D: Quite drinkable. I was a little bit skeptical of this one and wasnt quite willing to go after the 4-pack, but was lucky enough to see a single of this. This will definitely be a yearly purchase.

Huge thanks to Womencantsail for nailing one of my longest wants as an extra in our trade!

Nose is light blueberries with a hint of chocolate truffles.  Not as robust as Id like, but good.  Taste is a bit oatmeal stout-like, which is pretty cool, and there are definitely subtle whispers of blueberry around the edges.  I am curious what this beer tastes like fresh; my bottle is presumably from last winter.  Its a darn good beer with the year of age on it, but I really wanna see something out of it this year.

12 oz. bottle from International Beverage in Grand Rapids, MI.  Pours black with a quickly fading, thin brown head.  Aroma of dark chocolate and blueberry pie filling.  The flavor is mostly dark chocolate, espresso, and smoke but the there is a very nice and welcome blueberry component in the background.  Exceeded my expectations, this is quite excellent.

12 oz bottle acquired via trade. Dark brown pour with a tan head and some sticky lacing. Smells of chocolate, coffee and blueberries. Tastes of roast, chocolate, coffee, nice light kick of blueberries on the finish. Might have wished for a little more berry flavor, but it was still a nicely accented brew.

Poured dark brown with a fleeting tan head.  There was a ridiculous amount of yeast sediment in my glass including large unappealing chunks.  Blueberry, chocolate, and coffee aromas with a slight hint of alcohol.  The blueberry aroma was strong at first then faded.  Roasted malt and coffee flavors with a slight hint of blueberries.  Watery mouthfeel with very little carbonation.  The aroma was nice, but the appearance and watery mouthfeel led me to give this beer low marks.  It did not taste bad but I couldnt get past all of the sediment and ended up dumping this one down the drain.

Scored as a bonus in a trade.  12oz bottle pours a watery, opaque black with one ring of beige head.  Nose has plenty of berry, a touch malty, a touch of grain.  Smells like blueberry pancakes.  In that way the nose is really nice, albeit one dimensional.  Flavor is sweet, chocolate, malty, dark toasted bread, berry, a little candy.  Has a very strong flavor of fresh blueberry.  Nice, toasty, dry finish.  I like this, but its one dimensional.

This will be interesting. Black with a small bubbly dark brown cap and some ropy lacing. Huuuuuge blueberry aroma with a hint of chocolate, the blueberry aroma is so damn similar to Hubba Bubba blueberry gum - I highly doubt this is even sold anymore but the last time I had it it was at the park across from my cuzs house on the east side - Im pretty sure I had to suffer though that gum getting stuck in his ass just so I could eat some.. ahh.. those were the times! Seems like there may be a hint of smoke but just a hint. The blueberry smell is just a killer for everything else but some how its working. Found something else but ... ah screw it. WOW! What the f is this? Cool. Very cool flavour - blueberries mixed in to perfection with the chocolate and the mild roasted malts, nuttiness, hahahahahah! fucking Steel Panther - Turn Out the Lights is hilarious! Faint hops and perfect mild bitterness compliment this treat. Fine carbonation, beyond medium bodied, almost has that coffee aftertaste but wheres the coffee? This was a damn fine brew. Great aftertaste goes nicely with the dry mouth feel.

Brew I chose at Beer Geeks in Highland, IN after many samples.  Aroma is blueberry, hershey chocolate.  Brew poured black with 2 finger tan head that dissipates to thin ring.  Medium body, dark, dry, and sweet, light blue berry.  Interesting and never had a sweet stout.  Will have again..

Thanks to Exiled for sharing this bottle.

The beer pours a very dark brown to black color with a tan head. The aroma is roasted malt with a touch of blueberries. There is not as much fruit in the aroma as I expected. The flavor is different, as the fruit is much more apparent. I get a lot of blueberry character as well as some roasted malt and a touch of smoke. The beer has a slight medicinal tastes, but it works OK in this beer. There is a strong, lingering blueberry aftertaste. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

Bottled
Opaque dark brown color, decent brown head. Coffee, chocolate, wood and hints of blueberry in the nose. Very full bodied for this abv. Foamy mouthfeel. Coffeish, roasted malty flavor with some blueberry notes. Nice "light beer", blueberry works reasonably well, base stout here is excellent.

Bottled. Black colour, brown small head. Aroma is caramel, mild roast as well as blueberries and some mild toffee. Flavour is quite similar with also a quite junipery and spicy touch to it. Big time roasted and ashy finish. Pleasant and very fullbodied for being only 4.5 %.
UPDATED: JUN 3, 2014 Aroma: roasted malts, caramel, spices and berries. Taste of chocolate, malts, berries (blueberries), caramel and a bit of smoke. Enjoyed !
355 ml bottle from Voldby. Black with medium lasting light brown head. Flavour is roasted malt, blueberry, fruit, sweet, chocolate and bitter.

Nice black appearence and a creamy dark brown head. Aroma has lots of roast, fine sweetness, raw malt, little blueberry. Taste has a nice roasted side, some nice sweetness, latte-ish coffee, no blueberry is present. At 4,5%, this is a taste bomb!!!

Bottle. Brown/black colour with a small brown head. Aroma is fairly big on malt with some roasted notes, liquorice and blueberry-like sweetness. Also some funny hints of raw, unprocessed malts. Taste is roasted and sweet with some of the blueberry-like sensations with some faint port wine and a little chocolate.
Almost black. Has a light brown head, moderate duration. Aroma of cinnamon, pepper, medicine. Flavor is heavy sweet. Creamy texture.
Draft. Pours black, with a persistent tan skim. Nose is jasmine, berries, very delicate, mildly spicy. Flavours of blueberry, mild choco-roast, chinese 5-spice. Tres cool.

12oz bottle. Pours a black body with a finger-width, dark brown, creamy and frothy head that dissipates quickly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is nice. Roasty with some sweeter dark chocolates and a pleasant blueberry. Not overpowering at all. A light caramel with a touch of peat and burnt malt. Flavor is very nice as well. Roasty with a light sweetness and rich chocolates and caramels. A light blueberry stays in the background with a touch of acidity from the berries. A much more distinct peat with a hint of tobacco smoke. Finishes dry and roasty with a bit of a spice and a light sweetness. Lengthy aftertaste following a medium body and moderately fizzy carbonation that works well with this. Overall, I was very impressed with this one. Lots of roasty, chocolate flavor with the blueberries playing more of a subtle role. I really like the peaty aspect of this too. Great beer.

From Voldby, DK.
Bottled, 200710.
Black with beige head. Aroma of roasted malt and fruit. Flavor is with blueberries and notes of spices and chocolate.

Pours jet black, opaque with a medium mocha head.  Fades to a small amount of a fine lacing.  The nose explodes with the smell of wild blueberries.  Hints of chocolate and roasty aromas present as well.  The taste is fantastic, not as much blueberry as youd expect from the aroma, well-integrated with the malty richness, hint of sweet, no real bittering to speak of.  Nice finish with some lingering blueberry notes and roastiness.  Solid, interesting, tasty fruit beer.

Bottle. Pours an almost opague black color, with just the slightest hint of brown in the bottom of the glass. The head is frothy and tan/brown. The aroma is of sweet blueberries along with roasted malt and some chocolate, Flavor is at first of sweet and fruity blueberries on the tip of your tounge. But fades into a regular stout with roasted malt, coffee, chocolate and even some caramel. I also get a slight amount of ginger when the beer first hits your toung. The body is medium with a creamy mouthfeel. Overall a really good and interesting sweet stout!

amazing beer: sweet, fruity, blueberry, dark roasty malts, smooth with piney hops. I envisioned making something like this last summer... and failed miserably, making me appreciate the artistry of a delicious fruit stout all the more.

Dark thick pour as always. Love this beer. Aroma is sweet and roasty with the blueberry actually noticeable. Overall a solid stout with sweet blueberry, almost with hints of pie and chocolate but not overly sweet. Nice level of roast, really nice to drink.

Bottle.  Aroma is roasted malts and, surprise, blueberries.  Notes of dark chocolate and a hint vanilla come out as it warms.  Palate is awesome, smooth, creamy, and strong.  A bit of coffee comes out in the flavor and it finishes dry leaving a blueberry/dark chocolate after taste.  Pretty damn good.  Head retention is this beers only flaw.

Ah glorious. Going into this one I was expecting a disaster. A blueberry stout either lacks the blueberry and is a terrible stout because it was attempted, or is way too much blueberry and no stout. Well let me tell you this is the perfect combination. Strong blueberry aroma with some chocolate and coffee in the background. Medium sweetness with light bitterness. Black with no head and brown foam. Creamy full mouth feel.

A: The beer is nearly black in color with a small-ish tan head on top.

S: Tons of sweet blueberries in the nose. A bit sugary and overly sweet like blueberry pie, but still pleasant. The coffee and roasted notes keep things from becoming cloying.

T: The blueberry flavor is certainly there and is much the way you would expect from the nose. The coffee, roast, and bitter chocolate are more noticeable here and provide a bit more balance.

M: Medium body with a fairly high level of carbonation for the style, but seems to work for this beer.

D: One of those different/interesting beers that actually was quite good. I look forward to having another one of these.
Bottle thanks to Secret Santa! Pours black with tan head. Nose is blueberry pancakes. Taste is fresh blueberries, lightly toasted malts and maple. Some chocolate undertones.

Bottle. Frothy lightbrown good mostly deminishing head. Black colour. Heavy malty and moderate hoppy aroma. Vanilla more present than blueberry. Moderate bitter nice flavor. Average moderate bitter fniish. Creamy palate. Nice stout.

Bottle. Pours a pitch black beer with a weak lightbrown head. The aroma is roasted, coffee, licorice, cold coffee and blueberries. The flavor is roasted, coffee, cold coffee and licorice. The palate is roasted. Overall a very balanced and good beer.

Bottle. Pours black with a brown head. Lots of dark malt in aroma. Notes of vanilla and wood. The taste is quite malty aswell, lots of coffee and some dark chocolate in the aftertaste. The blueberrys are there in the background all the time. The end is dry with licorice notes. Interesting stout!

12 fl oz bottle brought home from Kihoskh, København. Pours an opaque black body with a finger of dense brown foam on top.  Jammy blueberry aroma, a chocolate scent and notes of cookies and fruit drops. The blueberry flavor  blend well with the light sweet, toasted dark malts. Very mildly hopped, but a fine malt bitterness and notes of mild roastedness and dark chocolate is balancing the sweetness. Creamy mouthfeel. Healthy body. Chocolate and blueberries linger in the end.  Delicate, balanced and easy drinkable.

On draft at Bridgids.

Pours pitch black and completely opaque with a frothy 2.5 finger dark mocha color that has excellent retention, only slowly fading into a lastig cap. Streaks of lacing left behind.

Roasted dark malt aroma with lots of chocolate malt, oatmeal, toffee, burnt toast and a subtle dark fruit presence. The dark berry presence is well integrated, balancng out the deep roasty notes.

Full bodied with a nice creamy texture that adds fullness and complexity. Verydry and roasty with hits of bittersweet dark chocolate, coffee bean and burnt toast hut this is balanced out by subtle dry spic and swee dark fruit. The bluberry presence is evident but not verly sweet balancing outthe roasted malt notes very well. Slight alcohol warmth onthe finish. Pretty drinkable for how heavy it is.

Pours a pitch black and nearly opaque with a small, dark tan colored head of foam that slowly settles to a thin film that leaves tiny rings of lace behind on the glass. The aroma shows notes of dark cocoa, roasted coffee, and fresh blueberries that are ready for muffins. I would love to wake up to this smell every morning. The blueberries are nice and fresh, and not fake like other beers. The flavor follows with more dark dark cocoa and roasted barley up front and then the sweet blueberries and a touch of cream. The mouthfeel is medium to full bodied and very smooth with balanced carbonation leading into a lingering finish of blueberries and cocoa. This is a tasty stout, and a great fruit beer.
Bottle. Nice head with short duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are roast malt, blueberry, chocolate and notes of coffee.

(bottle - 12 oz) Dark black pour with tan foam. Aroma is loaded with peppery and spicy blueberry notes sitting on top of a lightly roasted base. Flavor has a very mild blueberry hint, definitely not as much as the aroma would lead you to believe is coming. The roasted notes from the stout blend with the blueberries and really bring out the natural tartness of them, rather than the sweet extract taste. Really nicely done.

Location: Bottle at Max and Andys Fantasy Tasting, 5/1/10


Aroma: Strong chocolate, booze, and roasted malts notes accompany the blueberry

Appearance: A dark brown-black pour with a creamy brown head

Flavor: The taste is quite strong, big malty flavors, some fruity notes, and some dry flavors

Palate: This is a full bodied brew with a a nice dry feel to it, and a boozy backbone

Overall Impression: 
This one tastes like a good dry stout combined with a nice blueberry flavor.  I thought that it worked quite well, and I enjoyed drinking it.  Good stuff.

Thanks to CanIHave4Beers.  Thanks, Andy.  Damn, I love this beer!  Pours near black with a mocha head.  I swear theres a bluish-purple tint to the head.  Nose is big floral blueberry, but backed with a ton of roasted malt and some dark chocolate notes.  This is really balanced for a beer with such a strong ingredient.  Great balance of fruit and roast.  Light but lively palate. Lovely.

Appearance: Nice murky brown black body with 1 finger brown crown that rapidly dissipates and leaves a sole ring of lace.

Smell: Oh mama I found da blueberries! Also roast malts and perhaps coffee notes.

Taste: Roast malt and blueberries up front. Followed by a bitterness and hint of coffee. A bit disjointed but not bad.

Mouthfeel: A touch thin but thats what I expected with the use of fresh fruit.

Drinkability: Thin, low abv, easy session stout.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 06-25-2009

Bottle. Pours super dark and thick with reasonably substantial head. smell is of chocolate, coffee, molasses, with fresh blueberry notes. Flavor is of the same with the blueberry flavor hitting you at the very end. This was a very well balanced sweet stout with a very unique addition.

Pours thick as motor oil...solid black with thick brown head.  Complex aroma...peppery, black licorice & blueberry.  Great taste and like the aroma, very complex.  Chocolate malt dominates.  Notes of roasted malt, pepper, coffee, black licorice and of course, blueberry.  The blueberry is fresh tasting, not artificial.  One of the most unique beers Ive ever had.  To sum up the taste in five words...Blueberries covered in dark chocolate.  It is a tad cloying...very sweet and rich, but a great treat.  Cant believe it has such a low ABV.

Black pour with a brown head.  Aroma was a nice combination of blueberries, cocoa, roasted malt and chocolate as was the flavor. I was hesitant to try this and glad I talked myself into it. It left a nice cocoa nib aftertaste in my mouth. Overall-Tasty.

12oz bottle in a 4-pack from a tiny store in Quincy, IL (quite a rare find!).  Pours opaque black with a quickly-thinning deep brown head.  Interesting pungent aroma of dark chocolate, smoke, and dark-toasted blueberry waffles.  Flavor gets a little crazy, with a heavy-handed layer of salt and pepper (I have no idea how else to explain it) that fades into blueberry, smoky (burnt?) malts, and little else.  Great to smell, but hard to drink with a sort of acrid finish.  Entirely possible that this is an old, old bottle since it was discovered in BFE (I can say that, I grew up there!) next to Coors Light and Bud Light Lime cases.

Bottle, bought @ Ølbutikken, Cph.
Very dark brown, almost black. Fine medium frothy beige head. Fair duration. Lovely aroma, lots of blueberries, light peppery, roasted malts and lots of dark chocolate. A fruity, wine-like viniousness. Medium carbonation, light creamy with a good dryness. Flavour is nicely roasted, lots of milky dark chocolate. Some light fruitiness with a light berry touch. Really impressive for only 4,5 %. Wonderful elegance.

Bottle thanks to grownfool.  Pretty dark milk chocolate foam over a dark brown body.  Chocolate and light roast aromas mix well with blueberry and some bitter astringent malt and coffee.  Taste is roast with blueberry never making it to the foreground, very much like chocolate covered blueberries.

I think this bottle was old so Im throwing a caution flag on this one.  Standard stout limited brown lace.  This was almost without blueberry notes to me at all.  A solid stout but I dont see what everyone is raving about.  Super dark and malty, but nothing exciting happening on the palate.
Pours black with a light brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, vanilla, oak, blueberries, coffee and chocolate. Flavour is roasted malt, vanilla, oak, chocolate and coffee.

Bottle via trade from kmurray8621 on BA.

Pours nearly black with a small tan head that leaves a ring.

Aroma is lots of blueberry.  Some slight roasted malt is all else I really get.

Flavor is roasted malt, coffee, blueberry, spice (coriander?), and maybe a little wildness.  Some chocolate notes in there as well.

Once again for this series, its just a little bit thin, but otherwise smooth and well-carbonated.

Pretty good overall.  Not awesome, but good.  Drinkability is high.

Bottle @ Odense Tasting, April 2010. Pours pitch black with a small beige head and lacings. Nose is roast, chocolate and blueberries. Very smooth and roasted flavor with cold coffee, chocolate and again hints of blueberries. Dry roasted and ashy end.

Small bottle. Have to start out with this,  Im not a fruit beer fan. This is the best one Ive had. Pours a dark brown with a nice dark chocolate head. Smells exactly like slightly alcohol infused blueberry pancakes. Taste has a good blueberry flavor, not overwhelming, caramel, but lacks a bit on the "stoutness" of the beer. Finishes a little sour and dry.

Tres (of four) purchased at Tiffanys in Kalamazoo last summer.  Aroma reminds me of the Harry and David blueberry chocolate candies:  very rich in the sweet blueberry and some chocolate malt scent behind it.  I figure this is probably a good year+ old, and it kind of shows.  Its scent is strong, but the flavor is somewhat bittering and chalky.  Regardless, it held up well enough that I would definitely give this another day in court.
Awesome aroma of blueberries, roasted coffee... almost cookie like. Light sweetness with hints of berry tartness and roasted barley. Unique concept pulled off well.

Appearance:  Pours a dark brown with a creamy cap of froth.

Aroma:  Dark chocolate, milk chocolate, chocolate covered blueberries and slight roasted coffee.

Taste:  Roasted coffee, dark chocolate, tangy blueberry. Leaves a acidic coffee aftertaste.

Mouthfeel: Fizzy and dry.

Overall:  Who would have thought coffee with blueberry notes would work. It did for me.
Bottle. Dark pour with brown head. Aroma is of blueberry jam, and dark malts, flavor isnt overly sweet but has enough fruit essence. Nice brew.

Dark beer with a very dark brown head.  This beer has great aroma of blueberries, but it does not follow through in the taste.  I think this is a great thing, the stout has a hint of blueberry taste.  It is there to be certain, but the blueberry flavor does not overpower the stout and is more prominent in the aroma than on the palate.

12oz bottle courtesy of badnewsbears. thanks, tyler! pours a silky black with a creamy, dark brown head and a tight ring of lace. aroma is wonderfully unique with huge notes of fresh blueberries backed by roasted malts, dark chocolate, earth, and a bit of peat with hints of coffee and cinnamon oatmeal. flavor is great as well, never tasted anything like it really. honestly tastes like blueberry spiked coffee with notes of dark chocolate, roast, and dry barley with a hint of ash. palate is medium bodied with solid carbonation and a dry, blueberry/coffee finish. overall, one of the most unique fruity stouts ive tasted. damn nice beer.

Fløska. Útsjónd: Black, dark brown hue, light brown head. Nøs: Pleasant blueberry aroma with dark fruits, roasted malt and chocolate. Smakkur: Roasted malt, blueberries, coffee and chocolateLong lasting finish of roasted malt, blueberries and chocolate.

Pours black with a dark brown head that dissipates.  Aroma is chocolate, coffee, caramel and toffee...where is the blueberry??  Flavor is slightly sweet and the palate is spicy, smooth but a little thin.  Solid beer.
Pours black with little head. Aroma of roasted malts, brown sugar, blueberries and coffee. Taste is same as aroma with a hint of blueberry with a slight bitter to finish. Nice stout.

dark brown,almost black, small brown head.
strong aroma of blueberries, hints of a stout beneath the blueberries.
flaovr is sweet bliueberries, roasted grains. fruity bitterness, brown sugar, caramel, malty sweet.

Pours a deep ink w/ a towering peaty creamy head, aroma is rich with blueberries and cream, some toasted malt, flavor matches aroma with a smooth and creamy mouthfeel and a slight dry fruit bitterness at finish, very tasty and unique brew, a must try

Bottle courtesy of Howardf from TBS....thanks!  Opaque dark brown with a dark long-lasting head.  Definite blueberries in the scent, almost overwhelming.  Not as much in the taste though, subtle berries.  Almost no sweetness in it, very dry and bitter.  I enjoyed it, it was certainly something different.

Dark brown, almost black with a real thin chocolate-milk colored head. On the nose, a blend of blueberry and coffee, chocolate. It smells lovely, kind of like blueberry oatmeal. The taste is... interesting.  Id best-describe it as a stout with a coffee-finish, that also has a note of chocolate-covered blueberry to it. The initial mouthfeel is a bit dissonant, but it settles into a smooth finish. An intriguing change of pace.

Pours black with a light tan head. Aroma is of coffee and blueberries. Has flavors of chocolate, coffee and blueberries.  However the balance between the blueberries and the roasted flavors of the malts is somewhat off.

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2010 Pours an opaque black, with a creamy tan head.  Smells like blueberries, with some sweetness and subtle roasty coffee, as well as some lactic sourness.  Taste is dominated by roasted malt, with a bitter finish.  Good palate, coats the mouth nicely.

Bottle.  Pours a heavy looking, near-black color with a thin brown head.  Smokey aroma with a sweet berry background.  Dominant roasted flavor with dark chocolate and a bittersweet blueberry finish.  Lighter in body than it appears.  A refreshingly pleasant fruity stout that isnt overly sweet or tangy.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2010 Pours pitch black producing a large creamy beige head that retains throughout. The smell is of roasted malts with a subtleness of fruit squeezing out. I am not fond of fruit being introduced to stouts so I worry about the impact of the impending blueberry. The flavor starts with a dark coffee profile that eventually is washed out by a funky berry fruit backbone. To my expectations, the fruit completely throws off my palate. The blend of blueberry with subdued dark malt characteristics is both muddled and unappealing. The body offers a thick creamy body with a mid to low amount of bitterness. I struggled to finish this beer, as it fell way flat on flavor.
Bottle shared by Plovmand, Thanks. Black body with a small brown head. Aroma is Chocolate, caramel and notes of berries. Flavor is chocolate, roasted malt and berries.

Thick opaque black pour with a dark tan head.   Roasted malt and aroma with coffee.  Deep clean blueberry aroma.  Very dry bitter roast aroma.  Chocolate notes with nice dry blueberry flavor throughout.  Very light and refreshing.

Pours black and thick with a huge tan head. The aroma is full of sweet blueberries, roast, anise, and grain. The flavor is similar, roasty and blueberry filled, with a decent amount of bitterness to balance the sweetness. Somewhat dry finish, with a weird grainy, earthy aftertaste. Lots of flavor for such a low abv, but not as enjoyable as I had hoped.

Flaske: Kulsort øl med et fint skumhoved. Duft af mørk malt og en anelse blåbær. Ekstrem mørk og frugtmaltet i smagen med en stor brændthed og en fin bitterhed. Smager af langt flere procent end den er. Blåbærrene er en sidste eftertanke i denne fantastiske øl der vinder og vinder.

Another good Stout from Dark Horse.  Pours black with the dominate aroma of surprise...blueberries.  Flavor of blueberries, chocolate, roasted malt.  A very good fruit stout though.  I kind of thought it would be stronger than 4.5%

Thanks to Plovmand and Hallinghansen. Black with a small but lasting brown head. Aroma of licorice, brown sugar, caramel and a hint of berries. Sweet and full bodied roasted flavour with a burnt finish

Bottle. Pitch black with a creamy tan head. The aroma is lihgt berries, roasted malt and coffee. The flavour is mainly roasted with light chocolate notes and light berries. Quite full flavoured for the light alcohol.

12 ounce bottle. Served in a snifter, the beer pours black with about an inch frothy brown head. Head retention and lacing are both good. The aroma is very nice, it smells like roasted malt, chocolate, coffee and blueberries. None of the aromas overpower the other, which is nice. The taste is the same as the aroma, the roasted malt, coffee, chocolate and blueberry flavors all mesh well together and none of them are overpowering. Mouthfeel/body is medium/full, its rich, creamy and coating and also has good carbonation. The drinkability is pretty good, and at only 4.5% ABV its also quite sessionable. This is a very good fruit stout, and I would definitely buy this again the next time I see it.

Dark black in color. Brown head that gathers to the sides. Aromas of chocolate, roasted malt, and light blueberries and alcohol as it is warms. Smooth and slick, rolls across the tongue with a little carbonation tickle. Sweet with blueberries upfront, finishes with a light roasted bitterness and tart blueberries. One of the most satisfying stouts. The blueberries are subtle and such a nice touch.
caramel, chocolate, roasty, floral, licorice, black, brown foam, medium sweetness, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish,

Ive thoroughly enjoyed the Dark Horse stout series.  And Ive never had any desire to drink a blueberry stout, but this one is actually pretty damn good.  Looks great, dark black with a thick dark brown head.  Aroma is serious blueberry.  Smells like blueberry pancakes.  Im not a blueberry fan, but a good aroma considering what they are going for.  Flavor contains less blueberry than the aroma, but its still in there.  There are some great heavy roasted malts and a nice bitterness.  A fine stout that makes use of a blueberry accent.  Well done.
Bottle at home - shared with Mette. Pitch black - brown edges. Cocoa, chocolate, blueberries, lactose, fruity, dry lactose, burned, licorice, light sharpness, roasted. Very smooth - fullbodied.

Bottle. High creamy thick long lasting and good looking brown head. Absolutely black body. Coffee choccolate aroma with blueberries in the background. Roasted malt and relatively bitter flavor with choccolate and blueberries. Creamy palate. Low carbonation. Short aftertaste. I guess a bit more alcohol would had given the beer a  more solid body.

Bottle at home.
Pitch black coloured with a medium sized fast disappearing brown head.
Roasted aroma of blueberries with notes of chocolate.
Roasted flavour of berries and chocolate with notes of coffee and dish washer.
Light roasted finish.

Bottle.

Very dark brown with a minimal reddish brown head that quickly fades away.

The aroma is quite interesting with a mix of hard roasted malts, coffee and sweet blueberries. Notes of tobacco.

The flavor has some malty sweetness to it and quite a lot of roasted coffee bitterness. The blueberries are more muted than in the nose. Ends very dry with notes of sweet licorice, blueberries and roasted malts.

Medium body with rather aggressive and sharp carbonation.

Decent, not more. The blueberries are more fun an interesting than good. But it sure packs a lot of flavors for such a low ABV beer.

Pours dark with a nice brown foamy head to it that rapidly disappears but not completely. Aroma is of roasted malts, coffee, and a hint of blueberry. Full bodied. Huge on taste despite the ABV. Very smooth and drinkable. Makes a great session beer for a full bodied stout. Tastes of coffee and roasted malts, a very small hint of chocolate and cream all balanced with the tartness of the hint of blueberry with a smooth dry finish.

12oz. Bottle:  Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, blueberry, and a hint of coffee.  Poured pitch black in color with a small to medium-sized, creamy, dense, brown head that greatly diminished but lasted throughout.  Opaque.  Sparkling.  Flavor is lightly sweet and light to medium bitter.  Tastes of blueberry, roasted malt, chocolate, and a hint of cream.  Medium to full body.  Average texture.  Soft to average carbonation.  Roasted malt, blueberry and slight tar finish is a tad chalky.

Dark brown/ black pour with tan head that settles.  Aroma of roast, smoke, blueberries, some chocolate, some meat.  Flavor is meaty with blueberries.  Kind of a weird combo that is solved with some smoke, some roast, some chocolate. The blueberry and roast meld in the finish. Full mouthfeel.  I dont really dig blueberries that much, so thats putting a damper on my enjoyment of this beer.

A - Pours a dark, dark brown that just begs you to get lost inside. Mocha colored head that dissipates very quickly.

S - Blueberry(who wouldve figured) and roasted malt. Fantastic, I wish they made a candle that smelled like this.

T - The blueberry is much more subtle in the taste as opposed to the smell. Big roasty flavors. Some coffee. Big roast. Very good.

M - A little thin. Not bad but not great. At 4.5% what do you expect though.

D - I find this to be very drinkable. Great flavor and only 4.5 ABV. If I was the type to drink one beer all night I could do this one easily.

blueberry on the nose. very dark pour, with a beige head just how i like it. head dissipates quickly, but i really thought this was a pretty beer. dark horse does a great job. blueberry is present in the taste, but not overwhelming, and overall the beer is not too sweet, which i feared would be the case. only 4.5%abv, i think an imperial version of this would be nice.

bottle thanks to Keir, pours black with a medium dark tan head.  Aroma is black patent malt, faint blueberry, and some coffee.  Chocolate malt and a light blueberry finish with light flavors of coffee.  Not bad.
Soda an floral blueberry blossome nose. Full boddied head settles quickly a little slick. Dry but smooth with dark chocolate and skins.

bottle, from trade with barleypops. Ok aroma, bittersweet, roasted malts, chocolate, coffee with  blueberry jelly. Dark brownish black color, small head, no lace. Bitter sweet flavor, Lite body, smooth oily creamy mouthfeel, Bitter sweet dry finish. Good, but nothing exciting, very drinkable,
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: Pour is nearly black.  The beer has a thin tan head at first, but swirl it around a bit and it thickens considerably with tons of lacing.  You can definitely pick up the blueberry in the nose, along with licorice and alcohol.  The roasted malt character is lost a bit in the aroma and the taste, which is again licorice and blueberry, as well as  some chocolate and coffee.  I think this beer has an excellent kind of silky mouthfeel to it.  The finish is slightly bitter dark chocolate.

Bottle. These guys need to update this label a little... Pours murky thick black, with minimal head formation. Had to pour rather vigorously for anything to show up. Still, though, the little head thats there is dark and pretty. Nose is great - chocolate covered blueberries and a little coffee. Calling this a dry stout is accurate - the sweetness is quite low. Roasted barley directs the flavor, and theres a nice little blueberry undercurrent. Minimal hopping - some bitterness is present, but its from the roasted malt, not hops. This is a very nice stout, and certainly an idea Ive never come across before. I feel it might be a little bit too dry - maybe a tad more sweetness would add to the blueberry flavor. An enjoyable brew, though.

A: Pours deep dark black with a huge 3 finger espresso head. The head died down but hung around nicely. There was some bubbles and nice lacing for a stout.

S: Soo very nice. Nice milk chocolate mixed with the aroma of blueberries. Coffee undertones and a hint of booze. Lovely.

T: One great stout man. Coffee and Chocolate dominate. There is a hint of blueberry but I wish there was more, the blueberry taste is too faint.

M: Medium bodied but extra creamy.

From coyotehunter via trade.  An attractive, super-dark brown pour with a one-finger tall brown head.  The aroma was blueberry (sometimes it smelled like real blueberries, sometime it smelled like Boo-Berry cereal) along with lots of coffee.  The flavor was more of the blueberry mash-up, coffee and some chocolate.  Mouthfeel was almost medium in body.  No alcohol noticed.  OK.  Not something Id fall back on, but worth a try.

12 oz bottle-pours a disappearing brown head and black color.  Aroma is rich dark malt-licorice, earthy.  Taste is rich dark malt/oat-licorice/chocolate, earthy hops.  I dont get blueberry but stevo says he does.  Thanks stevo for sharing.

Bottle shared by Dickinsonbeer at his home brew day: Opaque black with a deep brown head. Thick dry chewy black malt aroma- mild chocolate with a licorice spiciness and very subtle blueberry- its presence is just right. Silky/fluffy feel on the palate. The flavor has dry rounded roast. Firm black malt body with subtle licorice and a soft natural blueberry presence. Touch of coffee roast. This brewer is one of the best when it comes to stouts!

Trade with sprinkle...June 2008... bottle consumed 6-7-2009....used motor oil in color with a rich brown head....blueberries and coffee are an interesting blend in a beer.....mongo white floaties....major roasted malt in aroma and taste....its thick and luscious...not too many dimensions...flavors are milk stout-ish...coffee, blueberries, roasted malts, and brown sugar....tasty and hearty....couldnt drink a ton of it, but yum yum yum....roasted toasted blueberry finish

( 12oz bottle thanks to bobby91w and sprinkle) Pours a pitch black color that is somewhat viscous, oily, nice 1 finger head but recedes as quickly as soda head. No real lacing on the glass to speak of either, but looks nice for the style. The smell is a nice complex mixture of coffee, dark chocolate, and blueberries, but the blueberries stand out just a LITTLE bit too much. Reminiscent of blueberry muffins, almost buttery even. Taste starts off coating the tongue with dark chocolate, perhaps some burnt toast! Blueberries assault the middle of your tongue. There is a little more bitterness than I like in stouts here, maybe from some hops? Not sure really. Perhaps its too much cocoa flavor for me; like unsweetened chocolate. There is a lot going on here really. The finish lingers with the bitterness a bit. The mixture of stout and blueberries is a pretty ingenious combination and its well done here. So thick and perfect, really nice carbonation, thick and viscous, needs to be creamier though and a little slicker/oily to be perfect.

Pours black and thick, blueberry definately somewhat natural aroma, and oily roast aroma.  Above avrage mouthfeel, almost no head, certainly no lace.  A decent dry stout, assisted by some blueberries.

12 ounce bottle shared at Dickinsonbeers brewing fest.  Very dark black with brown head.  Rich chocolate spicy fruity blueberry aroma.  Rich roasted coffee chocolate mild fruity blueberry and strong, call me crazy, anise spice or licorice.  Blueberry is artfully subdued.  Nice texture.  Very good.

wasnt huge on this one, thick dark pour almost black maybe dark brown. tan foam. looks nice. nose was coffee, maybe some blueberries but only because i know they r there.. could easily be missed. flavor is choc and coffee not much maybe a touch of blueberry. astringent finish very dry mouthfeel
Bottle, pours black with a short tan head. Surprisingly (to me) the blueberries power their way thru the coffee and chocolate.

Courtesy of After4ever, thanks Tom. Its pitch black with a dark brown, small, creamy head. The aroma has notes of roasted malt, blueberries and candy. The sweet flavor has notes of roasted malt, licorice, blueberries, perfumed candy and in the slightly dry finish, there are hints of coffee  quite charming.
pours a dark black colour with a dark chocolate coloured head, nice blueberry aroma. Mix of coffee, chocolate and blueberry flavours.

Bottle courtesy of BMan1113VR in this years summer secret santa.  Thanks!  Pours a viscous midnight black with a dark brown head.  Just gorgeous.  One of the most beautiful looking stouts Ive come across, but the head falls off a bit too quickly for me.  
Light sweet blueberries, chocolate, and very faint hints of roast.  The body is a little thinner than its looks belie, but its not thin by any means.  Really nice mouthfeel, smooth and supple.  Chocolate, blueberry,  subdued roast character that leans more towards bitter cocoa than char.  A little like a dark chocolate truffle with blueberries in it.   Finishes with more lingering bitter dark chocolate flavor.  Outstanding.
Dark with creamy head. smells of blueberries. tastes of dark chocolate, coffee, with slight hint of blueberry and tobacco, but not overpowering

Bottle with big blueberry thanks to coyotehunter.  Pours brown-black with little fizzy head of a reddish tan color.   Nose is all roastyness blueberry aroma, and even a touch of coffee?  Maybe thats just the roasty malts though.  Theres a faint smokey quality as well.  Flavor is substantially the same, though with less emphasis on blueberry and more on coffee, bitter roastiness, burnt earth, a touch of cocoa in the middle palate, and a smooth oat-malt finish.  Really a surprisingly nice beer.  Coyotehunter may be the best trade partner in the world.  Nothing but winners so far in the this box!

I was floored to see this was less than 5%. Growler supplied by Kevin. Poured a dark brown almost black. Low carbonation but still a small tan head. Nose is huge blueberries and a fair amount of smoke. Flavor is quite roasty with lovely smokiness and some subtle chocolate and toasted malt complexity. Huge thick body I estimated this beer was 6.5% at least. What an achievement. Amazing beer.

Bottle thanks to polomagnifico!Black with a thin tan head, gone quickly. Nose is heavy roast, oat, chocolate, and very subtle blueberry. Lots ashy roast and chocolate in the flavor, stinging, syrupy presence of fruit. More blueberry in the finish than anywhere else. I like the subtle nose, but the flavor doesnt blend well and the palate makes for an overall astringent experience.

Bottle, thanks to TampaBrew for sharing.  Poured black with a thin brown head.  Aroma is chocolate malt with some blueberry notes peeking thru.  Medium bodied with soft carbonation and a slightly oily mouthfeel.  Very nice flavor, dry and roasted with a good chocolate character and actually a lot more blueberry than I expected.  Finished dry with mild bitterness.  Very good.

Better than expected! This stout poured a slick, oily black with no head. Just a few lingering tan bubbles. The aroma was made up of strong blueberry notes and chocolate. The flavor included blueberry, chocolate, and roasted malts.

12oz bottle.Pours a menacing dark brown-black with saddle-soap-colored head that leaves nice lacing throughout the inside of the glass. Aroma is bitter-roasted grain, dark chocolate, and of course, blueberries. Flavor is also bitter from the roasted grains but has little of the charcoal flavor that so many craft-brew stouts seem to aim for (and lacking this is a good thing IMO). There is some sweetness from the malt and presumably the blueberries to keep the bitterness in check. Speaking of the blueberries, I was skeptical about a blueberry stout, thinking that a judicious dose of blueberry flavor would be the only way it could work. And thats exactly what they have done here -- just enough to let you know the blueberries are there but not trying to "take over" the flavor. Any more of the blueberry flavor and I dont think this would have worked. Body is full with a thick, almost oily palate. This would have been a solid stout without the blueberries, and adding blueberry flavor could have ruined it not handled properly. Thankfully, it was handled properly.

Pours a very dark brown with a thin brown head. Aroma of blueberries and roasted malts. Suprisingly, the blueberry notes are not as evident on the palat as they are in the aroma. Coffee with a slight bluebery flavor in the background. This is good, but not quite for me.
12oz bottle into a pint glass.  The first whiff is like WHOA BLUEBERRY, but the first sip is stout notes with coffee and such.  I just didnt find it to be a great combo.
Pours deep brown with purple highlights and head. Sweet blueberry and chocolate in the nose and flavor. Creamy mouthfeel.

Courtesy of TampaBrew. Pours dark brown with dark tan head. The aroma is roasty malts, sweet malts and a truck load of blueberries. The taste is up front sweet blueberry fruitiness moving into sweet malts and highly roasted maltiness. As the experience moves to the finish the blueberry fruit fades a bit to reveal an even roastier malt layer that borders being burnt. As usual, tasty stuff from this brewery.

Thanks TampaBrew for the share.  Pours dark brown with a miniscule off-white head.  Nose is roasted malt, perfume, prickly overripe blueberries, and some coffee.  Flavor is roast, chocolate, blueberry puree, and sweet darkness.  Medium bodied with a lingering sweet finish. Interesting spin on this style.

Pours a dark black with a tiny quickly disapating tan head. Nose is blueberry preserves, caramel and toffee. Flavor fresh blueberries, blueberry pie filling, smokey malt, toast, sweet malt. Mouthfeel is full. I was expecting this to be overwhelming blueberry and was dead wrong. Excellent job!

I shared a bottle of this with BeerBaron617.  I took a whiff of it when I opened the bottle up and it smelled a lot like blueberries :)  It poured a really super dark brown/black with a brown head.  Aroma, at first was very chocolaty and very subtle on the berry...as time went on the berry became much more pronounced.  Taste, well, its very very carbonated!  Almost like a soda.  Its not really all too sweet, and certainly doesnt have that artificial blueberry flavor which is great.  With time, and as the beer warms it sort of begins to taste like a blueberry soda of some sort.  I really enjoy this stout because its not too heavy, and is really really accessible.  I honestly think I could drink this on a regular basis.

Very interesting stuff. Shared a 12 oz with MereLikesBeer. Started off just out of the fridge, with just the slightest afterthought of blueberry, but with classic stout qualities. But as it warms up, the blueberry has come out a lot stronger, and has "turned" into a fantastically complex beer. Cheers!!
Shakeyfest 09. Wow what a surprise! Nose is full of anise and fennel-not unlike Chartreuse really. Slight blueberry. Not at all sweet. Great mouthfeel, perfect thickness and carbonation.

12 oz bottle into snifter.  Aroma is great - coffee, bitter roastiness, bitter chocolate, and blueberry! Flavor is the same.  Lots of chocolate bitter and sweet. Medium to heavy bodied with medium to low carbonation.  Overall: great, well done beer.

Bottle at the RBSG09 grand tasting.   Black with a tan head.   Awesome blueberry aroma.   The flavor is a dry mix of dark chocolate and blueberries.   Medium bodied and smooth.   I like how they packed a ton of fruit flavor that perfectly compliments the chocolate without the beer being sweet and sticky.   By flavor impact, I guessed this was almost twice the strength.

RBSG09 bottle at the grand tasting. Almost black in color with some brown highlights. Tan head leaves a little lacing. Smells like fresh Maine blueberries with a whisper of cocoa. Flavor is darkest chocolate with tart blueberries and a roasted finish. Interesting taste, I like the subtlety. Nice medium body, dry on the palate.

Bottle.  Pours black with a small light tan head.  Aroma of blueberry muffins.  Also sort of smells like glue...Flavor is lightly roasted with the sweet blueberry/glue.  Interesting stout but the blueberry flavor is a bit odd to me.
7/4/7/4/14 (3.6/5)

Bottle, thanks to tjthresh. Wow. A fruit stout that isnt a worthless disaster. Remarkable accomplishment in itself. Aroma of blueberries and chocolate. Flavor nicely roasted with a hint of coffee, loads more semisweet blueberry and semisweet chocolate. Dry, blueberry finish. Great beer, great dessert, simple, smooth, deceptively decadent, and all at 4.5%.

UPDATED: AUG 10, 2016 Bottle at home ... Thanks to a trade which escapes me (but feel free to tell me it was you ) ... deep black with a thick fairly firm tan head ... soft roast malt almost coffee nose ... quite a lots of roast with a noticible blueberry presence in the linger ...
